Full Job Description

Full Job Description

Fortunesoft IT Innovations, Inc is a high end software product engineering & services company based out of Nashville, Tennessee. We are specialised in offering end to end technology solution to Fin-tech, eCommerce, Healthcare and Faith-tech companies. In addition to US, Fortunesoft has offices in Bangalore, India and Singapore.

Fortunesoft IT Innovations, Inc. is looking for Interns to work with their Sales & Marketing office at Nashville, Tennessee. Job description includes contacting prospective clients, requirement gathering, organising meeting with in-house technology team and providing technology solutions to the customers.

Opportunity

The Interns will get an immersive experience in Business development, Account management and Sales experience for high end software product engineering services.

Part Time or Full Time: Part Time during school year and additional hours possible in summer

A Day In The Life
Business development, contacting prospective clients, requirement gathering, organising meeting with in-house technology team, providing technology solutions and updating accurate contact information of customers in CRM.

Skills & Qualifications:

  • Self-starter with a commitment to professional development
  • Passion for learning and business requirement gathering
  • Experience with lead generation and developing new prospects through outreach a plus
  • Event support experience a plus
  • SalesForce or similar CRM exposure a plus
  • Preferred majors: sales, business, communication, entrepreneurial studies, marketing or an information technology/computer science field

Compensation: In addition to the hourly rates you will receive a commission on sales generated by your lead generation. You will also have an opportunity to become a team member upon successful completion of the internship and performance.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship

Pay: $15.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

  • Commission pay

Work Location:

  • One location

Work Remotely:

  • No

Full Job Description

The Research and Development department at DigiStream Investigations Inc. is looking for a curious, organized and motivated individual to join the team on a part-time basis as the R&D Intern.

DigiStream Investigations
Venture Management Specialists, Inc

Position: Research & Development Intern (paid internship)

Starting Hourly Rate: $16.00 per hour

Work Status: Part-time hours, and flexible weekly work schedule to accommodate your weekly school schedule

Office Location: West Sacramento, CA

*Great opportunity to gain work experience, and for career advancement!

Job Summary:

DigiStream Investigations is a national investigative firm with twenty affiliate offices and growing. By joining this exciting and fast-paced team, the R&D Intern will get a chance to participate in cutting-edge research projects, provide critical assistance in investigations, and learn about how technology impacts and enhances the investigative tradecraft. This individual should be currently working towards their Bachelor’s degree.

Responsibilities:

With guidance from all R&D Specialists, the R&D Intern will be expected to:

· Assist with research projects and experiments in the field

· Help extract key insights from data entry, analysis, and visualization

· Learn and utilize current R&D programs and software used for investigations

· Provide essential support and insight to R&D Specialists regarding investigations, projects, and special affiliate requests

· Assess experimental software and hardware for effectiveness and report all results to the team

· Track all completed advanced assignments in established R&D logs

· Preserve and deliver confidential evidence as requested

· Fulfill requests from department employees and affiliate offices

· Create and manage auxiliary open-source intelligence resources, such as investigative social media accounts

· Attend operations meetings to discuss ideas and project findings with the team

· Other duties as needed

Requirements:

· Strong research and writing skills

· Strong organizational and communication skills

· Working towards a degree in an applicable field such as Criminal Justice, Computer Science, Psychology, History, Political Science or Journalism

· Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

· Willingness to learn basic investigative methodology and practices

· Willingness to learn and use new software and hardware

· Ability to interpret, analyze, and distill information from databases, social media, and government/private entities

· Maintain confidentiality of subject and client information, as well as DigiStream’s investigative methods and technology

· No prior hardware/software experience is required, however a demonstrated history of successful troubleshooting is preferred

**Please provide a Resume and Cover Letter when applying for this position!

Job Types: Part-time, Internship

Pay: From $16.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule

Schedule:

  • Day shift

Education:

  • Bachelor's (Preferred)

Work Remotely:

  • No

Full Job Description

Department: Information Technology
Location: Orlando, FL
Reports to: Director of Project Management and Interns
Peers: IT Support Specialist, IT Systems Analyst
Exemption Status: Non-Exempt

Who You Are

First, you're a committed Christian who wants to use your technical skills to serve the Lord. You are also an aspiring IT technician who likes to solve problems and learn new things. You enjoy helping people use technology and you have the patience required when the solutions are hard to find. You enjoy the feeling that comes with helping people get back to work after their computer gives them trouble. You aren’t afraid to own a technology upgrade project from start to finish.

Who We Are

A group of about twenty-five Christian software and infrastructure techs, working at an aggressively growing non-profit that is helping to make the Bible available to everyone, everywhere. God has blessed us with the resources to pay for high performance team-members. You can learn more about our organization at https://www.wycliffeassociates.org/. This is the kind of place that rewards intensity, ambition, drive, and creativity.

The Job You'll Do

The infrastructure help desk intern position is a uniquely important because the person who fills this role will act as the face of IT to the rest of Wycliffe Associates. Customer service skills are equally as important as technical skills. Working with senior help desk and application support staff, this intern will be responsible for resolving simple to medium complexity issues.

What We'll Do For You

  • Enable you to serve God through your talents in fellowship with other believers
  • We’ll give you a place where you can learn about all kinds of technology that is used to keep an organization running
  • We’ll give you opportunities to grow, stretch, flex, and learn
  • Provide help desk best practices guided by seasoned professionals
  • Create an environment to learn from mentors and each other
  • Have you contribute to real-world projects with meaningful impact

Job Responsibilities And Duties

  • Responding to help desk phone calls, emails, and walk ups
  • Resolving computer and IP telephony hardware issues
  • Solving network connectivity issues
  • Resetting forgotten passwords
  • Setting up new user accounts
  • Imaging computers and servers (Windows & Linux)
  • Helping end users with common Microsoft software such as Windows and Office 365
  • Learning basic troubleshooting of some in house applications
  • Assisting with and potentially taking ownership of project work such as hardware refreshes, network upgrades, or major software rollouts

Your Skills

  • You have at least a basic understanding of common PC and network troubleshooting concepts and a desire to learn more.

*

  • You should be able to install Windows and Office on a computer from scratch

*

  • You should be able to tell what the IP address of a computer is and how the computer got it
  • You should be comfortable supporting users over the phone, email, and in person
  • Nice to have (experience):
  • Windows Server
  • Linux
  • Active Directory

Your Education & Experience

  • You are currently enrolled or recently graduated, studying either Computer Science, Information Technology, or Information Systems at an accredited college or university
  • An overall GPA of 3.0 or above
  • If you are still in school, you are or will be a Senior by Fall of 2021

Personal Qualifications

  • Have a personal relationship with Jesus Christ and live a life in full alignment with our Core Beliefs. https://wycliffeassociates.org/about/core-beliefs/
  • Should sense a call from God to ministry and have a genuine caring for people.
  • Should have personal warmth that invites confidence and possess a personal integrity that never forfeits the trust that is offered.
  • Ability to be at ease with people from diverse cultures and backgrounds.
  • Demonstration of the attitudes of a servant leader.
  • Highly self-motivated and directed.
  • Keen attention to detail.
  • Ability to communicate effectively in oral and written form.
  • Ability to work effectively with a virtual team.
  • Can keep commitments.
  • Ability and desire to learn new technologies, improve skills, and adapt to change.

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Pay: $12.00 - $20.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Professional development assistance

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:
We are sanitizing surfaces and social distancing in the office.

Education:

  • Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

  • IT Helpdesk: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location:

  • One location

Work Remotely:

  • No

position: SAP iXp Intern - IT Asset Management
description:
Full Job Description
Requisition ID: 289844
Work Area: Information Technology
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:
Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

The IT Asset Management team has an opening for an intern / work student position. As part of SAP’s IT Strategic Central Services unit, the IT Asset Mgmt team offers services that enable key stakeholders in making efficient decisions in daily business & transformation via ALM Key Service Areas: Software Portfolio Mgmt, Asset Data Management & QA, Asset Compliance Mgmt. This includes driving multiple board initiatives to transform our services to a world class IT Asset Mgmt practice. This intern/ work student position will mainly be supporting scaling PMO setup which will support the IT Asset Mgmt unit & various parallel projects driving process optimization and internal transformation initiatives.

What you’ll do:
Position Title: SAP iXp Intern - IT Asset Management
Location: Newtown Square, PA
Expected Start Date: June 2021
Contract Duration: 6 months

In this role, you’ll:
As a student, you will perform routine tasks to support the effective and efficient running of the Asset Lifecycle Management (ALM) team. This will give you the opportunity to learn and experience different roles and responsibilities within the Asset Lifecycle Management (ALM) team. Additionally, this will give you the opportunity to assist in structuring and transforming a team focusing on high performance.

Support rollout of PMO deliverables to the ITAM team and drive organizational transformational initiatives.
Support maintenance of team ITAM JAM page JIRA, ITAM wiki pages
Drive the continuous improvement of new resource onboarding packages & ITAM service catalog.
Support the execution of the ITAM skills management strategy with the development of a standard training curriculum.
Become advocate for team operating principles and procedures
Support monitoring and attainment of team goals
Support bi-weekly management reports and quarterly newsletters

Who you are:
You are a currently enrolled student at a university or a university of applied sciences:

Preferred fields of study: Computer Science, Finance or related fields
Software skills: Jira, Microsoft products (especially Excel, PowerPoint) is required, MS Teams/share point is a plus
Agile skills: Knowledge and experience in scrum and agile frameworks is nice to have
Language skills: Fluent in English is required (written and verbal) and German is a plus
Soft skills: Team player in a multi-national and multi-cultural team, an ideal candidate is organized, well-structured with high degree of passion and creativity, etc.
Others: Flourish in a work environment where flexibility is essential to adapt to changing environment

Then YOU are the right candidate for this position. We are looking forward to your application and getting to know you.

We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Full Job Description
Indiana Health Information Exchange's (IHIE) Solution Engineering team develops technologies that directly impact the quality, safety, and efficiency of healthcare. We are seeking a Solution Engineering Intern with experience in software design, implementation, testing, and debugging to work with the CareWeb team. Knowledge of the JAVA language is essential for all applicants. If you're talented, driven, and enjoy a little fun, you'll find IHIE to be a wonderful place to work.

Summary: The Solution Engineering Intern will work in an agile setting as a part of the CareWeb team on

Debugging, documenting, and testing existing java applications that interact with some of the largest medical data repositories in the world
Investigate and propose improvements to existing systems and applications
Build proof of concepts for new product ideas

Requirements:
Experience with Object Oriented methodology and best practices
Experience with JAVA programming language required
Experience working with version control systems (git, svn)
Experience with GOOGLE ANALYTICS preferred.

IHIE Attributes:
Adaptability and flexibility in a rapidly changing environment
Self-starter and self-motivated
Ambitious spirit – brings fresh ideas to the table and finds creative solutions to problems
Positive attitude with outstanding communication skills

Education:
Computer Science or related major required

Skills and Experience:
Aptitude to learn technologies quickly
Efficient time management and organizational skills
Professional demeanor
Ability to communicate effectively, both in verbal and written form
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions as well as manage ambiguity
Ability to work independently and as part of a team of professionals at all levels

We offer an exciting opportunity to gain valuable, real-world experience while solving some very interesting challenges. We have a very casual work environment and dress code, all in a dynamic, fun-loving company culture!

IHIE is the nation's largest and most advanced health information exchange helping to ensure health information is where it needs to be, when it needs to be there to improve care coordination and patient outcomes. IHIE was formed in 2004 and currently serves over 90 hospitals and processes more than 14 million clinical data transactions each month. Learn more at www.ihie.org.

Full Job Description
Overview:
The SAGE Publishing Technologies Digital Accessibility Internship offers the opportunity to learn more about the academic publishing industry while developing the skills needed to succeed in digital accessibility and technology positions.

The role will allow someone to gain hands-on experience and learn about digital accessibility and general academic publishing. They will engage in work pertaining to digital educational products that is project-based, multifaceted, fast-paced, intellectually exciting, and above all, collaborative. This position assists, maintains, and helps drive a range of accessibility testing and documentation activities.

This role is best suited for self-starters who are curious, organized, take initiative, ask questions, share feedback, participate in meetings, and are passionate about digital accessibility in higher education.

This internship is paid, part-time (16–25 hours per week during normal office hours) position for the fall 2021 academic semester with the possibility of extending into future semesters and/or the summer based on performance and continued interest. Interns will work remotely and, in the SAGE Washington, DC, office on a mutually agreed schedule.

Essential Job Functions & Responsibilities:
Job functions include, but are not limited to, the following:
Assist accessibility specialist in conducting automated, manual, and screen reader testing on SAGE platforms and content
Record test results for incorporation into SAGE accessibility documentation
Support digital resource and assessment development
Provide user feedback on new products and platforms
Conduct research
Participate in regular and ad hoc meetings

Qualifications & Education:
Must be an active student currently working toward the completion of a degree at an accredited college or university. Preferred programs of study are Digital Accessibility, Universal Design, Web Design, Computer Science, Publishing, or a related field
It is essential to have a basic knowledge of HTML, CSS and/or JavaScript
Important to be a quick learner and independent problem solver
Able to read, analyze, and interpret concepts, documents, requirements, etc.
Familiarity with the W3C’s WCAG 2.1 and/or Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act is a plus
Able to communicate potentially complicated information to non-digital accessibility experts.
Able to maintain high level of confidentiality and professionalism while working with tact and diplomacy
Able to multitask while maintaining attention to detail
Able to work in a constantly evolving, fast-paced environment requiring flexibility
Able to meet deadlines and work expertly under pressure
Possess exemplary communication skills
Possess effective decision-making skills

SAGE U.S. Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) Charter:
SAGE Publishing is committed to being an inclusive employer where all individuals are treated with fairness and respect, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, marriage and partnership status, pregnancy and parental responsibilities, race, religion and belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

We believe that diversity is a cornerstone of a vibrant culture. We want SAGE to be an organization where the most talented staff and high-potential staff are recruited, have the opportunity to grow, and want to work. We strive to achieve a better representation of diverse talent at all levels, including leadership, across our workforce.

position: Intern - SAP Fiori Tools, Software Engineering
description:
Full Job Description
Requisition ID: 274783
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

Contract Duration: 6 to 12 months

Contract Hours: 40 hours per week

Anticipated Start Date: February 2021

Office Location: Remote / Palo Alto, CA

About the team:
SAP UX Engineering is a global team that builds tools to allow SAP along with its customers and partners to build SAP Fiori apps more easily. Our most recent innovation is SAP Fiori tools. SAP Fiori tools is a set of extensions for SAP Business Application Studio and Visual Studio Code designed to simplify the development of SAP applications, ensuring that users can create applications both efficiently and consistently.

As a member of the SAP Fiori tools team in Palo Alto, you will work in a dynamic environment with colleagues around the world, helping to develop extensions for Visual Studio Code. If you have software development skills and want to contribute to developing platforms and applications that are used internally across SAP and externally worldwide, this may be the role for you.

Expectations & Tasks

Work as a part of our cross-functional SCRUM team to develop very high-quality software
Design, develop, and test usable software in close collaboration with the product owner, architect, and scrum team
Coordinate testing, integration, and documentation of the solution
Set up and maintain the auto test framework in an agile and continuous delivery environment
Acquire development skills in new areas and technologies in alignment with team priorities
Handle the design, architecture, development, code review, and testing of applications and proof of concept prototypes
Be comfortable working collaboratively in a virtual environment
Provide estimates for assigned work
Monitor and maintain customer support queues; Be able to confidently perform troubleshooting in the production environment, including communicating with affected users as required
Have fun!

Skills / Competencies

Experience developing web applications in HTML5, JavaScript, TypeScript, CSS, Web Components, React
Working experience with data structures, algorithms, and principles of OO design
Strong problem-solving skills
Ability to prioritize and work on multiple tasks
Working experience with test automation and continuous development models (Jenkins, Puppeteer, Sonar, JIRA and Git) is an asset
Excellent communications skills to coordinate with development colleagues in different regions

Educational Requirements

Candidates must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate, Master's, or PhD degree program which is applicable to the position (computer science or equivalent proven experience). Recent graduates within the last 6 months will also be considered.

WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.
A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team. (Americas:Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). Full Job Description
We are currently looking for an intern to work 3-6 months within our Design and Simulation Systems Research Group in Princeton, New Jersey!

The Challenge

During the internship, you will experience the excitement and challenges of industrial research and be part of a world class team. Your responsibilities will be:

Perform innovative research and development for physically accurate light simulation through participating media
Design, implement, and test ray-tracing based solutions and integrate them into real-world product environments
Analyze and present technical approaches and results
Collaborate with the team on challenging and ground-breaking projects
Create technical reports, patents, and journal publications

The Candidate

We are looking for PhD or Master students in Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, or related discipline.

Qualified candidates will have:
Experience in modeling and simulating light propagation through participating media (e.g. fog, dust, smoke, inclement weather, clouds, etc.)
Experience with latest rendering techniques using real-time ray tracing
Proficiency in C++ and familiarity with common graphics frameworks
Experience with Simcenter Prescan software preferred
Experience with high performance computing preferred
Publications and research experiences in related fields
Outstanding communication skills in English
Excellent interpersonal skills and a can-do attitude
Capability for quick prototyping
Successful candidate must be able to work with controlled technology in accordance with US Export Control Law. US Export Control laws and applicable regulations govern the distribution of strategically important technology, services and information to foreign nationals and foreign countries. Siemens may require candidates under consideration for employment opportunities to submit information regarding citizenship status to allow the organization to comply with specific US Export Control laws and regulations. Additional information on the US Export Control laws & regulations can be found on https://www.bis.doc.gov/index.php/regulations/export-administration-regulations-ear
About Us

Siemens Technology employees are passionate about applied research. We create technology with purpose that benefits society - more agile and productive factories, more intelligent and efficient buildings and grids, more reliable and sustainable transportation. Our work powers Siemens products and is regularly featured in patents and publications. We operate in a global ecosystem focused on innovation, partnering with our businesses, government agencies, and leading academic institutions on highly visible projects where collaboration is key.

Our people continuously develop their talents, are curious, and are not afraid to take risks in pursuit of technological innovation. A strong learning culture empowers employees at Siemens Technology to own their growth and development.

We know that diversity fuels innovation and drives business success. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment, where diversity of thought, culture, and experience is seen as our greatest strength. This is what brings our best ideas to life.

We take pride in bringing our best selves to work every day, prioritizing individual health, work-life blend, and flexibility.

At Siemens Technology, the success of our employees drives our success.

Join Us

We are more than employees; we are actively helping to make people’s lives a little better every day. Would you like to be a part of that? Then join us. We offer you a high level of practical relevance as well as an opportunity to individually contribute your knowledge and your visions around the world. Whether you’re helping to develop products for the operating units or working in interdisciplinary projects for the business areas: At Corporate Technology you’ll be working in the heart of Siemens’ technological research together with the best!

Full Job Description

The Freedonia Group, a division of MarketResearch.com, is one of the leading global suppliers of off-the-shelf industrial research studies, specializing in plastics, chemicals, construction, industrial components, packaging and other topics. Located in Cleveland, Ohio, the company has been in business for over twenty-five years. In addition, The Freedonia Group’s industry market research is considered an authoritative source by the world’s leading publications and has been featured in nearly every relevant trade publication.

We are currently looking to hire a tech-related intern, to help provide remote and on-site support for our employees. The successful candidate will also gain a wide variety of hands-on experience in a multitude of areas.

Responsibilities:

· Remote and on-site support of end users in all company and remote locations.

· Support the Tech Team in maintaining hardware, software and other systems

· Organize and maintain IT Resources.

· Assist in maintenance of IT inventory and accessories

· Lend IT support in areas such as cybersecurity, programming, analytics, and data management

Requirements:

· Working towards or recently completed a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or Management Information Systems (Or related)

· Minimum 3.0 GPA

· Familiar with Windows 10, Windows Server 2008 and newer, Desktop and Laptop hardware, and basics of wired and wireless networking

· Comport oneself in a professional manner at all times

· Strong verbal and written communication skills

· Strong problems-solving skills

· Ability to work in an isolated environment and in teams

· Strong worth ethic, discipline and attention to detail

Benefits

· Gain hands-on experience in an IT position that is both on-site AND remote.

· Opportunity to attend events and meetings with company management and executives

· Flexible schedule for students

· A chance to move the technology of a company from one site to another

· Compensation available

Besides the excellent learning opportunity, interns are welcome to participate in the day-to-day activities of Freedonia - including attending holiday parties, board-game nights, organized hikes, annual cooking competitions, etc.

Interns with The Freedonia Group will maintain a work schedule as determined by Freedonia and the intern. We are willing to work around school and activities schedules.

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Pay: $1.00 - $2.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Work Location:

  • One location

Work Remotely:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

Full Job Description

We are seeking an energetic Validation Engineering Intern to support our Engineering & Validation Teams in our Louisville, KY facility.

Ideal candidates should be actively enrolled in a technical field of study such as Engineering, Computer Science, Math or Physics. Candidates must also be self-motivated, able to multi-task and be willing to learn.

  • Participate as a multidisciplinary engineering team member.
  • Assist Engineers with the design, development, integration and testing of systems.
  • Assist with the assembly and wiring of hardware installations.
  • Assist with the documentation of software, production and engineering data.
  • Participate in the QA/QC process of software and hardware.
  • Provide engineering documentation to other departments as necessary.
  • Assemble/Modify prototype hardware designs using surface mount equipment and soldering iron.
  • Conduct hardware testing and report test results.
  • Conduct software testing and report test results.

Skills

  • Proficient understanding of MS Office Programs (Word, Excel, Outlook)Ability to learn MiTek’s internal computer systems and navigate network/network file structure
  • Ability to learn MiTek’s internal systems and other programs as needed.

EDUCATION

Actively enrolled in a technical field of study such as engineering, computer science, math or physics

EXPERIENCE

Job Description

ENSCO Avionics is looking for a talented Software Engineer intern to join its IData® development team. IData® is the only data-driven solution for accelerating the creation of mission- and safety-critical embedded display applications on the market. IData® provides a robust and flexible development framework to easily design, develop, prototype, and deploy rich graphics for any target display application regardless of platform.
As part of the IData® team you will be involved in the development of the desktop application, porting of embedded software target hardware for both customer applications and demonstrations, customer support, road-map decisions.

Our dedicated workforce is diverse—in background, experience, skills, and interests. position: Predictive Science Academic Alliance Program III Student Intern (PSAAP III)
description:
Full Job Description
Company Description

Join us and make YOUR mark on the World!

Are you interested in joining some of the brightest talent in the world to strengthen the United States’ security? Come join Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL) where our employees apply their expertise to create solutions for BIG ideas that make our world a better place.

We are committed to a diverse and equitable workforce with an inclusive culture that values and celebrates the diversity of our people, talents, ideas, experiences, and perspectives. This is essential to innovation and creativity for continued success of the Laboratory’s mission.

Job Description

We have multiple openings for graduate level students who are a part of the Predictive Science Academic Alliance Program III (PSAAP III) to perform discipline-focused research needed to help further predictive science enabled by effective extreme scale computing. This internship will run 10-12 consecutive weeks, between April and October, 2021. Our goal is to develop and demonstrate technologies and methodologies to support effective extreme computing in the context of science/engineering applications. You will provide technical and/or research support to projects in the areas of computational science, computer science, numerical methods, mathematics, or other related fields.

In this role you will

Students will work with Scientists and Engineers doing research in assigned area.
Under minimal supervision, will participate in research in assigned area.
Gather and analyze data or information in support of scientific research.
Make an oral or poster presentation on the outcome of their research activities.
Students should expect to spend approximately 40 hours a week working on their research projects or participating in the provided professional development opportunities.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Must be a continuing college or university student in good standing at an accredited institution pursuing a graduate degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or other related fields.
Must be an active member of the Predictive Science Academic Alliance Program III (PSAAP III).
Demonstrated academic achievement in scientific curriculum.
Experience applying advanced computational science and/or mathematical principles to solve technical problems.
Additional Information

Why Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory?

Included in 2021 Best Places to Work by Glassdoor!
Work for a premier innovative national Laboratory
Comprehensive Benefits Package
Flexible schedules (*depending on project needs)
Collaborative, creative, inclusive, and fun team environment

Learn more about our company, selection process, position types and security clearances by visiting our Career site.

Security Clearance

LLNL is a Department of Energy (DOE) and National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) Laboratory. Some positions will require a DOE L or Q clearance (please reference Security Clearance requirement above). If you are selected and a clearance is required, we will initiate a Federal background investigation to determine if you meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information or matter. In addition, all L or Q cleared employees are subject to random drug testing. An L or Q clearance requires U.S. citizenship. For additional information please see DOE Order 472.2.

Equal Employment Opportunity

LLNL is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer that values and hires a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, marital status, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, protected veteran status, age, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please submit a request via our online form.

California Privacy Notice

The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) grants privacy rights to all California residents. The law also entitles job applicants, employees, and non-employee workers to be notified of what personal information LLNL collects and for what purpose. The Employee Privacy Notice can be accessed here.

Web Development Intern Part-Time (Remote)

1GS Digital Agency specializes in working with small business professional service firms and educational companies, specifically schools, law firms and e-commerce businesses across the United States.

You will also be utilizing different builders, WP-Bakery, Divi, Elementor to build sites for clients. You will also be cross-trained on other marketing related tasks to support the operations and fulfillment of client projects.

Part-Time

What You’ll Do?

  • Implement new functionalities based on the specifications provided.
  • Develop fast, scalable, and web-based solutions to resolve critical business problems.
  • Build effective and reusable front-end systems to drive complex web apps.
  • Build UI components, improve our existing front-end infrastructure, and discover ways to solve issues.
  • Work together with other developers, Designers, copywriters and Account managers.
  • Attend daily meetings, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines to implement agile methodologies and deliver value to our clients and customers.

  • Conferring with teams to resolve conflicts, prioritize needs, develop content criteria, or choose solutions.

  • Maintaining an understanding of the latest Web applications and programming practices through education, study, and participation in conferences, workshops, and groups.

  • Evaluating code to ensure it meets industry standards, is valid, is properly structured, and is compatible with browsers, devices, or operating systems.

What We Look For?

  • Pursuing degree in Computer Science, IT, Web Development, or relevant major.
  • Passion towards coding and web designing.
  • Experience with Front End development (Elementor, Divi, WP-Bakery)
  • Experience with Figma, Adobe XD or similar software
  • Prior experience in building fast and responsive UI would be a plus.
  • Sound knowledge of web development technologies such as HTML, CSS, Angular2, or ReactJS.
  • Self-driven and creative.
  • Excellent oral and written communication.
  • Solid ability in both written and verbal communication.
  • Knowledge of programming language and technical terminology.
  • Able to develop ideas and processes and clearly express them.
  • High degree of independent judgment.
  • Able to solve complex problems.
  • Strong Problem solving skills.

We are looking for someone who is a self-starter and strong collaborator with great organizational and communication skills. This position calls for a digitally savvy individual who can work independently and drive results for a variety of clients.

This position is remote, but local (south florida) presence is preferred. This position also has the opportunity to turn into a full-time position based on performance, so the ideal candidate is comfortable working independently, communicating when needed, and meeting deadlines.

We are a Veteran-owned company that supports a collection of companies working directly with Veterans to help them maximize their VA disability compensation. We assist by helping these Veterans with the critical documentation and medical records-gathering process.

Our mission is to provide 5-star operational, administrative, and technical support to our Veterans through accurate, timely and caring services.

Supports our software development team by assisting in the various stages of development of software using the Agile development model. Possess a basic understanding of computers, are eager to learn new software and gain experience with an in-house Development Team.

Hands on experience with guidance from mentors.

Ability to identify opportunities to adopt innovative technologies.

#INDLOX

Full Job Description
Job Summary

The National Security Agency (NSA) Science of Security (SoS) Summer Internship Program offers paid research internship opportunities for undergraduate and graduate-level university students pursuing STEM degrees. The 12-week program starting mid-May/June offers interns the opportunity to gain hands-on experience working with full-time NSA researchers on innovative cybersecurity research and technology. NSA/CSS Research Directorate (RES) is home to a highly technical and talented workforce that performs cutting-edge research and creates breakthroughs in mathematics, computer science, engineering, cybersecurity, physics, neuroscience, and linguistics that lead to creative solutions to NSA's most challenging problems.

Qualifications

' Must be a U.S. citizen.
' Must be eligible to be granted a security clearance.
' Must be available for an operational interview and other applicable processing between the months of November 2021 and March 2022.
' Applicants should have demonstrated superior STEM aptitude and problem-solving skills. Evidence of successful work on an independent STEM project is desirable. Applicants may be at any stage in their undergraduate or graduate careers and working, or intending to work, in any STEM area.
' Desired majors include, but not restricted to, computer science, cybersecurity, engineering, information technology, mathematics, and psychology.

Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule

  • Students are paid a competitive salary commensurate with their education level.
  • Receive annual leave, sick leave and paid federal holidays.
  • Participation in agency-wide extracurricular programs.
  • Students who attend schools in excess of 75 miles from Ft. Meade, MD, are eligible for a round trip airfare ticket to and from school or mileage reimbursement up to the cost of a government-issued airline ticket.
  • Daily transportation to and from work is not provided. Students participating in the program are highly encouraged to bring a vehicle. Carpooling with other students MAY be available but NOT guaranteed.
  • Subsidized housing accommodations are available upon request if school is located in excess of 75 miles from NSA main HQs campus.
How to apply

Submit an online application on or before 31 October 2021.

Send an applicant package to sos.research@nsa.gov; you will receive an email confirmation upon receipt.

Applicant packages should include:
' Resume,
' One page essay on the applicant research experience and/or interests,
' Most recent transcript(s) that show academic performance - Unofficial copies are accepted, and
' A letter of recommendation (LOR) from a faculty member or research mentor who can speak to your research experience/background (LORs attached to the application package or sent directly from the recommender to sos.research@nsa.gov are accepted).

Early Acceptance Incentive;
The application period runs until 31 October 2021. However, the Agency will determine selections for early acceptance into the program on a rolling basis throughout the application period and anticipates filling approximately 1/3 of the available positions prior to the closing of the application period.

If you have questions about the Science of Security Intern Program, please contact us at the email address above or call 1-844-ICHIRES. You may also e-mail Summer_Interns@nsa.gov for application questions.

***PLEASE NOTE:
U.S. Citizenship is required for all applicants. Reasonable accommodations provided to applicants with disabilities during the application and hiring process where appropriate. NSA is an equal opportunity employer and abides by applicable employment laws and regulations. All applicants and employees are subject to random drug testing in accordance with Executive Order 12564. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a security background investigation and polygraph.

This position is a Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS) position in the Excepted Service under 10 U.S.C. 1601. DoD Components with DCIPS positions apply Veterans' Preference to eligible candidates as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 USC, in accordance with the procedures provided in DoD Instruction 1400.25, Volume 2005, DCIPS Employment and Placement. If you are a veteran claiming veterans' preference, as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 U.S.C., you may be asked to submit documents verifying your eligibility.

DCIPS Disclaimer

The National Security Agency (NSA) is part of the DoD Intelligence Community Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS). All positions in the NSA are in the Excepted Services under 10 United States Codes (USC) 1601 appointment authority.

Full Job Description
Saint-Gobain is looking for an energetic student to work as an intern in the Engineering department. This position is full-time during the summer months, and then part-time hours during the school semester. The total duration of the internship is projected to be 6 months.

Job Goals:
The Automation Engineering intern will work within the Manufacturing 4.0 Department in the manufacturing plant. The person in this position will have hands-on learning experience working with SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition) software (Ignition). This is an opportunity for an intern to get exposure to various aspects that they have learned in the classroom with real-life experiences in digital automation activity at Saint-Gobain Ceramics, which has a worldwide presence.

Main Functions:
Work on projects of minor or significant assignments of broader programs involving existing products or processes. The incumbent will receive instructions on task specifications and design constraints as well as technical direction during assignments.
Provide quality testing support for software improvements on our quality control software
Prepare details, sequence and priority of tasks to meet established time targets.
Scripting new software features within the Ignition platform for data acquisition and analysis
Ability to work closely with other employees and departments in the company
Other related duties as assigned.

Required Qualifications

Skills and Requirements:
Full-time student, pursuing a Computer Science or an Engineering degree
Coding or scripting experience, preferably in Python and SQL
SCADA or PLC experience is a plus
Ability to work Monday-Friday, 8am-4pm during the summer, part-time hours during the school semester to accommodate class schedule
Microsoft Suite product experience
Good communication skills, high computer literacy and ability to operate in a team environment

Company Summary

With over 60,000 employees working across 46 countries, Saint-Gobain’s Innovative Materials Sector boasts a unique and profitable portfolio of high-tech and high value-added solutions for housing and construction, mobility, healthcare and industry.

A true technology bridgehead for the Saint-Gobain Group, the Innovative Materials Sector is supported by 3 powerful growth drivers: innovation, co-development and research.

In the field of High Performance Materials, it proposes a comprehensive range of innovative technologies targeting the housing and construction market, transport, industry and healthcare, and combined into four families of materials: ceramics, polymers, abrasives and technical fabrics. Flat Glass is a world leader in manufacturing, processing and selling glass products for the construction and transportation sector (including the automotive industry).

Saint-Gobain provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. Full Job Description
Software AG is looking for ambitious, energetic, and motivated students or recent graduates looking to apply what they’ve learned in Information Technology, business, sales, and or project management as a Business Value Engineering (BVE) intern in our Reston, VA or Denver, CO office.

The role will provide a unique and exciting opportunity to start a career in Enterprise Software supporting some of the most advanced and industry leading technologies in the world.

This internship will be a 3-6 month part-time opportunity to grow and master your key analytical, sales, & project management skills - helping the North American Presales organization at Software AG.

Due to current circumstances, the internship will start out remotely and you will not be required to go into the office.

What you get to do each day:
Learn the Software AG suite of software including ARIS, webMethods Integration and Cumulocity IoT
Utilize the Software AG technology offerings to build assets that will be utilized by the NAM BVE community.
Be a member of a collaborative team working on customer facing business cases, financial analysis, and other sales BVE related activities.
Work on quantification of business value delivered through our software solutions in Excel models.
Build out ARIS process models that capture our customers Goals, Key Business Requirements, impediments and solutions.
Assist with 3rd party software analysis research and translate to key benefits and capability our solutions provide.

What you bring to the role:
Pursuing a MBA with BS/BA in Computer Science or recent graduate looking for a chance to prove yourself
Have strong Excel and modeling skills
Love working with technology and naturally curious
Great communication skills, both verbal and written
Detail oriented and Goal oriented
Interested in potentially pursuing a customer facing role in technology

Summary:
ASRC Technical Services (ASTS) brings a long and successful history of delivering high-performance space systems engineering, integration and satellite operations services to civil and defense agencies. ASTS provides these services throughout all phases of the program life cycle and across the entire space systems architecture, including space and ground assets.

Job Description:
We are seeking an intern to support the GOES-R Ground Segment team, with a focus on analyzing and leveraging GOES-R observation data in new ways. This internship will involve working with GOES-R series data in the Cloud, generating sample scripts to analyze and visualize GOES-R data, publishing scripts to a public github repository. It is expected that GOES-R data will additionally be fused with high-resolution data from external sources, such as NWS, USGS or USDA. The intern will thoroughly document their work and format this documentation in publicly available formats (such as slide decks or PDFs linked from the GOES-R website, or content directly available on the GOES-R website).

The intern will work closely with GOES-R staff and management and will provide status and updates at least weekly, and perhaps more frequently at management's discretion.

None

Strong writing and presentation skills.
Must be a team player able to work in a large program environment and have good communications skills.
Self-starter

Samsung is a world leader in Memory, LCD and System LSI technologies. We are currently looking for exceptional software and hardware talent to join our Samsung Austin R & D Center (SARC) in Austin, TX and our Advanced Computing Lab (ACL) in San Jose, CA. SARC was established in Austin, TX in 2010 to be one of Samsung’s strategic investments in high performance low power ARM based device technology. Presently our GPU design teams, located in Austin (SARC) and San Jose (ACL), are developing a GPU that will be deployed in Samsung mobile products. Our System IP team located in Austin (SARC) is working on Coherent Interconnect and memory controller architectures.

Managing a large, complex IT Infrastructure is no small task. Samsung SARC/ACL IT service operations works across many technologies and operates the current and next wave of infrastructure, application, platform and virtual technologies. Full Job Description
Description

Exempt

Job Announcement

Preparation and Credentialing Intern

$16 hourly

Agency profile:
We believe that the success of Washington’s students depends on the success of Washington’s educators. At the Professional Educator Standards Board (PESB), we oversee the preparation and certification of Washington’s P-12 educators.

We are one agency with two governing Boards: the Professional Educator Standards Board and the Paraeducator Board. Our board members and staff are committed to ensuring all Washington students learn from highly effective educators within the education system. We focus on educator quality, workforce diversity, and policy innovation by creating policy, administering grants, workgroups, and pilot projects.

In addition to serving as the state’s educator licensure board, we oversee approval and review of all educator preparation programs. Our agency values serve as a foundational framework for advancing this work.

We prioritize diversifying the educator workforce and addressing educator shortages through programs focused on pathways into the profession, strengthening the assessment system, and supporting recruitment, retention, and professional growth efforts.

We value:
Educator voice
Diversity, equity, and inclusion
Educator excellence for student success
Community engagement
Learning and Innovation

To operate as an antiracist agency, we seek candidates aligned with these values.

Position overview:
The 2021 Washington state legislature directed PESB to develop two new specialty endorsements: elementary computer science and secondary computer science. The legislature also provided funding for PESB to administer grants to organizations to support educators in

professional learning and credentialing in computer science. This position, located in Olympia, Washington, will play a key role in development of policy and implementation relating to this computer science legislation..

This position reports to the Associate Director of Preparation and Credentialing, and is mentored by the Program manager for professional learning and program support. The intern will work closely with the Preparation and Credentialing team.

Key responsibilities:
The primary responsibilities of this position will be co-facilitating a workgroup of external stakeholders to develop computer science essential learnings, and supporting grantee organization leaders. Leaders and stakeholders could include legislators, technology organization leaders, state agency staff, community organization leaders, educators including district administrators, higher education faculty, tribal school leaders, educational service district superintendents, as well as others in leadership positions.

Collaborate with PESB preparation and credentialing team staff as they review, develop, and implement computer science education policy as directed by the Washington State legislature and the Board.
Collaborate with PESB Preparation and Credentialing team staff on implementation and facilitation of a workgroup of stakeholders to develop essential learning for computer science specialty endorsements. Work with PESB staff on presenting these essential learnings to the Board.
Collaborate with PESB Preparation and Credentialing team staff on implementation of PESB’s professional learning grant, including:
Supporting grantees from the grant launch through closing including conducting (virtual) site visits, responding to organization questions via phone or email and providing resources.
Collecting final grant reports from grantees and participants and compiling and analyzing data from the reports.
Collaborating with PESB Preparation and Credentialing team staff to create and publish a final grant report, and present this report at PESB’s July Board meeting.

Who you are:
A self-motivated leader with the following:
Ability to integrate diversity, inclusion, cultural responsiveness, and equity into policy and implementation, through functions, processes, and materials
Excellent communication skills
Ability to develop and maintaining positive, supportive relationships with grantee organization leaders
Good organizational skills
Ability to learn new technologies
Ability to work remotely for both independent work and collaborative work
Adaptability and flexibility to adjust approach and style to varied circumstances, audiences, and timeline requirements

Required qualifications:
Currently enrolled in a Master’s in Education Policy program
Ability to co-create with your colleagues a welcoming, supportive, safe, affirming, and respectful work environment
Ability to engage and support respectful dialogue and courageous conversations even when uncomfortable
Ability to participate in continuous learning, development and training offered in the areas of diversity, inclusion, cultural humility, oppression, and equity
Employ a range of problem-solving strategies with self and others for agency advancement
Experience working productively with diverse groups across categories of difference
Ability to work effectively in a team environment under tight timelines

Desired qualifications:
Knowledge of state policy issues specifically related to public education and certified education professionals
Knowledge or interest in computer science or STEM (science, technology, engineering, math) education
Experience working with P-12 or higher education
Passion for the mission of PESB
Compensation

This position serves at the pleasure of the Executive Director of the Professional Educator Standards Board and is exempt from civil service laws. Compensation is $16 hourly. The intern will work up to 18 hours per week through July 31, 2021.

Application Process

Those interested in this position must apply through Careers.wa.gov. Applications must include the following documents in MS Word and PDF format only:

A letter of interest specifically addressing the qualifications listed in this announcement;
A current résumé;
A sample of a data project completed by the candidate, and;
A list of three or more professional references.

Please address any questions to:
Carole Lynch, Human Resources

Office of Superintendent of Public Instruction
600 Washington Street Southeast
Olympia, Washington 98504-7200
(360) 725-6270; Carole.Lynch@k12.wa.us

Persons needing accommodation in the application process or this announcement in an alternative format may contact the Human Resources Office at (360) 725-6270 or (360) 725-6066, or e-mail hroffice@k12.wa.us.

New Jobs Alert Service

OSPI offers a subscription service, which regularly notifies subscribers of new OSPI employment opportunities on careers.wa.gov. Subscribers are notified via text or email alert. If you are interested in this service, then please subscribe at this location.

OSPI is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from job seekers who will contribute to our diversity. OSPI provides equal access to all programs and services without discrimination based on sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, age, honorably discharged veteran or military status, sexual orientation including gender expression or identity, the presence of any sensory, mental, or physical disability, or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal by a person with a disability. If you would like, please include your name and gender pronouns in your application, to ensure we address you appropriately throughout the application process. Persons needing accommodation in the application process or this announcement in an alternative format may contact the human resource consultant listed in “Application Process.”

Full Job Description
Becht is a 5 STAR rated Glassdoor, a Top 100 Best Places to Work in New Jersey according to NJBIZ and a Great Place to Work-Certified™ company!

Please attach a recent unofficial transcript with your resume. If you are a Master's degree student, please also upload your Bachelor's degree transcript. Failure to do so will create a delay in the review of your application.

Who is Becht?
Founded in 1964, Becht is a rapidly-growing, multi-discipline consulting firm relied on by customers to relentlessly solve their most difficult and entrenched problems. We combine vast experience through our network of over 1500 technical experts with both engineering expertise and professional experience. Becht is a company founded on excellence, and as such we seek individuals who want to be part of our passionate and energetic team.

Who Do We Want?
Becht is seeking junior, senior, master’s or doctorate computer science/software engineering students with interest in web app development with a database back end who want to learn more by joining our world-class, family-owned engineering organization. Becht is committed to developing young professionals by providing opportunities to explore the dynamic environment of engineering consulting services. Becht strives to provide the student with:
  • Real world experience with a consulting company operating with the latest technology
  • Guidance in the form of a highly trained mentor
  • A positive, team approach work environment
  • Hands on experience with the full SDLC during your internship
At Becht, our intern/co-op program gives students the opportunity to explore the practical applications of their college classes while working with customers from around the globe. We offer full-time student positions for every semester. These positions actively support current projects and are constantly evolving. As a student with Becht, you will learn to develop internal and client facing web apps, web pages, and productivity tools with a team of other software developers and engineers. You will be involved in the entire process from setting application requirements, creating data models, and designing the interface, developing the front and back ends, testing and assisting in deployment. You will be at the forefront of our most advanced and technically rewarding projects to assist clients in improving reliability and profitability while also reducing risks to people and the environment.

Build Your Career with Becht
A creative and innovative work environment isn’t all we have to offer! When you join Becht, you can expect:
  • A positive, collaborative workforce
  • Access to further training and development
  • Mentoring programs
  • Company and family events such as baseball games, go-karting, and bowling
  • Opportunities that provide stability as well as variety
  • Work day events such as birthday lunches
  • Community outreach programs such as Red Cross blood drives, Toys for Tots collections/volunteering, and United Way campaigns
Your Knowledge and Expertise
  • Passion for technology and can navigate across complex and rapidly changing landscapes
  • Detail oriented and organized
  • Creative and confident to express new ideas
  • Proven troubleshooting skills
  • Self-motivated and self-disciplined
  • Should be comfortable working in a virtual team
  • Ability to compartmentalize efforts—put one task down, pick up another, then resume the first with minimal ramp up required
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Object oriented programming experience
  • Database experience
  • MSSQL, Bootstrap, C# and/or .NET Core experience are a plus.
  • Must be enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s Software Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent, degree
  • Must be available to work 40 hours per week for a minimum of one semester
  • Remote or must be local or willing to temporarily relocate to the Medina, OH; Liberty Corner, NJ; or Humble, Houston, TX areas or KC or MO; Northland area.
6 months Internship/Co-op blocks are preferred.

BECHT is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Full Job Description

Job Description

Company Information

Smarter Grid Solutions (SGS) is a fast-growing technology company that delivers products and services to enable utilities and developers to integrate distributed and renewable energy resources into our electric grid. Our unique Active Network Management (ANM) technology is the only technology of its kind to provide real-time, autonomous control of distributed energy resources, and is the result of over ten years of developing, deploying and proving this unique approach to managing the Smart Grid.

Overview

SGS is seeking a Software Analytics Intern to join our smart grid analytics team. The team is responsible for developing practical paths to operationalizing advanced power systems analytics; this could be battery optimization techniques, ML-based forecasting, or integration with advanced network-model based approaches based on load flow, optimal power flow, or state estimation. All of these power systems techniques can be used to help manage the grid more optimally and pave the way for deeper de-carbonization.

We are looking for a highly motivated student or graduate with excellent software development skills to help build out our analytical capabilities. In this group, you will sit between the world of software development, power systems, and advanced analytics. Your focus will be on helping develop and test software frameworks that give us and our customers confidence that these complex analytics can be safely operationalized. You will be involved in end-to-end software development in a multi-disciplinary environment.

Qualifying Criteria

**Please note we cannot consider applications from candidates who do not meet these criteria.**

You must be either a NY State resident attending or having attended any college or university, regardless of location, within the last 12 months

or

an out of state student, attending or having attended a College or university located in New York State within the last 12 months.

Required Skills

· Strong academic track record in Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Computer Science, or similar

· Familiarity with high-level power and energy systems concepts

· Solid experience in modern analytics-friendly languages like Python, Scala, or R

Desired Skills

There are a number of additional desirable attributes that would complement the required skillset:

  • An understanding of power systems analysis
  • Optimization using AMPL, GAMS, or similar
  • AI and ML techniques
  • First principles understanding of algorithms, data structures, and time/space complexity

Anticipated Start Date: Summer 2021.

Duration: Minimum of 6 months.

Salary: Competitive

Job Type: Internship

Location: New York

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Pay: $17.00 per hour

We are an equal opportunity employer. Your application will be considered without regard to race, color, national origin, age, disability, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, or veteran status. You must be legally authorized to work in the U.S.

Full Job Description
CHS Inc. is a leading global agribusiness owned by farmers, ranchers and cooperatives across the United States that provides grain, food and energy resources to businesses and consumers around the world. We serve agriculture customers and consumers across the United States and around the world. Most of our 10,000 employees are in the United States, but today we have employees in 19 countries. At CHS, we are creating connections to empower agriculture.

Summary

CHS has an exciting opportunity in our Global Grain & Processing group. We are looking for a Data Analytics Intern to help support a variety projects that will range in scale and complexity. You’ll have the opportunity to develop your skills by learning from and collaborating with a talented team of business and IT professionals.

Responsibilities

As a Data Analytics Intern, your assignments may include, but are not limited to:

Gather required data for analytics purposes, using UAS technology.
Work closely with data scientists and analysts to design and develop data cubes in our Power BI business information tools to analyze key business information.
Participate in engagement and discovery sessions between data scientists and data analyst to identify problems/gaps as well as innovation opportunities that can be solved or enabled by machine learning, data analytic and modeling.
Participate in the design of dashboards for business intelligence.
Implement and test models in a POC (proof of concept) scale to operationalize the outcomes of the predictive modeling and validate the results in the real-world.
Become a part of a successful, dynamic team using standard Lean processes to deliver quality and timely results to internal customers.
Be encouraged and expected to innovate and be creative in your data analysis, problem solving and presentation of solutions.
Minimum Qualifications (required)
Currently enrolled in in Business Analytics, Mathematics, Economics, Physics, Computer Science, Engineering, or similar degree program at an accredited institution, entering junior or senior year, or recent graduate
Experience with Data visualization tools – e.g. Power BI or Office 365, visual data capture technology
Experience with Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) / Drone technology
Training or experience in data analytics/science areas, such as time series analysis, forecasting, classification and regression analysis
Excellent communication skills, customer focus, strong analytical and problem-solving skills, self-motivated with confirmed leadership abilities, presentation skills and be able to function in a team-oriented environment with resource and time constraints.
A passion for customers, engineering and product quality
Additional Qualifications
Experience with database management technologies in the data analytics context
Experience with RPA
Training/Experience in Lean methodologies

CHS offers a competitive total compensation package. Benefits include Health, Dental, Vision, Hearing, Life Insurance, Health and Day Care Savings Accounts, Paid Vacation, 401K, Company Funded Pension, Profit Sharing, Long and Short Term Disability, Tuition reimbursement, and Adoption assistance.

CHS is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Full Job Description
Overview:
This internship position is to support the computer vision and machine learning team in the development of deep neural network solutions designed to run on our latest low-power AI chip Katana. The internship will include several exciting and challenging tasks, mostly focused on analysing the training\testing data, and designing and implementing creative techniques for improving and extending the data, including planning and conducting additional data collections and annotations, and running machine learning tools against the data. The intern will have significant interactions with the team members, and will have exposure to the latest computer vision and machine learning techniques.

Responsibilities:
Analyze the current training\testing data, and produce reports\spreadsheets\visualizations describing the data quality, coverage, features, and identify collection\labeling errors.
Design and implement creative scientific techniques for improving and extending the training\testing data.
Design and implement ways for improving data organization, storage, formats.
Design and implement creative techniques for improving the data collection process.
Organize and conduct new data collections.
Apply statistical, mathematical, and software skills to support machine learning model development.
Run ML training tools against the data.
Analyze the performance of the system, and summarize the failure patterns\areas of improvement.

Qualifications:
Currently enrolled as a student, with 1+ years of relevant work experience in an accredited Bachelors, Masters or PhD program within the United States.
Majoring in computer engineering, computer science, or a relevant field.
Passion for machine learning, computer vision, and data analysis.
1+ years of experience in coding in Python, and debugging skills.
Highly analytical, attentive to detail, curious, self-starter.
Effective written and verbal communication skills
Team player

High preforming interns may be offered full-time positions post-graduation. You will be paid a competitive hourly rate for the internship. In addition, many interns may receive academic credit for their work through their college or university.

What you’ll do

Support day-to-day applications, data, reporting, and analytics projects and complete ad hoc application requests
Provide historical, current, and predictive views of business operations to support key partners in decision making across the enterprise
Build/analyze data sources to understand key drivers of the business
Creatively and rigorously apply modern techniques to a wide range of business problems

What we’re looking for

College Junior or Senior within one to two years of graduation
An interest in pursuing a career with Kum & Go post-graduation
Must be able to complete at least 240 hours during the summer 2021
Must have completed high school in Iowa or currently attend an Iowa community college, private college, or Board of Regents institution

Other key requirements

Pursuing an undergraduate degree in MIS, Computer Science or other STEM major (master’s or doctorate students not eligible)
Detail oriented and process-thinker
Excellent writing and communication skills
Experience in Microsoft Technologies preferred

Leadership Competencies

Communication: Delivers clear, effective communication and listens to others
Conceptual/Systems Thinking: Recognizes patterns, trends, themes, and connections in information to develop innovative ideas and solutions
Constructive Engagement: Expresses ideas and disagreements, constructively resolves conflict, and encourages others to do the same
Customer Orientation: Meets the expectations and needs of internal and external customers
Decision Making: Makes good decisions in a timely manner
Empowerment: Takes initiative and solves problems
Talent Development: Maximizes potential and improves overall performance
Influence: Proactively builds relationships and influences others
Analytical Thinking/Problem Solving: Accurately assesses problems and effectively and efficiently arrives at solutions
Strategic Thinking: Understands the current state and is able to visualize the ideal state and how to achieve it

About Kum & Go

At Kum & Go, our purpose is to make days better. We do that by connecting with people. Every day, whether in stores or at our Store Support Center headquarters, we take a people-first approach to developing associates, serving customers, and solving problems. We provide a unique working experience where associates are given many opportunities to make connections and to have fun along the way. Our culture is supported by our five core values:

Passion - We love what we do, and it shows in our work.
Integrity - We do the right thing, even when it is difficult.
Teamwork - We believe that greatness is only achieved in unity.
Caring - We have genuine compassion for our customers, associates, families, and communities.
Excellence - We expect and deliver superior performance.

For nearly 60 years, Kum & Go has been dedicated to the communities it serves, sharing 10 percent of its profits with charitable causes. For four generations, the family-owned convenience store chain has focused on providing exceptional service and delivering more than customers expect. Established in Hampton, Iowa, in 1959, the chain has since grown to employ more than 5,000 associates in more than 400 stores in 11 states (Iowa, Arkansas, Colorado, Minnesota, Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, North Dakota, Oklahoma, South Dakota, and Wyoming).

Kum & Go is an Equal Opportunity Employer

JOB DESCRIPTION

Inspiring People - Impactful Experiences

If there was one common theme to describe what our employees get from a career with Envista,

it’s: An Experience. Envista prides itself on being One Company/One Team.

Forensic engineering, as an industry, is designed to rely on scientific principles to investigate all types of failures impacting service, people, and business production— from minor to catastrophic. It’s our job to analyze and determine why it happened.

The IT Support Intern will gain solid grounding in the technology skills needed to understand and navigate ServiceNow (Help Desk) and WDS (Windows Deployment Services) strategy.
