When you join Envista, here’s what to expect:
Motivating projects: no day is the same.
Potential to propel your career forward with our thoughtfully designed career paths.
Contribute to a diverse team that encourages innovation and aspires to always do better.
Impact businesses all over the world with your ability to solve intricate matters
Established client portfolio that takes us to five continents and endless opportunity for company
Work in a family-oriented atmosphere with a small company feel, with the resources and technology of a large enterprise.

Assist in (WDS) deploying images to new and replacement computers.
Assist with managing IT hardware
Assist in upgrading hardware components on laptops or repairing used and damaged laptops.
Assist in MDM, deploying cellphones and tablets.
Assist with shipping and receiving IT hardware and components.
Assist in creating and managing users in Active Directory.
Demonstrate commitment to Envista’s vision, mission, and values.
Performs others duties as assigned.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
All levels of experience are welcome, including those seeking career exploration or changes, gap year students, freshmen, sophomores, and/or those seeking first internships.
Basic Computer repair skills like swapping components
Excellent time management and organizational skills, including attention to detail and accuracy to execute tasks and meet deadlines.
Strong computer proficiency including working knowledge and experience in Microsoft Windows programs, including Microsoft Office software.
Think critically, creatively, be a self-starter.
Ability to work and be productive independently.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with diverse group.
Excellent interpersonal skills and willingness to contribute to the team-centric culture

Preferred Skills/Abilities/Experience

Actively involved in school, community or other volunteer activities or organizations is a plus.

Education:
Have a high school diploma or GED.
Majoring or plan on majoring in computer science, computer engineering or other related technology field.
Passion and interest for computers.

One Company/One Team is not just one of our 5 Guiding Principles, it’s we how separate ourselves from our competitors. We learn together, we win together and through our team members voices, we bring certainty to an uncertain world.

At Envista, we recognize that our potential team members come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a role. We strive to reflect the communities and clients we serve to drive innovation, excellence, and meaningful work—We want you to bring your authentic self to Envista. Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. Experience with Angular frontend framework and JavaScript is preferred.
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

Full Job Description
What You Will Do

The NIE workforce is comprised of Cybersecurity Technical Staff, Computing Systems Tec & Professionals, System Programmers, Solutions Architects, Computer Operator Technicians, IT Managers, Network Professionals, Network Security Professionals, Telecommunications Specialists and undergraduate/graduate students. NIE is seeking graduate level students looking for a challenging paid internship. Each selected candidate will be provided with a mentor and be assigned to a team based on their skills and interests and on the needs of the organization. The division is organized within five groups and provides the following services:

Configuration and Development Services (NIE-CDS) - provides enterprise level configuration management, vulnerability patching and remediation, and system and software development needed for those services.
Infrastructure Services (NIE-IS) - responsible for providing unclassified and classified institutional compute and storage, operating systems (OS) support for Laboratory business systems, institutional network services, and managing the institutional datacenters.
Engineering and Security Services (NIE-ESS) - responsible for the Lab's classified and unclassified institutional network services and for the security of the institutional network infrastructure.
Core Services (NIE-CS) - provides production systems for the division. A primary responsibility of this group is managing infrastructure for LANL’s Enterprise information technology applications.
Telecommunication Services (NIE-TS) - provides telecommunication technologies and services enabling science, programs, and operations at LANL. The group provides the entire Lab with voice, wireless, data, and video communication services.

Essential Job Functions (can perform with or without reasonable accommodation): See guidance at: http://int.lanl.gov/employees/staffing-guidance/hr-process-guide/hiring-process/posting-a-job/requirements.shtml

Work Environment: See guidance at: http://int.lanl.gov/employees/staffing-guidance/hr-process-guide/hiring-process/posting-a-job/requirements.shtml

What You Need

Minimum Job Requirements:
  • Currently enrolled in an accredited graduate degree program in any Information Technology
discipline (or equivalent), to include:
o Administrator (database or computer systems)

o Analyst (information security or computer systems)

o Big Data

o Computer Engineering

o Computer Networking

o Computer Programmer

o Computer Science

o Cyber Security

o Developer (software or web)

o IT Management

o Management Information Systems

o Network Engineer

  • Must be enrolled in at least 6 semester credit hours (or full-time equivalent). Entering graduate students must provide documentation indicating matriculation into a graduate degree program.
  • Must currently have and maintain a cumulative GPA of at least 3.2 on a 4.0 scale (or equivalent).
Desired Skills:
  • Relevant work experience
Note to Applicants:
Along with your resume, please include a detailed cover letter explaining how you meet each of the minimum requirements and any of the desired qualifications.

Location: This position will be part of the Laboratory’s Telework Pilot and may work from a remote/home location within a two-hour ground commute of the Laboratory. The Telework Pilot is in effect from Oct. 1, 2020 through Sept. 30, 2021, but may be shortened or extended at the manager’s discretion. Ability to report on-site is a must for this position.

Where You Will Work

Located in northern New Mexico, Los Alamos National Laboratory (LANL) is a multidisciplinary research institution engaged in strategic science on behalf of national security. LANL enhances national security by ensuring the safety and reliability of the U.S. nuclear stockpile, developing technologies to reduce threats from weapons of mass destruction, and solving problems related to energy, environment, infrastructure, health, and global security concerns.

The Network and Infrastructure Engineering (NIE) Division manages the network, telecommunications, collaboration, cyber defenses, and virtual computing infrastructure for the Laboratory. NIE is seeking graduate level students looking for a challenging paid internship for the current academic year and/or summer. Each selected candidate will be provided with a mentor and be assigned to a team based on their skills and interests and on the needs of the organization.

Additional Details

No Clearance: Position does not require a security clearance. Selected candidates will be subject to drug testing and other pre-employment background checks.

New-Employment Drug Test: The Laboratory requires successful applicants to complete a new-employment drug test and maintains a substance abuse policy that includes random drug testing.

For general program information refer to the Student Programs web page.

Internal Applicants: Regular appointment employees who have served the required period of continuous service in their current position are eligible to apply for posted jobs throughout the Laboratory. If an employee has not served the required period of continuous service, they may only apply for Laboratory jobs with the documented approval of their Division Leader. Please refer to Policy Policy P701 for applicant eligibility requirements.

Equal Opportunity: Los Alamos National Laboratory is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse and inclusive workforce. All employment practices are based on qualification and merit, without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, religion, age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation or preference, marital status or spousal affiliation, physical or mental disability, medical conditions, pregnancy, status as a protected veteran, genetic information, or citizenship within the limits imposed by federal laws and regulations. The Laboratory is also committed to making our workplace accessible to individuals with disabilities and will provide reasonable accommodations, upon request, for individuals to participate in the application and hiring process. To request such an accommodation, please send an email to applyhelp@lanl.gov or call 1-505-665-4444 option 1.

Instructions on How to Activate/Create a LANL Jobs Account:

Click the Vacancy Name number (in blue) to view any job’s details.

position: Intern to support Charitable Needs in the Philippines & Filipino Community
description:
Full Job Description

Nonprofit Virtual / Remote Internships and Volunteer Opportunities

Charitable Needs in the Philippines and in the Filipino Community

Our nonprofit offers an outstanding opportunity to use your skills, gain experience, enhance your resume, and make a tremendous positive social impact on the causes or communities you care about, including charitable needs in the Philippines and in the Filipino Community.

Who Is It For?

We welcome:

  • Professionals who want to volunteer part-time
  • "Dependent Spouses" of H1-B, F1, and L1 visa holders
  • Recent graduates, including international students on OPT
  • Undergraduate and graduate school students, including international students on CPT, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador
  • Outstanding high school students, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

Unpaid / Credit for Students

As a nonprofit our Internships are unpaid. They are eligible for credit from many schools, and we are happy to do our part to meet the school's requirements.

Time Commitment

Those with busy schedules and just 4 hours per week available can join us as Public Engagement Interns.

Those with more time can join us as part-time or full-time interns.

When

We are always hiring: school year or summer; full-time or part-time.

About Us

ChangingThePresent.org is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit. The New York Times called us an “Amazon.com of the nonprofit world.”

We make the experience of a donation, which you can give in a friend’s name, feel like a rewarding present and an appealing alternative to buying and giving yet more unwanted "stuff." In this way, we are starting to channel to nonprofits some of the $450 billion Americans spend each year buying birthday, wedding, holiday, and corporate presents. Imagine how much good we could all do together as more of that money goes to making a difference.

  • Our visitors can contribute to provide school children with their first book, preserve an acre of the wilderness, fund an hour of cancer research, etc.
  • Wish lists and registries let them share their dreams for a better world.
  • Personalized greeting cards make a charitable gift especially memorable. Gift cards let friends support the things they care about.

We already work with hundreds of the most prestigious nonprofits in the country, and we are now opening the site to all nonprofits so they can all attract additional funding for their important missions. Among those we want to add are those that address charitable needs in the Philippines and in the Filipino Community.

You can also choose to focus on your favorite causes (including education, hunger, women, children, cancer, human rights, environment, women, veterans, etc.) or the charitable needs of any ethnic group, religious group, city, or country.

Unprecedented Opportunities for Responsibility and Leadership

Our interns and volunteers get more responsibility than they would anywhere else. You can take a leadership role.

Interns and Volunteers Focused on Charitable Needs in the Philippines (and for any cause) will do the following:

  • Identify, research, prioritize, and invite potential Advisors and Experts.
  • Identify, research, prioritize, and invite nonprofits, who can register and list their charitable gifts at no cost. The opportunity for them is discussed in the slideshow on this page: ChangingThePresent.org/pages/for-nonprofits
  • Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch magazines, websites, blogs, professional organizations, social media channels, online communities, and other ways to reach people who care about each specific cause.
  • Identify, research, and pitch strategic partners for the cause.
  • Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch sources of growth funding (philanthropists, corporations, or foundations)
  • Conceive of and create cause marketing sponsorship proposals.
  • Identify and invite the promotional support of celebrities who support the cause/community.

Focus on Ethnic, Religious, City, or Country Communities

We also have opportunities to focus on the charitable needs of any ethnic, religious, city, or country communities.

Opportunities for Most Areas of Academic / Professional Focus

We also have positions that align with a wide range of academic and professional fields, including business development, analytics, finance, accounting, technology, web development, Salesforce, database, computer science, science, STEM education, marketing, digital marketing, communications, social media, publishing, Human Resources, organizational psychology, research, education, and graphics.

You Benefit

We want all our interns to get the following from their experience here:

  • Make a tremendous positive impact in the world.
  • Use your skills, experience, knowledge, creativity and talent.
  • Assume responsibility and take a leadership role.
  • Learn a tremendous amount.
  • Have a great time working with people from around the world in a diverse and supportive community.
  • Enhance your resume with a record of professional achievement and community service.
  • Receive a great letter of recommendation.

When

We welcome full-time and part-time interns during the school year and/or the summer. We are entrepreneurial and flexible, and we are always hiring.

Where

We are all working remotely during the pandemic.

More Info

Please review these:

  • the slideshow on this page, which provides an overview of internships here: ChangingThePresent.org/pages/interns-and-volunteers
  • the comments from current and former interns about the experience here: ChangingThePresent.org/reviews

How to Apply

For Public Engagement Interns (as little as 4 hours per week), please see

ChangingThePresent.org/pages/college-public-engagement-interns, and use the application form there.

For those with more time, we have part-time and full-time internships. Please see ChangingThePresent.org/join , then send a short cover note and resume to the email address provided there.

We will get back to you very quickly.

Please Share

We hope you will also share this opportunity with anyone who might be interested.

Thank you very much!

description:

description:
Full Job Description
Organization:
The Bail Project is a national nonprofit designed to combat mass incarceration by disrupting the money bail system one person at a time. The Bail Project’s National Revolving Bail Fund provides free bail assistance to low-income individuals who are legally presumed innocent, and whom a judge has deemed eligible for release before trial contingent on paying bail. We enable our clients to return home to their families and communities while awaiting their court dates, connect them with community organizations that can assist them in accessing resources, and provide reminders and assistance to ensure that clients return to court for their court dates.

The Intern Program:
The Intern Program invites members of the community, 18 or older, to intern with The Bail Project. All individuals who intern with TBP will be members of a cohort. All interns will be expected to participate in educational opportunities, community-building events, and other cohort activities. Interns will be expected to work 10-15 hours a week based on their availability. All interns will begin work on August 30, 2021. This is a hard start date and we encourage all candidates to consider this requirement carefully.

Position Summary:
TBP is seeking an individual with an interest in criminal legal system reform and improving outcomes for incarcerated and returning community members to assist with several data and research projects to improve TBP’s knowledge of system operations and community resources. This individual will also provide data input support by utilizing Salesforce.

Hours: 10-15 hours per week, flexible schedule

Term: August - November 2021

Start Date: 8/30/21

End Date: 11/30/21

Reports to: Volunteer and Intern Coordinator

Compensation: $15 an hour.

Responsibilities:
Document team referrals to social service providers in Salesforce.

Document client experiences with social service providers in Salesforce.

Use case lookup system to vet potential clients and provide recommendations to Bail Disruptors

Use court records and client records to improve TBP understanding of which clients retained private attorneys rather than public defenders and the impact that had on their cases.

Use court records and client records to determine which judges set bail for TBP clients.

Analyze and present preliminary findings on the degree to which judicial discretion plays a role in determining initial bail affordability and subsequent bail forfeitures for TBP clients.

Research client criminal backgrounds to understand past charges in relation to current charges.

Develop a list of community institutions and direct service agencies throughout TBP’s service area that may be willing to partner with TBP in providing support for TBP clients, advocate for the use of said institutions and agencies to the team, and add to the database within Salesforce.

Research and connect with activist organizations working on criminal justice reform that clients may be interested in joining and advocate for the value in promoting said organizations.

Participate in cohort events geared towards social justice, policy, nonprofit management, etc.

Engage in weekly or bi-weekly check-ins with supervisor to evaluate progress, identify next steps, etc.

Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:
You are driven, highly organized, and have a deep commitment to The Bail Project’s mission to eliminate race- and wealth-based disparities in our criminal justice system. We’re looking for someone who is comfortable working independently or in a team-based setting, and with a strong commitment to our clients.

To excel in this role, you likely bring the following:
Passion for understanding and changing the system of mass incarceration and criminal justice

Familiarity or personal experience with the local criminal justice system a plus

Strong communication skills

Interest in data or computer science

Basic computer skills and familiarity with spreadsheet software (Google Sheets or Microsoft Excel preferred)

Some experience with quantitative research

Well-organized and professional

Familiarity with Salesforce a plus

How to Apply:
Interested applicants should submit a resume and cover letter. In the cover letter, please address the following:

Why do you want to intern with The Bail Project?

Please share 1-2 experiences that highlight why you would be a strong candidate for this internship and how you meet the qualifications for the position.

No emails, faxes, or phone calls, please. Applicants will be notified regarding whether or not they have been selected for an interview. Applications without cover letters will not be processed.

Only candidates who live within a 90-minute radius of Augusta will be considered for this role.

The Bail Project is proud to be an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and actively seeks the candidacy of people of color, women, LGBTQIA people, and formerly incarcerated individuals. We are committed to inclusive hiring and dedicated to diversity in our work and staff.

Note: This position should ideally be filled by an undergraduate or graduate student, someone directly or indirectly impacted by the bail system, or an individual coming from an internship-providing institution.

Full Job Description
We are seeking an energetic, responsible intern to join our growing organization. In this position, you will be expected to learn the ins-and-outs of our daily routines and procedures. You will focus on learning how our organization runs.

Position Overview

This position will responsible for supporting the technology team of an organization in designing computer systems, modifying networks, and resolving technical issues.

Key Responsibilities

  • Assist in performing hardware and software installation procedures
  • Perform software configuration on stand-alone computers and laptops
  • Provide support in diagnosing hardware and software issues and troubleshooting activities
  • Assist in handling data migration duties
  • Document all processes in reference manuals for training and guidance
  • Take user support requests and take measures to fulfill requests
  • Assist in hardware and software inventory management
  • Handle periodic maintenance of hardware and software
  • Troubleshoot equipment such as printers and scanners and other peripherals
  • Participate in the development of software applications
  • Handle researching options and research computer bugs and their solutions
  • Take telephone calls from users and attempt to assist them with their information technology questions and problems
  • Assist in gathering user requirements and developing appropriate reports for IT professionals
  • Provide users with ongoing assistance in their information technology problems
  • Create a presentation on internship experience, projects, and outcomes and present to department leadership.
Position Requirements

Essential (Must Have):
  • Ability to problem solve

Full Job Description
Precision Strip, Inc., the leader in the metal coil processing industry, is seeking qualified candidates for an IT Software Co-Op position that is based out of our Headquarters location in Minster, Ohio. The primary responsibility of this position will involve analysis, design and development of new systems, as well as provide maintenance and support to our custom software.

At Precision Strip, our systems are considered a source of competitive advantage in the market space, and our team is often sought after to architect innovative solutions that improve productivity and quality. Qualified candidates will be working towards a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, MIS, Information Technology or an equivalent with a 3.0 or greater GPA requirement. Other qualifications include: a strong knowledge of computer programming, analytical skills, communication skills, teamwork, attention to detail, creativity, and an appreciation of the bigger business picture.

This IT Co-op is for a student interested in working approximately 40 hours per week during the fall semester starting in August 2021.

Precision Strip is a drug free workplace and an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

Applications may be completed online at www.precision-strip.com/careers.

Learn more about Precision Strip by visiting www.precision-strip.com.

Precision Strip...Doing The Exceptional

position: Intern: Driver Electronics and Vehicle Connectivity
description:
Full Job Description
United States

Position Description

Introduction:
In Driver Electronics and Vehicle connectivity (DEVC) we are in the heart of the digital transformation inside the truck industry. We develop Driver related electronic devices such as instrument clusters, body comfort systems, cameras, secondary information displays and also connectivity solutions, android systems, apps. We also work with implementing HMI for this devices and apps.

Connectivity is a key enabler for fleet management, uptime services and advanced vehicle services like driver assistance and fuel reduction, targeting reduced costs as well as increased revenues. Our android based service and entertainment system is enabling new features in the entertainment productivity and uptime field.

The development in the area of driver electronics and vehicle connectivity is fast, furious and fun!

Would you like to use your passion in the automotive industry and be part of the digital transformation leap? Would you like to work in a great team with competent and helpful colleagues? We have a place for you!
We are now looking for potential and prospective candidates for 2021 fall internship. This program offers a great learning environment combined with hands-on work experience which will complement your academic knowledge.

What will you do:
You will work on some interesting real development projects guided by experienced colleagues, giving you an opportunity to learn about our development processes, be part of solving real problems, get answers to a lot of questions.
Work on your own project which will support our ongoing continuous improvement initiatives.
Learn about truck functionalities and understand how a truck is different from a passenger car.
Visit factories and see how trucks are built.
Network with a lot of professionals from other functions and get career guidance.
Great opportunity to enhance your interpersonal, communication and leadership skills by working with people from highly diverse backgrounds.

Who you are:
Must be currently enrolled and pursuing a degree in Electrical/Electronics/Computer science/ Automotive /Robotics engineering at an accredited school and have completed 30 semester hours of undergraduate studies prior to the start of the internship.
Has strong engineering basics and fundamentals
Experience with any programming language (graphical or script based) – coding and software design
Project experience involving design of electronics systems preferably utilizing Micro-controllers, sensors, actuators, communication modules to solve a real life problem.
Innovative and think out of the box.
Familiar with Microsoft office products.
Ability to gather, analyze and present scientific information;
Team player and ability to lead with good interpersonal and communication skills;
Willing to work up to 30 hours per week for the full program duration;
Applicants must have a minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.0;
Valid US Work authorization;

About us

The Volvo Group drives prosperity through transport solutions, offering trucks, buses, construction equipment, power solutions for marine and industrial applications, financing and services that increase our customers’ uptime and productivity. Founded in 1927, the Volvo Group is committed to shaping the future landscape of sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions. Countless career opportunities are offered across the group’s leading brands and entities that share a culture of Trust, Passion, High Performance, Change and Customer Success.
www.volvogroup.com/career.

Volvo Group Trucks Technology provides Volvo Group Trucks and Business Area's with state-of-the-art research, cutting-edge engineering, product planning and purchasing services, as well as aftermarket product support. With Volvo Group Trucks Technology you will be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals who work with passion, trust each other and embrace change to stay ahead. We make our customers win.

Full Job Description
Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in the Duck Creek Suite (Policy, Billing, Insights).
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.
Provide product support and maintenance for products in production.
Participate in developing documentation and job aid documents.

We are looking for candidates with…

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT and XPath.
Experience in with the C#, .NET programming language.
Experience with Angular frontend framework and JavaScript is preferred.
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

Full Job Description
Mobile App Tester will be responsible for QA on Android Applications that are delivered through the Digital Turbine Ignite Platform. This individual will interact with business teams and technical teams to ensure that all applications meet the requirements of Digital Turbine. This person will thoroughly test each application by executing a defined test plan and documenting all results.

Key Responsibilities:
Execute test cases to verify bug-free functionality of new and existing features
Focus on finding, reporting, and reproducing bugs with Android applications
Document all test results including application features and functionality into internal data
Communicate issues and bugs to internal management chain
Working directly with internal cross functional teams and communicate testing results as necessary

Qualifications:
Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal
Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
Team-oriented with excellent interpersonal skills
Familiar with Android games and apps
Great attention to detail

Preferred Qualifications:
Android system test experience.
Knowledge of a programming language like Java.
A Computer Science major.
Interested in automation/grey box testing.
Command line experience.

Reasons to Work for Digital Turbine:
We’re a leader in an evolving industry – The mobile app business is booming and changing every day, which means that we are always adapting to stay ahead of the curve.
Take an Opportunity to work with the industry’s top talent – Many of our employees have over a decade’s worth of experience in the mobile app space. We are a company of ‘A’ players and only look for the best people to join our team.
We live our values – We regularly Laugh and applaud our Results with our Global partners.
We’re a company that values diversity & inclusion. Everyone has a voice and can make their mark – Every employee has the opportunity to implement new processes, design new programs, and be creative within their unique role.
High Growth—We’re growing quickly, which gives our employees exciting opportunities to take on new challenges and have a significant impact on the company’s future.
Flexible work environment – Employees enjoy coming to work in jeans, working in an open environment, and lounging on couches with their laptop. We offer an unlimited vacation policy too! We work hard but respect our employee’s work/life balance and general well-being. Freedom is one of our values.
Company Equity- All employees are expected to make an impact, so everyone is granted stock options when they join the company.
Equitable Compensation—we believe in every employee’s impact, giving every employee annual stock option awards, a bonus that is based on both individual and company performance and we pay a basic Living Wage.
When we say global, we mean it—Digital Turbine has 6 physical locations around the world and employees in more than 10 countries.
We fuel your “tank”—In addition to a great job with great people, our office kitchens are stocked with plenty of snacks and drinks to help get you through each day.
Beer Fridays—Every Friday afternoon, the company breaks away from work to come together and unwind after a busy week. Enjoy coffee, tea, juices, soda and water anytime.

Employment decisions are based on the principles of equal opportunity and affirmative action; without regard to race, creed, color, sex, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Full Job Description
Position Summary

As an IT Co-Op candidate you will assist in helpdesk functions to support most areas of Information Technology’s (IT) responsibility. The candidate will need to complete setups, troubleshoot and resolve problems with hardware/software for desktop/laptops/printers, as well as, upgrade software/hardware. Utilize helpdesk systems to address open help requests, interact with end users, problem solve and disposition. The candidate must be a motivated, self-starter with a good foundation in the basic principles of computer science, as demonstrated by their course work and/or extra-curricular activities. Course work or experience in one or more of the following areas is preferred: computer and communication technology, computer security, networks, databases and hardware. An individual must be detail oriented and able to manage multiple projects. Must have good organizational, communication, interpersonal, analytical, skills. Needs to be punctual. This is a paid full-time Co-Op. 40 hours a week with flexibility in schedule to continue college studies.

Responsibilities

  • Setup, deploy, troubleshoot and resolve desktop/laptop, printers, PC Software and telecom issues. • Configure new software, Upgrade OS software, etc. • Utilize help desk system to address day to day user requests • Follow safety procedures on shop floor and maintain a safe work area
Qualifications

The successful candidate must be currently enrolled in a four year college working towards a bachelor degree in Computer Science or Business. Completion of sophomore year of college with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0. Must have Microsoft Office and Microsoft OS knowledge and experience with desktop/laptop hardware.

Parker Hannifin

Founded in 1917, Parker Hannifin Corporation is a $13.7 billion, global company. With annual sales of $13.7 billion in fiscal year 2020, Parker Hannifin is the world's leading diversified manufacturer of motion and control technologies and systems, providing precision-engineered solutions for a wide variety of mobile, industrial and aerospace markets. The company has operations in 49 countries around the world. Parker has increased its annual dividends paid to shareholders for 63 consecutive fiscal years, among the top five longest-running dividend-increase records in the S&P 500 index. Parker’s engineering expertise and broad range of core technologies uniquely positions the company to solve some of the world’s greatest engineering challenges. By partnering with customers, Parker improves their productivity and profitability and seeks new ways to solve humanity's biggest challenges.

Full Job Description
Leading the future of luxury mobility

Lucid’s mission is to inspire the adoption of sustainable energy by creating the most captivating luxury electric vehicles, centered around the human experience. Working at Lucid Motors means having a shared vision to power the future in revolutionary ways. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the automotive industry.

The technical publications internship offers the chance for students or recent graduates to get hands-on experience creating and managing content for the next generation of electric vehicles at Lucid.

Lucid’s paid interns will work alongside the Technical Publications team in support of its department-specific goal: we transform complex information into content that helps end-users perform the correct action.

Along the way, you’ll learn much about how an electric vehicle is transformed from an idea on a whiteboard to a vehicle in a customer’s driveway. Lucid interns will be immersed in a work environment that’s supportive of curiosity, encourages independent problem-solving, and provides many opportunities to learn new skills.
Responsibilities
Review, design, write and edit technical and process documentation. (That’s kind of in the job title, isn’t it? Tech writers need to write stuff.)
Learn and compile documentation using the DITA XML specification. (The focus is on the documentation content more than the look and feel.)
Learn and apply Lucid standards for clarity, style, and terminology.
Generate and manage images using CAD modeling tools.
Meet with subject matter experts in several of Lucid’s Service and Engineering departments.
Track work with project management tools: tickets, project dashboards, Kanban boards, etc.
Understand and participate in documentation lifecycle management.
Qualifications
Associate’s, Bachelor’s, or Post-Secondary Degree in Journalism, Computer Science, Creative Writing or related fields (Recent graduates are eligible up to 12 months after graduation.
Excellent writing and editing skills
Demonstrable organization and detail-oriented skill
A mindset that enjoys new challenges and solving problems
Expertise with Microsoft Office: Word, Outlook, Excel, OneNote, PowerPoint – you’ll learn other authoring tools and platforms while you’re here; it’s expected that you have MS Office knowhow on day one.
Preferred Qualifications
If you’re fluent in French or Arabic, please mention it on the resume. Lucid is a global company, and documentation needs to be translated.
Experience with XML, or knowledge of the DITA XML specification
Experience with CAD tools
Previous experience relating to journalism (ie. writing for a school newspaper) is a plus
Project management or other operational experience

Please include with your application:
Résumé
Portfolio / writing samples
Relevant courses taken while in school
Other
Programming Timing: September 7th – November 26th, 2021 (12 weeks); End date can be extended up to December 23rd, 2021 based on individual needs; Some flexibility with start date is available if needed
Availability: Full-time and Part-Time available
Location: This position is in Newark, CA. You must be prepared to start on site for your first day of employment
Work Environment: Production Lab
Anticipated Hours: 8:30 am – 5:30 pm
Compensation: Student compensation is based on location and current degree level, non-negotiable
Visa Sponsorship: Lucid may but is not obligated to sponsor foreign national employees requiring company sponsorship for U.S. employment authorization
Medical benefits: Dental and vision on day 1 for all interns working 30+ hours a week; medical for interns in California working 30+ hours a week
Housing: No compensation for housing
Bonus: No signing bonus, relocation bonus, equity, or other bonuses currently
Relocation: Round trip flight from/to permanent residence
Housing/Transportation: You must provide your own living arrangements and transportation in the local area
Background Check: All offers of employment are contingent on clearing a background check
Publications: This internship may involve access to and/or knowledge of Lucid confidential and proprietary information. As a requirement of accepting an offer of employment with Lucid Motors, you will agree to keep all such information confidential and not disclose such information to any third party including but not limited to research papers, thesis, dissertation, school papers, or any other publication in any form without prior written approval from Lucid Legal Department.
Be part of something amazing

Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.

At Lucid, we don’t just welcome diversity - we celebrate it! Lucid Motors is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.

To all recruitment agencies: Lucid Motors does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias or other Lucid Motors employees. Lucid Motors is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Full Job Description
Leading the future of luxury mobility

Lucid’s mission is to inspire the adoption of sustainable energy by creating the most captivating luxury electric vehicles, centered around the human experience. Working at Lucid Motors means having a shared vision to power the future in revolutionary ways. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the automotive industry.

We are currently seeking an Intern, Technical Program Manager. This position requires an experienced professional who has a passion for EV’s and can work cross functionally to help consolidate program updates. Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches his or her work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment.

Role/Responsibilities:
Preparing Program Schedules
Consolidating weekly program updates
Designing and implementing online repository for program updates

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Atlassian tool chain
Experience with Excel
Great communicator
Flexible and can-do attitude

Education:
Field(s) of study: Industrial Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or Related Major
Will consider undergrads Sophomore level and above: Associate’s, Bachelor’s, Post-Secondary
Graduates are eligible for this internship up to 12 months after graduation

Programming Timing:
Start Date: September 7th, 2021
End Date: November 26th- December 23rd
Our internship program is 12-16 weeks; end date is flexible based on individual needs.
Some flexibility with start date is available as needed.

Other:
Location: This position is in Newark, CA. You must be prepared to start onsite for your first day of employment
Availability: Full – Time is preferred
Anticipated Hours: 8:30am – 5:30pm
Work Environment: Mix - Split between: Office/ Lab/ Bay
Compensation: Student compensation is based on location and current degree level, non-negotiable.
Visa Sponsorship: Lucid may but is not obligated to sponsor foreign national employees requiring company sponsorship for U.S. employment authorization.
Medical benefits: Dental and vision on day 1 for all interns working 30+ hours a week; medical for interns in California working 30+ hours a week.
Housing: No compensation for housing.
Bonus: No signing bonus, relocation bonus, equity, or other bonuses.
Relocation: Round trip flight from/to permanent residence.
Housing/Transportation: You must provide your own living arrangements and transportation in the local area.
Background Check: All offers of employment are contingent on clearing a background check.
Publications: This internship may involve access to and/or knowledge of Lucid confidential and proprietary information. As a requirement of accepting an offer of employment with Lucid Motors you will agree to keep all such information confidential and not disclose such information to any third party including but not limited to research papers, thesis, dissertation, school papers or any other publication in any form without prior written approval from Lucid Legal Department.
Be part of something amazing

Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.

At Lucid, we don’t just welcome diversity - we celebrate it! Lucid Motors is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.

To all recruitment agencies: Lucid Motors does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias or other Lucid Motors employees. Lucid Motors is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Full Job Description
Our vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life. Join an inclusive team passionate about one thing: using their expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. The solutions we build help make everything from virtual reality experiences to breakthroughs in neural networks possible. We do it all while committing to integrity, sustainability, and giving back to our communities. Because doing so can fuel the very innovation we are pursuing.

As an engineering intern in the compact modeling team at Micron Technology, Inc., you will support technology and product development by authoring automation of semiconductor device tests and simulations to evaluate accuracy of simulations. During your internship, you will have the opportunity to work with compact modeling, device characterization, and reliability engineers.

Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
Automation and report generation for simulation to hardware analysis;
Utilize statistical methods to identifying key hardware to simulation gaps;
Report your findings to our engineering teams in a collaborative environment;

Qualifications:
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written;
Ability to independently adapt & learn;
Background in solid state physics, semiconductor processing and device characterization;
Knowledgeable in a variety of software tools and operating systems, including but not limited to:
Python/Pandas
PERL
C/C++
JMP/JSL
Strong data analysis skills and experience in automating data analysis methods;
Familiarity with spice simulation and layout platforms and EDA tools including, but not limited to:
HSPICE
FINESIM
Cadence Virtuoso Schematic Editor
Synopsis StarRC
Familiarity with operation of semiconductor instrumentation including, but not limited to:
Parameter analyzers, SPA, SMU
LCR meters
Network analyzers
Oscilloscopes
Pulse & waveform generators
Wafer probers

Education Requirements:
  • Working towards completion of Bachelor’s, Master’s degree or PhD in the following areas: electrical engineering, computer science, physics or related discipline.
About Micron Technology, Inc.
We are an industry leader in innovative memory and storage solutions. Through our global brands – Micron® and Crucial® – our broad portfolio of high-performance memory and storage technologies, including DRAM, NAND, 3D XPoint™ memory and NOR, is transforming how the world uses information to enrich life. Backed by more than 40 years of technology leadership, our memory and storage solutions enable disruptive trends, including artificial intelligence, 5G, machine learning and autonomous vehicles, in key market segments like mobile, data center, client, consumer, industrial, graphics, automotive, and networking. Our common stock is traded on the Nasdaq under the MU symbol. To learn more visit micron.com/careers.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

For US Sites Only: To request assistance with the application process and/or for reasonable accommodations, please contact Micron’s Human Resources Department at 1-800-336-8918 or 208-368-4748 and/or by completing our General Contact Form

Located in Cleveland, Ohio, the company has been in business for over twenty-five years. In addition, The Freedonia Group’s industry market research is considered an authoritative source by the world’s leading publications and has been featured in nearly every relevant trade publication.

We are currently looking to hire a tech-related intern, to help provide remote and on-site support for our employees. The successful candidate will also gain a wide variety of hands-on experience in a multitude of areas.

· Organize and maintain IT Resources.

JOB
ExemptJob Announcement Preparation and Credentialing Intern$16 hourlyAgency profile: We believe that the success of Washington’s students depends on the success of Washington’s educators. At the Professional Educator Standards Board (PESB), we oversee the preparation and certification of Washington’s P-12 educators.We are one agency with two governing Boards: the Professional Educator Standards Board and the Paraeducator Board. Our board members and staff are committed to ensuring all Washington students learn from highly effective educators within the education system. We focus on educator quality, workforce diversity, and policy innovation by creating policy, administering grants, workgroups, and pilot projects.In addition to serving as the state’s educator licensure board, we oversee approval and review of all educator preparation programs. Our agency values serve as a foundational framework for advancing this work. We prioritize diversifying the educator workforce and addressing educator shortages through programs focused on pathways into the profession, strengthening the assessment system, and supporting recruitment, retention, and professional growth efforts.We value: Educator voiceDiversity, equity, and inclusionEducator excellence for student successCommunity engagementLearning and InnovationTo operate as an antiracist agency, we seek candidates aligned with these values. Position overview: The 2021 Washington state legislature directed PESB to develop two new specialty endorsements: elementary computer science and secondary computer science. The legislature also provided funding for PESB to administer grants to organizations to support educators inprofessional learning and credentialing in computer science. This position, located in Olympia, Washington, will play a key role in development of policy and implementation relating to this computer science legislation.. This position reports to the Associate Director of Preparation and Credentialing, and is mentored by the Program manager for professional learning and program support. The intern will work closely with the Preparation and Credentialing team.Key responsibilities: The primary responsibilities of this position will be co-facilitating a workgroup of external stakeholders to develop computer science essential learnings, and supporting grantee organization leaders. Leaders and stakeholders could include legislators, technology organization leaders, state agency staff, community organization leaders, educators including district administrators, higher education faculty, tribal school leaders, educational service district superintendents, as well as others in leadership positions.Collaborate with PESB preparation and credentialing team staff as they review, develop, and implement computer science education policy as directed by the Washington State legislature and the Board.Collaborate with PESB Preparation and Credentialing team staff on implementation and facilitation of a workgroup of stakeholders to develop essential learning for computer science specialty endorsements. Work with PESB staff on presenting these essential learnings to the Board.Collaborate with PESB Preparation and Credentialing team staff on implementation of PESB’s professional learning grant, including: Supporting grantees from the grant launch through closing including conducting (virtual) site visits, responding to organization questions via phone or email and providing resources.Collecting final grant reports from grantees and participants and compiling and analyzing data from the reports.Collaborating with PESB Preparation and Credentialing team staff to create and publish a final grant report, and present this report at PESB’s July Board meeting.Who you are: A self-motivated leader with the following: Ability to integrate diversity, inclusion, cultural responsiveness, and equity into policy and implementation, through functions, processes, and materialsExcellent communication skillsAbility to develop and maintaining positive, supportive relationships with grantee organization leadersGood organizational skillsAbility to learn new technologiesAbility to work remotely for both independent work and collaborative workAdaptability and flexibility to adjust approach and style to varied circumstances, audiences, and timeline requirementsRequired qualifications: Currently enrolled in a Master’s in Education Policy programAbility to co-create with your colleagues a welcoming, supportive, safe, affirming, and respectful work environmentAbility to engage and support respectful dialogue and courageous conversations even when uncomfortableAbility to participate in continuous learning, development and training offered in the areas of diversity, inclusion, cultural humility, oppression, and equityEmploy a range of problem-solving strategies with self and others for agency advancementExperience working productively with diverse groups across categories of differenceAbility to work effectively in a team environment under tight timelinesDesired qualifications: Knowledge of state policy issues specifically related to public education and certified education professionalsKnowledge or interest in computer science or STEM (science, technology, engineering, math) educationExperience working with P-12 or higher educationPassion for the mission of PESBCompensationThis position serves at the pleasure of the Executive Director of the Professional Educator Standards Board and is exempt from civil service laws. Compensation is $16 hourly. The intern will work up to 18 hours per week through July 31, 2021. Application ProcessThose interested in this position must apply through Careers.wa.gov. Applications must include the following documents in MS Word and PDF format only: A letter of interest specifically addressing the qualifications listed in this announcement; A current résumé;A sample of a data project completed by the candidate, and;A list of three or more professional references. Please address any questions to: Carole Lynch, Human ResourcesOffice of Superintendent of Public Instruction600 Washington Street SoutheastOlympia, Washington 98504-7200(360) 725-6270; Carole.Lynch@k12.wa.us Persons needing accommodation in the application process or this announcement in an alternative format may contact the Human Resources Office at (360) 725-6270 or (360) 725-6066, or e-mail hroffice@k12.wa.us. New Jobs Alert ServiceOSPI offers a subscription service, which regularly notifies subscribers of new OSPI employment opportunities on careers.wa.gov. Subscribers are notified via text or email alert. If you are interested in this service, then please subscribe at this location. OSPI is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from job seekers who will contribute to our diversity. OSPI provides equal access to all programs and services without discrimination based on sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, age, honorably discharged veteran or military status, sexual orientation including gender expression or identity, the presence of any sensory, mental, or physical disability, or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal by a person with a disability. Full Job Description
Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in the Duck Creek Suite (Policy, Billing, Insights).
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.
Provide product support and maintenance for products in production.
Participate in developing documentation and job aid documents.

We are looking for candidates with…

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT and XPath.
Experience in with the C#, .NET programming language.
Experience with Angular frontend framework and JavaScript is preferred.
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

MedPro Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Full Job Description
Leading the future of luxury mobility

Lucid’s mission is to inspire the adoption of sustainable energy by creating the most captivating luxury electric vehicles, centered around the human experience. Working at Lucid Motors means having a shared vision to power the future in revolutionary ways. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the automotive industry.

We are actively seeking a Software Development Intern to support our Commerce Systems team. This position requires an enthusiastic professional with an interest in developing the best experience for our online visitors. Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches his or her work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities
Project may include working on Lucid’s online store and systems to configure, order and pay for our cars
Develop new features and functionality to support Lucid’s e-commerce business
Work on projects cross-functionally with our web development team, enterprise systems, and our retail, sales, delivery, and service business teams
Qualifications
Associate’s, Bachelor’s, or Post-Secondary Degree in Computer Science or related fields (Recent graduates are eligible up to 12 months after graduation)
Prior experience in the workplace or classroom developing in Java, Javascript, Kotlin, or NodeJS and working with or developing REST APIs
Full-stack software development experience including database is a plus
Knowledge of AWS, DevOps, or CI/CD. E-commerce experience is a plus
Possession of a Post-Secondary Degree or working towards it is preferred
Other
Programming Timing: September 7th – November 26th, 2021 (12 weeks); End date can be extended up to December 23rd, 2021 based on individual needs; Some flexibility with start date is available if needed
Availability: Full-time preferred but Part-Time available
Location: This position is in Newark, CA. You must be prepared to start on site for your first day of employment
Work Environment: In Office
Anticipated Hours: 8:30 am – 5:30 pm
Compensation: Student compensation is based on location and current degree level, non-negotiable
Visa Sponsorship: Lucid may but is not obligated to sponsor foreign national employees requiring company sponsorship for U.S. employment authorization
Medical benefits: Dental and vision on day 1 for all interns working 30+ hours a week; medical for interns in California working 30+ hours a week
Housing: No compensation for housing
Bonus: No signing bonus, relocation bonus, equity, or other bonuses currently
Relocation: Round trip flight from/to permanent residence
Housing/Transportation: You must provide your own living arrangements and transportation in the local area
Background Check: All offers of employment are contingent on clearing a background check
Publications: This internship may involve access to and/or knowledge of Lucid confidential and proprietary information. As a requirement of accepting an offer of employment with Lucid Motors, you will agree to keep all such information confidential and not disclose such information to any third party including but not limited to research papers, thesis, dissertation, school papers, or any other publication in any form without prior written approval from Lucid Legal Department.
Be part of something amazing

Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.

At Lucid, we don’t just welcome diversity - we celebrate it! Lucid Motors is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.

To all recruitment agencies: Lucid Motors does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias or other Lucid Motors employees. Lucid Motors is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

position: Core Data Science Intern, Product Algorithms (PhD)
description:
Full Job Description
We are looking for researcher Interns to join the Core Data Science team. Core Data Science is an interdisciplinary team of quantitative scientists that aims to deliver research and innovation that fundamentally increase the magnitude of Facebook's successes. By applying your expertise in quantitative methods, you will be empowered to drive impact across a range of products, infrastructure and operational use cases at Facebook.
Work closely with a product engineering team to identify and answer important product questions
Answer product questions by using appropriate statistical techniques on available data
Communicate findings to product managers and engineers
Drive the collection of new data and the refinement of existing data sources
Analyze and interpret the results of product experiments
Develop best practices for instrumentation and experimentation and communicate those to product engineering teams
Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a PhD degree in CS or related technical field
Extensive experience solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches
Comfort manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources
A strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data
A flexible analytic approach that allows for results at varying levels of precision
Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner
Strong knowledge of an analysis tool such as Python or R
Experience working with large data sets, experience working with distributed computing tools a plus (Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, etc.)
Experience using machine learning and deep learning frameworks, such as PyTorch, TensorFlow or scikit-learn
Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
Must be currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship/co-op
Publications in top-tier Machine Learning, AI, computer science, statistics, applied mathematics, data science, or related technical fields
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Full Job Description
Overview:
Acuity, Inc. is seeking candidates for a summer Internship opportunity supporting our corporate Business Development efforts.

Acuity is a leading management and technology consulting firm that specializes in serving the federal government. Our innovative, collaborative and rewarding work environment has earned repeat honors from the Washington Business Journal’s Best Places to Work and SmartCEO Corporate Culture awards. We are looking for new talent to add to our growing team and are currently hiring additional College Interns.

Responsibilities:
The duration of the internship will be June 21-Aug 20. Scope of the 10-week project includes the following:

Understand Acuity’s account planning process, accounts and capabilities.
Review relevant documents such as existing account plans.
Conduct market research to document emerging market trends within Acuity’s current and target markets.
Analyze impact to Acuity and work with the BD team to make recommendations.
Prepare and present a report that outlines findings and recommendations.

Work will be performed at the Acuity Headquarters in Reston, Virginia or remotely.

Qualifications:
Working towards a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business or other related field.
Knowledge of and skills in market research
Ability to gather and analyze data, form conclusions
Ability to organize, report and present data
Experience with Salesforce, Bloomberg, Deltek and Sharepoint tools is helpful
Experience with federal IT consulting is helpful
Knowledge of the federal government structure is helpful

Full Job Description
Organization and Job ID

Job ID: 312258

Directorate: National Security

Division: Computing & Analytics

Group:Data Sciences and Analytics

Job Description

Do you want to create a legacy of meaningful research for the greater good? Do you want to lead and contribute to work in support of an organization that addresses some of today’s most challenging problems that face our Nation? Do you want to work in a collaborative team-based environment? Then join us in the Data Sciences and Analytics Group at the Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL)!

For more than 50 years, PNNL has advanced the frontiers of science and engineering in the service of our nation and the world in the areas of energy, the environment and national security. PNNL is committed to advancing the state-of-the-art in artificial intelligence through applied machine learning and deep learning to support scientific discovery and our sponsors’ missions. Help us advance this frontier and protect our nation!

Data science at the Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL) addresses critical national and global issues by applying scientific and mathematical techniques to multiple data sources and communicating the finding to our sponsors and the academic community. A PhD intern position at PNNL within the Data Sciences and Analytics Group is available for the summer and through the end of 2021, with the possibility of renewal.

We are looking for a motivated, independent worker with excellent skills in applied machine learning, deep learning, generative models, statistics, engineering, or broad machine learning expertise. The candidate should be enrolled and in good standing within a PhD program. Strong communication skills to successfully collaborate with the other members of the group and project team, and a strong working knowledge of both oral and written English are required.

Minimum Qualifications

Candidates must be currently enrolled/matriculated in a PhD program at an accredited college. Minimum GPA of 3.0 is required.

Preferred Qualifications

Demonstrated publication experience

Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate effectively on diverse teams

The ability to work independently and quickly adapt to new scientific environments

Strong deep learning experience, experience with generative models preferred

Ability to contribute that knowledge to the academic and research strength of PNNL and have experience writing scientific publications demonstrating their insight and discovery (e.g., publication in conferences such as NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, KDD, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ACL, ICWSM, EMNLP, NAACL, EACL, COLING, and SIGIR is preferred)

Preferred Education

Enrolled in a PhD program in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, or related.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Battelle Memorial Institute (BMI) at Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL) is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and supports diversity in the workplace. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital or family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or genetic information. All BMI staff must be able to demonstrate the legal right to work in the United States. BMI is an E-Verify employer. Learn more at jobs.pnnl.gov.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via https://jobs.pnnl.gov/help.stm

Please be aware that the Department of Energy (DOE) prohibits DOE employees and contractors from having any affiliation with the foreign government of a country DOE has identified as a “country of risk” without explicit approval by DOE and Battelle. If you are offered a position at PNNL and currently have any affiliation with the government of one of these countries you will be required to disclose this information and recuse yourself of that affiliation or receive approval from DOE and Battelle prior to your first day of employment.

Directorate: National Security

Job Category: Master's and PhD Level Internships

Group: Data Sciences & Analytics

Opening Date: 2021-06-17

Closing Date: 2021-06-24

Full Job Description
  • This position is payrolled via payroll agency.
Group/Role Overview:
The Advanced Data Planning Technology Group at TTCA focuses on next generation patterning process and advanced tooling for use in semiconductor manufacturing. We optimize the processes and hardware used to develop patterning solutions for advanced front, middle, and back end of the line applications. TEL is looking for a data-focused individual who will work with semiconductor fabrication tools, data-collection tools, and the engineers who know their operation. This person will collect, sanitize and synthesize the data coming off the tool. The goals of this position are to find distillations and visualizations of our tool sensor data which assist process engineers in making decisions with an industrial collaborator in ML/NLP interfaces.

Responsibilities:
  • Ensure and maintain connectivity between tools and the data-collection tools to ensure proper gathering of metrics
  • Work closely with cross-functional engineering teams to troubleshoot process/integration problems
  • Help to compile and analyze measured data & developing heuristics for alerting
  • Establishing models for detecting anomalies in the data
  • Using other statistical tools to deliver distilled data and visualization to end-users
  • Working with engineers to develop recommendations and prepare changes, additions, and modifications, which will facilitate equipment operations, uptime and efficiency.
  • Work with process and hardware engineers on demo of on-tool data visualization
Qualifications:
  • An ideal candidate must have or be pursuing MS degree or higher in Computer Science, Data Science or some other analytical discipline
  • Strong technical background in mechanics of materials and mathematics
  • Experience with programming languages (R, Python, C-sharp, etc.)
  • Candidate with project management experience or having previously demonstrated a strong self-directed skill set is preferential
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills a must
  • Ability and desire to work in a multicultural team
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the U.S without sponsorship

description:

OVERVIEW

Lavner Education is seeking passionate and engaging individuals who want to grow their IT and leadership skills in a fun and rewarding environment this summer. Gain significant hands-on IT experience, build your resume, and make a positive impact on students' lives!

Competitive pay
Build your resume

Provide ongoing troubleshooting and technical support to staff and students
