Full Job Description
Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in the Duck Creek Suite (Policy, Billing, Insights).
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.
Provide product support and maintenance for products in production.
Participate in developing documentation and job aid documents.

We are looking for candidates with…

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT and XPath.
Experience in with the C#, .NET programming language.
Experience with Angular frontend framework and JavaScript is preferred.
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

MedPro Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

The Help Desk Technician will be a user interfacing role responsible for providing on-site, hands on computer/tablet/peripheral technical support including but not limited to answering inquiries, resolving computer, network, application and Internet connection issues via phone, e-mail, and remote connection or in person and walk user through problem-solving process.

Responsibilities:
This position will support and troubleshoot device hardware, software, and network systems including:

Connectivity
Microsoft office suite
Printers & print servers
Exchange and Office 365 email
Active directory
Equipment (desktop, laptop, tablet, phone, scanner, etc.)
Assists users with system access, password issues, and application logins in accordance with API security procedures.

Respond to issues and maintain detailed information in ticketing system to assist in future incidents and reporting; Escalate and assign tickets appropriately and in a timely manner to ensure excellent customer experience.

Setup new workstations and refresh of previous hardware using imaging tools

Manage inventory of equipment and users

Participates in the onboarding of new API employees.

Provides telephone, in-person, and online support to end-users in a help desk environment.

This position may require occasional travel up to 10%

Experience/Education:
Working towards a degree in IT, computer science or related field or 2-4 years previous experience in IT Help Desk support

Excellent written and verbal communication skills required

Advanced troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.

Proficient working knowledge of computers, printers, network hardware, Windows 7 and 10, Microsoft Office, Internet, Intranet, Remote Access and principles of network operating systems.

Strong knowledge of various technology applications.

Physical Demands:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and use hands to finger, handle or feel objects. The employee will stand, walk, sit, talk or hear, climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl, and reach with hands and arms. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and regularly lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. The employee will: be required to lift computer hardware including PC’s, laptops, printers and scanners; walk from desk to desk; perform network wiring and create reports while using a computer.

fun together while creating a world class software portfolio. Our culture encourages creativity, welcomes fresh thinking and focuses on growth, so our people, our business, and our customers can achieve their full potential.

Here, you will apply your education to solve real-world problems, and turn theory into practice. At Siemens, our goal is to empower our students to become the next leaders of our company.

Full Job Description
About Vindex:
Vindex is the preeminent esports infrastructure platform. Founded by Mike Sepso and Sundance DiGiovanni, co-founders of Major League Gaming and early esports pioneers, and Bryan Binder and Jason Garmise, successful fintech entrepreneurs and private investors. The company provides technology and services that power the richest experiences in esports and help the world's leading game publishers, esports leagues and teams deliver deeply engaging experiences to fans around the world.

Summer 2021 Internship:
Vindex is seeking talented and enthusiastic interns to join our team this summer. This is an exciting and unique opportunity to join a rapidly scaling Esports start up. Our interns will have a rare opportunity to work alongside industry leaders, gain experience in the Esports industry and contribute to Vindex's success. Our internship will provide valuable real-world experience as well as networking opportunities. We are proud to offer roles across a variety of fields, such as Finance, Analytics, Operations, Marketing and Technology.

Program Dates : Our summer program is an 8-week paid internship which runs from July 6 2021 through August 31 2021.

Details : Vindex values the contribution of its interns and as such provides competitive compensation. Interns will be expected to commit to 40 hours per week.

Location : Our internship is fully remote this summer.

Deadline : Applications will be reviewed as they come in. Upon acceptance you may be asked to provide a copy of your transcript and references.

What you will do as a Software Engineering Intern:
Support Vindex's CTO with various projects at Vindex and across Vindex companies

Work alongside an experienced team of software and data engineers

Ingest data from partner APIs as well as internal data sources

Help develop the infrastructure that powers esports for businesses as well as gamers

Develop mobile application features and game platform integrations to provide a best in class gaming experience

Qualifications:
Current undergraduate with a degree in Computer Science or a related field

GPA of 3.2 or higher

Interest in Esports a strong plus

Detail oriented with strong verbal and written communication skills

Ability to work independently

Proactive and eager to learn

Experience in a fast-paced, startup environment preferred

Vindex is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender or gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by state or federal law.

By submitting your materials to Vindex, you unconditionally agree that Vindex may share any information you provide with its parents, subsidiary, and affiliated companies.

position: Intern to Support African American Charities
description:
Full Job Description

Support African American Charities

Manhattan OR Remote / Virtual / Work from Home

*
Gain Invaluable Experience

Our interns get more responsibility than they will anywhere else. You can take a leadership role.

Focus On Issues That Affect The Black Community

We want interns to engage with nonprofit organizations that focus on the issues like criminal justice reform, racial justice, mental health, black maternal mortality, entrepreneurship, etc.

Most Areas of Academic / Professional Focus

We also have positions that align with a wide range of academic and professional fields, including business development, analytics, finance, accounting, technology, web development, Salesforce, database, computer science, science, STEM education, marketing, digital marketing, communications, social media, publishing, Human Resources, organizational psychology, research, education, and graphics.

Focus on Ethnic, Religious, City, or Country Communities

We also have opportunities to focus on the charitable needs of any ethnic, religious, city, or country communities.

When

We are always hiring: school year or summer; full-time or part-time.

You Benefit

We want all our interns to gain the following from their experience here:

· Make a tremendous positive impact in the world.

· Use your skills, experience, knowledge, creativity, and talent.

· Assume responsibility and take a leadership role.

· Learn a tremendous amount.

· Work with people from around the world in a diverse and supportive

environment, and have a great time.

· Enhance your resume with a record of professional achievement and

community service.

· Receive a great letter of recommendation.
More Info and How to Apply
Please see https://ChangingThePresent.org/join for more information.

To apply, please send a short cover note and resume to join[at]ChangingThePresent[dot]org

We will get back to you very quickly.
Please Share
We hope you will also share this opportunity with anyone who might be interested.

Thank You!
About Changing The Present
We offer the greatest opportunity to assume responsibility and make a tremendous positive impact in the world.

ChangingThePresent is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization.

The New York Times called us an “amazon. com of the nonprofit world.”

We help channel to nonprofits some of the $450 Americans spend each year on birthdays, holidays, and other gifts. We do that by making the experience of giving a donation in a friend’s name feel like a memorable gift and a nice alternative to buying yet more "stuff." We provide tangible charitable gift opportunities (preserve an acre of the rain forest, fund an hour of cancer research, etc.), wish lists, registries, and beautiful, personalized printed greeting cards.

*

  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Full Job Description
Date: Jun 15, 2021

Location: Honolulu, HI, US, 96813

Company: HII's TSD

.

Job Description

HII-Technical Solutions is currently seeking an IT Intern to work out of our Honolulu, HI office.

Huntington Ingalls Industries is seeking an Undergraduate Junior or Upcoming Junior to take part in our growing internship program. We are looking for a future IT professional, interested in breaking into the defense industry. As one of our interns, HII-TSD will offer you the opportunity to work alongside subject matter experts and assist in providing critical support to our clients. Our experts will provide on-the-job training, and ensure our interns complete our program with the confidence to accurately perform the skills learned throughout their careers. This opportunity not only provides you the opportunity to gain valuable work experience in a professional environment, but also allows you a look at what HII-TSD can offer you as an employee.

Internships are offered in 90 day increments. Students may be invited to remain in the internship program for another 90 days, following an evaluation after the term.

Essential Job Responsibilities
Support the IT team in maintaining hardware, software, and other systems in areas such as cybersecurity, programming, analytics, and data center management
Assist with troubleshooting issues and provide technical support
Perform on-site installation/ configuration/ repair/ recovery/ back-up and preventative maintenance on PCs and related peripherals
Assist IT personnel in ensuring that hardware and software systems are fully deployed, implemented, and functioning
Minimum Qualifications
Pursuing degree in the field of computer science, information sciences, or a related field
High School Diploma or equivalent + Must be working towards a Bachelor's degree with between 40% and 60% of the required credits completed
Moderate understanding of general job aspects and some understanding of the detailed aspects of the job
Clearance- Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance
Preferred Requirements
Active Clearance: TS/SCI
Valid CompTIA Security + certification
Physical Requirements

Job performance will normally require only minor lifting and carrying of boxes of records or equipment.

A division of Huntington Ingalls Industries

This opportunity resides with Unmanned Systems, a business group within Huntington Ingalls Industries’ Technical Solutions division, creates advanced unmanned maritime solutions for defense, marine research and commercial applications. Serving customers in more than 30 countries, HII provides design, autonomy, manufacturing, testing, operations and sustainment of unmanned systems, including unmanned underwater vehicles (UUVs) and unmanned surface vessels (USVs).

Huntington Ingalls Industries is America’s largest military shipbuilding company and a provider of professional services to partners in government and industry. For more than a century, HII’s Newport News and Ingalls shipbuilding divisions in Virginia and Mississippi have built more ships in more ship classes than any other U.S. naval shipbuilder. HII’s Technical Solutions division provides a wide range of professional services through its Fleet Support, Mission Driven Innovative Solutions, Nuclear & Environmental, and Oil & Gas groups. Headquartered in Newport News, Virginia, HII employs more than 42,000 people operating both domestically and internationally.

Huntington Ingalls Industries is an Equal Opportunity/Vets and Disabled Employer. U.S. Citizenship may be required for certain positions.

Nearest Major Market: Honolulu
Nearest Secondary Market: Hawaii

Full Job Description
Description/Job Summary

Fruit of the Loom, an independent, wholly owned subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway Inc. & leading international basic apparel company, has an immediate opening for a Data Science Intern at its Corporate Headquarters in Bowling Green, KY.

The Data Science Intern supports the company's data-driven objectives by providing advanced analytics insights and recommendations by utilizing data mining techniques, including pattern detection and statistical analysis, and data visualization. This role is expected to work with Data Science and department team members to collaborate with business teams to efficiently and effectively answer business questions. The Data Science internvalidates findings and presents them in ways that can be easily understood by business counterparts.

Responsibilities/Duties

Data Research and Conversion

Work with the business stakeholders to identify what the business requirements are and the expected outcome. Model and frame business scenarios that are meaningful and which impact critical business processes and/or decisions. Identify what data is available and relevant, including internal and external data sources, leveraging new data collection processes such as smart meters and geo-location information or social media.

Data Validation and Presentation

Work in iterative processes with the business and validate findings. For example, validate discovered correlations across data with the business. Discovered findings can appear counter intuitive. Expose the rationale to their findings in easy to understand terms for the business. Be prepared to present back results that contradict common belief. Suggest ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information.

Required Experience

Undergraduate or graduate student majoring in Computer Science, Business Informatics, Statistics or Mathematics or related field, or equivalent years of professional experience
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills required
Programming knowledge and skills, experience with statistical programming software (i.e. R, Python), and knowledge of database query languages (i.e. SQL)
Ability to identify solutions to loosely defined business problems by leveraging pattern detection over potentially large datasets
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts
Knowledge of statistical forecasting and machine concepts (i.e. decomposition, linear regression, exponential smoothing, support vector machine, k-means clustering, boosted decision-tree) and software (i.e. R, STATA, Weka, Python)
Data visualization experience using PowerBI, Tableau, Qlikview, or similar technology

Required Qualifications

0-2 years of experience with data and statistical analysis, with mathematical modeling skills

Full Job Description
Anduril is a defense technology company, bringing Silicon Valley talent and funding to the defense sector. Our technology helps our customers solve their toughest challenges by enabling them to make better, more informed decisions in life-and-death situations. We’ve assembled a diverse team of experts in artificial intelligence, computer vision, sensor fusion, optics, and data analysis that are creating software and hardware solutions to radically evolve the capabilities of the United States and our allies. If you are passionate about solving problems that have real impact, come join Anduril and build the future of defense.

As a Software Engineer Intern, you will be working alongside a team of engineers with a diverse set of backgrounds and skills. Anduril has a collaborative culture with plenty of opportunities for ownership. As a member of the team, your decisions today will have a large impact on the company now and into the future, as well as our customers. We believe that simple systems are easier to understand, maintain, and scale. You will be making trade-offs as you work to ensure that our systems are prepared to scale - so being able to effectively communicate these trade-offs with your teammates is a must.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
Engineers are responsible for the full product lifecycle, including design, implementation, deployment, and maintenance.
Collaborate with cross-functional internal hardware & software teams to incorporate their innovations and vice versa.
Take feedback to iterate on and improve Anduril’s software systems.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Prior engineering internship experience, along with current academic pursuits & studies in the areas of: Computer Science, Computer/Software Engineering, Mathematics, or Physics.
Approaching Junior year or beyond at the time of the internship.
Familiarity with algorithms, data structures, storage systems, cloud infrastructure, front-end frameworks, and other technical tools.
Proficiency in a variety of programming languages such as Go, Java, C++, Python, JavaScript, etc.
A desire to work on software and applications that have real-world impact.
U.S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export controlled data.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Have a bias for action. If you see a problem, you want to solve and fix it.
Be naturally curious about the technologies and tools you use.
Have a point-of-view, but are still low-ego.
Anduril is an equal-opportunity employer, and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you are someone passionate to work on problems that matter, we’d love to hear from you!

Full Job Description
Internship Overview

Operating across multiple sectors and with a high degree of independence, the Office of the CTO (OOCTO) sponsors TIBCO LABSTM which is an innovation program aimed at helping customers and partners understand how new tech can be utilized within their TIBCO ecosystem/environment. Working closely with experienced architects, this is a unique opportunity to gain exposure and deepen understanding of cutting-edge solutions.

Internships give students hands-on training and guidance in a real-world experience on meaningful projects with the guidance of a mentor. TIBCO’s OOCTO internship program seeks to combine a broad set of technologies to enable research, development and consumer-focused deliverables. These form the basis of high-impact assignments for the selected candidates.

What You'll Do

These assignments will be formulated from the following focus areas:

Application Development

o Encompasses development and testing of new features and capabilities, enhancements and bug fixes on existing applications/projects.

Development of new features

o Encompasses development of new features and capabilities in existing projects and incorporate those changes in new demos, recordings, presentations and/or workshops to drive awareness.

Identification of new technologies

o Drive the identification, design and implementation of innovative changes in existing projects by leveraging new technologies in the market.

Documentation

o Improve existing application/project documentation (i.e. How to get started guides) and document suggested change requests that should be considered as part the applications/projects roadmap.

Who You Are

? Pursuing a BS or MS (preferred) in Computer Science, Data Science, Electrical Engineering or related analytical field of study with graduate classes in Kubernetes, data virtualization, machine learning, AI, data mining/management and/or statistics.

? Pride yourself on being an excellent communicator

? Classroom experience or better with a hands-on programming project experience

? Experience with programming languages such as GO, R, JavaScript, TensorFlow and/or some experience with visualization tools such as Spotfire is preferred

? Familiarity with AWS and/or Azure cloud services

? Open source contributions are a plus

? Successful past internships at system software companies are a plus

Full Job Description
Location: Kohler, WI

Opportunity

As a Human Experience / User Experience Intern you will participate in the creation of innovative product solutions, concepts, services, experiences, and human interfaces by utilizing best practices. The position will focus on understanding how people interact with products, environments, and experiences. This function will collaborate with cross functional teams: industrial design, manufacturing, marketing, and engineering. The goal will be to create products that improve the level of gracious living for our customers.

Work with senior Human Experience personnel to aid in the development of new products as well as ongoing changes of existing products.
Participate in design critiques of existing products, competitive products, and new concepts.
Assist in usability and human factors studies. This includes existing products, mock-ups, and prototypes.
Assist in creating UX deliverables: wireframes, logic maps, interactive prototypes, and GUI.
Develop appropriate outputs from findings to be used by internal and/or field personnel.

Skills/Requirements

Junior or senior level in accredited school or college of Industrial Engineering, Industrial and Systems Engineering, Human Factors Engineering, Ergonomics, Applied Psychology, Computer Science, Cognitive Sciences, Biomechanics, Physiology, or any related fields.
Relevant work experience in UI/UX, industrial design or engineering is helpful.

Applicants must be authorized to work in the US without requiring sponsorship now or in the future.

Why Work at Kohler Co.?

Kohler Co.'s mission is to contribute to a higher level of gracious living for those who are touched by our products and services. We understand that it takes investment in our associates’ development to make that happen. So, we offer ongoing investment in each individual’s personal development and the opportunity to collaborate with others across functions and roles at Kohler.

In addition to the investment in your development, Kohler offers a benefits package including a competitive salary, health, vision, dental, 401(k) with company matching, and more!

About Us

Beyond the competitive benefits and compensation, Kohler proudly offers a rich history, steeped in creativity and a commitment to our associates and communities. We invite you to learn more about our culture and company at www.kohlercompany.com.

It is Kohler’s policy to recruit, hire, and promote qualified personnel in all job classifications without regard to race, creed, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, disability or veteran status. If, as an individual with a disability, you need reasonable accommodation during the recruitment process, please contact kohlerjobs@kohler.com. Kohler Co. is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.

Full Job Description
Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in the Duck Creek Suite (Policy, Billing, Insights).
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.
Provide product support and maintenance for products in production.
Participate in developing documentation and job aid documents.

We are looking for candidates with…

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT and XPath.
Experience in with the C#, .NET programming language.
Experience with Angular frontend framework and JavaScript is preferred.
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

MedPro Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Full Job Description
Overview:
We are not just offering a job but a meaningful career! Come join our passionate team!

As a Fortune 50 company, we hire the best employees to serve our customers, making us a leader in the insurance and financial services industry. State Farm embraces diversity and inclusion to ensure a workforce that is engaged, builds on the strengths and talents of all associates, and creates a Good Neighbor culture.

We offer competitive benefits and pay with the potential for an annual financial award based on both individual and enterprise performance. Our employees have an opportunity to participate in volunteer events within the community and engage in a learning culture. We offer programs to assist with tuition reimbursement, professional designations, employee development, wellness initiatives, and more!

Visit our Careers page for more information on our benefits, locations and the process of joining the State Farm team!

Responsibilities:
State Farm has developed a unique internship opportunity for graduate students at the University of Illinois - the Modeling and Analytics Graduate Network (MAGNet). MAGNet interns apply their statistical modeling and analytic skills to a wide variety of business problems faced by the State Farm organization.

Most MAGNet interns are in the Statistics Department's graduate program, but graduate students in other highly quantitative disciplines may also be considered. While participating in the MAGNet program, students are evaluated and given consideration for full time post graduate employment at various State Farm locations: Bloomington IL, Atlanta GA, Dallas TX or Champaign IL.

MAGNet interns apply their predictive modeling and data analysis skills to a variety of business problems, in many different lines of business and departments (e.g., marketing, insurance and banking) including:
 Pricing and Underwriting Risk Predictive Modeling
 Claims Automation Predictive Modeling
 Sales/Growth Forecasting, Econometric and Predictive Modeling
 Data mining applications for Claims and Competitive Analysis
 Evaluating new statistical methods and tools for potential use by State Farm Modelers

Qualifications:
Interns are assigned based to a wide variety of departments for experience, based on major and interest area.

Majors considered:
 Statistics
 Mathematics
 Computer Science
 Finance
 Economics
 Actuarial Science
 Data Science

We Are Looking For The Following:
 Applicants must be accepted or currently enrolled in an approved Graduate program at University of Illinois
 Statistical modeling and/or data mining experience
 Data analysis and experience with database tools
 Computer programming (specifically SAS, R, or Python) skills
 Communication and presentations skills

What You Can Expect:
 During the academic year, MAGNet interns will work 20 hours a week
 Internship duration: Fall 2021 semester 8/23/2021 to 12/10/2021

What’s In It For You:
MAGNet is similar to a 50% graduate assistantship offered by the University and interns receive hourly pay comparable to that offered by the University for graduate assistants, as well as full tuition assistance for the duration of the internship. As with an assistantship, tuition costs are covered.

Some State Farm benefits may also apply, including the following:
 Relaxed dress code
 Direct experience you can leverage for you future career
 An opportunity to learn and network with industry-leading influencers
 A Learning Environment: Mentoring and Development to help you succeed
 We love to give back! Being involved in volunteer opportunities to give back to the community
 A culture that embraces Diversity and Inclusion - it is simply the right thing to do!

position: Information Management Intern - Sterling Heights, MI
company: thyssenkrupp Supply Chain Services NA, Inc. - 3.8
description:
Full Job Description
Your Responsibilities

The tkSCS team in North America provides a foundation to foster and support a safe, professional, and fulfilling work environment. The Information Management Intern will assist the Information Security team in our Sterling Heights, MI facility supporting the thyssenkrupp Supply Chain Services organization.

Key Elements of the role:
Assist the Information Security Management team with collecting and analyzing asset information for the business impact assessment
Assist with business process mapping
Execute additional relevant ISM requests by the manager

Your Profile

Your Profile:
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, experience with Word, Outlook, and PowerPoint.
Currently enrolled full-time in an accredited university, preferably in Computer Science/Information Systems

This is us – your new employer

With around 480 locations in over 40 countries, thyssenkrupp Materials Services is the biggest materials distributor and service provider in the western world. The broad service spectrum offered by the materials experts enables customers to focus on their individual core business. The area of Materials Services spans two strategic areas: global materials distribution as one-stop-shop – from steel and stainless steel, tubes and pipes, nonferrous metals and specialty materials to plastics and raw materials – and tailored services in the areas of materials management and supply chain management. An extensive omnichannel architecture offers 250,000 customers worldwide cross-channel, round-the-clock access to more than 150,000 products and services. A highly efficient logistics system ensures that all requested services are smoothly integrated into customer production processes “just-in-time” or “just-in-sequence”.

thyssenkrupp Supply Chain Services is a dynamic, forward thinking company offering great benefits, career advancement, and abundant learning opportunities. As a subsidiary of the global thyssenkrupp AG based in Germany, we have the security and resources of a large corporation, with a sense of ownership that is usually reserved for small companies. At tk your voice will be heard. When you join our team you are joining a skilled group of professionals with diverse backgrounds across many cultures and industries. Our company values are centered on promoting personal growth, diversity, community engagement, environmental responsibility, and career development. As a growing company, opportunities for advancement are plentiful for those who are willing to work hard - we strive to promote from within.

In the last four years our company size has nearly quadrupled. We now employ over 3,000 people across 35+ locations in the US, Canada, and Mexico. Working mainly in 5 major industries ¬- automotive, renewable energy, heavy manufacturing, commercial construction, and infrastructure logistics – we strive to be the preferred provider for supply chain services in North America. Our services span our “Hands, Wheels, Walls” approach: Quality Inspection, Logistics Management, and Warehousing & Distribution.

If this sounds like the right environment for you, apply today to thyssenkrupp Supply Chain Services:
It’s not just a job, it’s a career.

We work together closely and respect each other, for over 200 years. If that is just as important to you as it is to us, apply now!

We value diversity

thyssenkrupp Supply Chain Services NA, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, sex, race, color, religion, national origin, genetics, disability, gender identity, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other protected characteristic required by applicable law.

Applicants with disabilities who require reasonable accommodation in connection with the application process are encouraged to contact us directly.

Contact

For additional information on our company culture, company benefits, or to potentially get scheduled for an interview, please text SCSJOBS to 25000

If you are an applicant with a California residency, please click on the following link: California Job Applicant Notice of Collection

All positions require pre-employment background verification, medical review and pre-employment drug screen. In accordance with DOT regulations (49 CFR section 40.25), Amtrak is required to obtain prior drug and alcohol testing records for applicants/employees intending to perform safety- sensitive duties for covered Department of Transportation positions. If an applicant/employee refuses to provide written consent for Amtrak to obtain these records, he/she will not permitted to perform safety-sensitive functions.

Amtrak is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and we welcome all to apply. We consider candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability (including blindness), or veteran status.

At FOX Factory, our purpose is to challenge the impossible and lead in the never-ending pursuit of maximum performance. Together, we take pride in enabling our customers to be their best – to safely go farther and faster than they've ever imagined, fueled by a collective passion for winning.

The FOX Factory 2021 internship program is a 10-week hands-on experience to help college students gain the skills and knowledge needed to thrive in a real-world business setting. Specifically, Data Visualization Analyst Intern will have their own projects to complete and present to leadership throughout the summer that support the overarching global IT strategy.

The safety of our passengers, our employees, the public and our operating environment is our priority and the success of our railroad is the result of our employees.

Are you ready to join our team?

Role Summary: This internship will provide the opportunity to learn about Project Management and Information Technology. Individual will work on projects that will give hands-on experience with IT tools, project management methodology, Agile delivery methodology, business analysis, quality assurance and change management. The opportunity will allow to sharpen governance, communication and problem-solving skills in IT delivery environment.

Job Description:
Support project managers in managing schedules and milestones; ensuring that weekly project statuses are received from team members.
Documenting resourcing needs, availability and commitments.
Identifying and managing scope, constraints, risks, issues, assumptions, dependencies and deadlines; documenting risk mitigation plans.
Assisting with documentation and other project deliverables.
Creating presentation deck for project status update & facilitate meeting with senior management
Coordinating aspects of user testing and end to end delivery.

We are looking for Interns who are…..

Collaborative: Use strong interpersonal skills to actively listen and communicate in ways that foster trust and show flexibility. Easily adapt to varied roles on teams from follower to leader. Change approach or method to best fit the situation.
Self-Directed: Must be able to complete projects with limited supervision. Ability to take ownership and ask for help when needed.
Interested in technology and project management.

General Qualifications

Good MS Office or equivalent skills
Solid written and oral communication skills

EDUCATION

Graduate student pursuing studies in Project Management, Communication Management, Computer Science, Information Science, Information Systems, Business Management, Business Administration (or a related field) or equivalent work experience.

Requisition ID:57741
Posting Location(s):District of Columbia; Maryland; Virginia
Job Family/Function:Information Technology
Relocation Offered:No
Travel Requirements:None

Amtrak employees power our progress through their performance.

We want your work at Amtrak to be more than a job – we want it to be a fulfilling experience where you find challenging and rewarding opportunities, respect among colleagues, competitive pay, benefits that protect you and your family, and a high performance culture that recognizes and values your contributions and helps you reach your career goals.

We proudly support and encourage U.S. Veterans to apply for Amtrak job opportunities.

All positions require pre-employment background verification, medical review and pre-employment drug screen. Amtrak is committed to a safe and drug-free workplace and performs pre-employment substance abuse testing. All new hires are required to undergo a hair drug test which detects the presence of illegal drugs for months prior to testing. Marijuana, notwithstanding any statute, ordinance, regulation, or other law that legalizes or decriminalizes the use or possession of marijuana, whether for medical, recreational, or other use. Amtrak is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and we welcome all to apply. We consider candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability (including blindness), or veteran status.

Full Job Description
Market America a Global Product Brokerage and Internet Marketing company that specializes in One-to-One Marketing, is seeking an Intern for IT PMO / Project Management for our IT Team. This part time position is expected to last 90 days and may be extended for suitable candidates.

Position Summary: PMO Intern will get an intense exposure to project management activities and will gain lots of experience working on various project management tasks for our PMO. We are looking for an individual who is highly driven, is willing to take new challenges, is a problem solver, and has a very good attitude.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Maintains PMO confluence - wiki

Assist with PMO roadmap and process documentation

Assist in JIRA workflow redesign

Prepares weekly PMO status report

Able to perform gap analysis

Works with Project Managers on various projects

Complies with company policies and procedures.

Performs other duties as needed.

Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field.

Or a combination of equivalent education, experience, and/or training.

Skills:
Excel, Confluence, JIRA, MS Project

Strong interest in Project Management

Experience in project management preferred

Understanding of Agile and Scrum process

Above moderate use English reading comprehension, writing, and speaking; active listening;

Moderate use of critical thinking, operations analysis, quality control, troubleshooting, and programming.

Qualified candidates should apply online. This position is based from our Greensboro NC offices and is a remote - telecommute position.

ABOUT MARKET AMERICA, INC. & SHOP.COM

Currently in its 27th year, Market America, Inc. is a global product brokerage and Internet marketing company that specializes in one-to-one marketing and is the creator of The Shopping Annuity. Its mission is to provide a robust business system for entrepreneurs, while providing consumers a better way to shop. Headquartered in Greensboro, NC, the company was founded in 1992 by Chairman and CEO JR Ridinger and has generated over $8.5 billion in accumulated sales. Market America employs approximately 1,000 people globally with operations in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Singapore, Australia and Malaysia. Through the company’s primary shopping website, SHOP.COM, consumers have access to approximately 60 million products, including Market America exclusive brands and thousands of top retail brands. Market America’s revolutionary Shopping Annuity program, which helps shoppers convert their existing everyday spending into earning, is an extraordinary and financially meaningful benefit of the business. Internet Retailer has ranked SHOP.COM #65 in the 2018 Internet Retailer Top 1000, the #36 largest global online marketplace in the 2019 Internet Retailer Top 100 Online Marketplaces Database, #96 in the Internet Retailer Asia 500 and the 18th fastest growing Internet Mobile Retailer. The company is also a two-time winner of the Better Business Bureau’s Torch Award for Marketplace Ethics, was ranked 8th in the 2018 Grant Thornton North Carolina Top 100® (NC100) and received 2018’s Triad Business Journal’s “Fast 50” award as one of the top privately-held companies for sustained growth, driving the area’s economy. By combining Market America’s entrepreneurial business model with SHOP.COM’s powerful comparison shopping engine, Cashback program, Hot Deals, SHOPBuddy™, Express Pay check out, social shopping integration and countless other features, the company has become the ultimate online shopping destination.

For more information, please visit https://www.lumieredevie.com, http://www.marketamerica.com or http://www.SHOP.COM.

Full Job Description
Two Sigma is a financial sciences company, combining data analysis, invention, and rigorous inquiry to help solve the toughest challenges in investment management, insurance technology, securities, private equity, and venture capital.

Our team of scientists, technologists, and academics looks beyond the traditional to develop creative solutions to some of the world’s most complex economic problems.

When you work with us, you tackle tough problems alongside other scientists and engineers. People who will challenge your ideas. Who you can really learn from, and collaborate with. And you’ll be doing work that matters to a lot of people, too. Our investors include some of the world’s largest retirement funds, research institutions, educational endowments, healthcare systems and foundations. We admire what they do, and we’re proud to serve these organizations.

You will take on the following responsibilities:
Use the scientific method to develop sophisticated investment models and shape our insights into how the markets will behave
Apply quantitative techniques like machine learning to a vast array of datasets
Create and test complex investment ideas and partner with our engineers to test your theories
All the while, you’ll remain engaged in the academic community. As examples, you can:
Join our reading circles to stay up to date on the latest research papers in your fields
Attend academic seminars to learn from thought leaders from top universities
The internship program lasts 10 weeks in the summer and takes place at our Soho-based, New York City office. You will partner with an assigned mentor and work on a single project during the course of your time here, which will culminate in a final presentation at the conclusion of the program.

You should possess the following qualifications:
Are pursuing a degree in a technical or quantitative disciplines, like statistics, mathematics, physics, electrical engineering, or computer science with approximately one year remaining in your programs (all levels welcome, from bachelor’s to doctorate)
Demonstrate intermediate skills in at least one programming language (like C, C++, Java, or Python)
Performed an in-depth research project, examining real-world data
Are an independent thinker who can creatively approach data analysis and communicate complex ideas clearly
You don’t need a background in finance. It’s nice to have, but more than half of Two Sigma’s employees come from outside the finance industry. If you’ve got the quantitative skills, we can teach you the financial aspects of the job.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics.

position: News and Sports Technology Internships – Fall 2021, Remote
description:
Full Job Description
61350BR

Internships

Staff

Responsibilities

Opportunities may include (but are not limited to):
Digital Insights

Supporting the digital insights team in designing, conducting and analyzing primary research including surveys, in-depth interviews, focus groups, and user testing. The Digital Insights team works with NBC News, MSNBC and TODAY.

Audience Development

Keyword research, competitive research, data analytics, SEO (search engine optimization), google analytics, adobe analytics, google trends.

Creative Design/UX

Working with the analytics and insights team to understand the audience and the impact of the solutions you will help create. Designing wireframes and user flows in sketch. Creating functional prototypes with higher fidelity designs to test with users. Occasionally write some code (markup/CSS in the case of web) and commit it to GitHub to see designs through to execution.

Data/Graphics

Building interactives, charts, maps, illustrations, graphics and more to tell the news in a compelling and thoughtful way.

Digital Business Intelligence

Analyzing data generated by our primary data sources. Exploring datasets using SQL, applying Python or R against our large datasets. Documenting processes and procedures or the Business Intelligence team.

CNBC Front End Web Development

Working alongside software engineers building real-world features that are consumed daily by an audience of millions. Your primary focus is engineering, but you will also collaborate with all facets of our web engineering practices. This includes working with product on understanding and clarifying requirements, working with our design team to make sure features are pixel-perfect, and testing with our quality engineers to make sure your features are bug-free.

NBC Sports Consumer Platform Engineering

Support the engineering teams that power our flag ship products which comprise of GolfNow, GolfNow Compete, GolfPass, NBCU Sports Edge, and Sports Engine. Design and deliver apps based on business requirements. Build software prototypes and deliver in a fast-paced iterative process. Work closely with quality, platform and data technology teams to create roadmaps for our future products that converge the distribution platforms and business technology products.

Application Deadline: Fall Internship postings are live for a limited time only, apply today!

Qualifications/Requirements

In pursuit of an Associate, Bachelor or Graduate degree at an Accredited Institution and be able to provide documentation to confirm your degree progress.

Current class standing of sophomore or above (30 credits)

Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above

Must be 18 years of age or older

Must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by NBCUniversal
#LI-Remote

Desired Characteristics

Strong interest in the media and/or technology industry

Commitment to building an inclusive work environment

Ability to multitask and highly organized

Excellent verbal and written communication

Previous internship experience or on-campus leadership/projects a plus

For technical roles: Knowledge of HTML, C++, CSS, Java, Javascript, Github, Maven, PHP, Swift, Xcode Unix/Linux scripting, Node.js and relational databases and/or web development

Desired Majors: Business, Digital/New Media Studies, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Graphic Design, Animation, Business Analytics Data Journalism, Information Technology, Network Engineer, Mobile Development, Programming, Product Management, Project Management, Systems Administration, Software Engineering, Statistics, Web Design, Web Development, Technology Management, User Experience (UX)

Sub-Business

Campus Programs Interns

Career Level

Co-op/Intern

City

Remote

State/Province

Remote

Country

United States

About Us

The NBCUniversal Internship Program is an experience like no other. We offer diversity of opportunities, with unique internships across our iconic portfolio of brands. Through unparalleled access to the best in the business, hands-on training & one-of-a-kind networking events, our interns have the chance to influence change. Our interns are ambitious, innovative and savvy; they shape the way we do things. Here you can contribute as content creators, problem solvers & innovators. Here you can learn the power and possibilities of media and technology. Here you can go far.

NBCUniversal owns and operates over 20 different businesses across 30 countries including a valuable portfolio of news and entertainment television networks, a premier motion picture company, significant television production operations, a leading television stations group, world-renowned theme parks and a premium ad-supported streaming service.

Here you can be your authentic self. As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. We strive to foster a diverse and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. We believe that our workforce should represent the communities we live in, so that together, we can continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world. Click here to learn more about Comcast NBCUniversal’s commitment and how we are making an impact.

Notices

NBCUniversal’s policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law. NBCUniversal will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with relevant legal requirements, including the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative For Hiring Ordinance, where applicable.

Full Job Description
Job Location: St. Peter's School - Philadelphia (Society Hill)

OVERVIEW

Lavner Education is seeking passionate and engaging individuals who want to grow their IT and leadership skills in a fun and rewarding environment this summer. Gain significant hands-on IT experience, build your resume, and make a positive impact on students' lives!

Competitive pay
Build your resume

Full Job Description
Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in the Duck Creek Suite (Policy, Billing, Insights).
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.
Provide product support and maintenance for products in production.
Participate in developing documentation and job aid documents.

We are looking for candidates with…

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT and XPath.
Experience in with the C#, .NET programming language.
Experience with Angular frontend framework and JavaScript is preferred.
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

General:
MedPro Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Full Job Description
Leading the future of luxury mobility

Lucid’s mission is to inspire the adoption of sustainable energy by creating the most captivating luxury electric vehicles, centered around the human experience. Working at Lucid Motors means having a shared vision to power the future in revolutionary ways. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the automotive industry.

The Dimensional Control Intern will assist in working with the Manufacturing and Metrology Engineering Teams to resolve issues and build solutions that are related to manufacturing and dimensional control processes. The successful candidate must be willing to assist in making data driven recommendations, and the ability to understand and communicate measurement data and clear reporting to the team. We have a very collaborative team that is focused on Quality, Health and Safety while meeting our goals.

The Role:
Working with the manufacturing engineering and metrology to assist in the development of master production schedule and daily production plans to obtain maximum utilization of labor, tools, and equipment for all manufacturing operations.
Assist with the maintenance of relationships between manufacturing, purchasing, engineering, and sales departments to coordinate production scheduling and NPI.
Prepares production forecasts and capacity analysis while identifying improvement opportunities.
Assist in developing and maintaining production control systems using ERPs to streamline process.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:
Pursuing BS/MS in Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent
Experience with format and data processing is a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills to communicate effectively with diverse groups of people, including cross-functional teams in multiple locations.
Analytical skills, including the creation and interpretation of reports and ability to use data to solve problems.
Proficient computer skills and familiarity with Microsoft Suite including Excel, Enterprise Resource Planning and Manufacturing Execution System software is a plus
Experience with programming such as Python is a plus
Problem-solving skills to respond to manufacturing process and system problems
Graduates are eligible for this internship up to 12 months after graduation

Programming Timing:
Start Date: September 7th, 2021

End Date: November 26th – December 23rd
Our internship program is 12 – 16 weeks; the end date is flexible based on individual needs.
Some flexibility with the start date is available as needed

Other:
Publications: This internship may involve access to and/or knowledge of Lucid confidential and proprietary information. As a requirement of accepting an offer of employment with Lucid Motors you will agree to keep all such information confidential and not disclose such information to any third party including but not limited to research papers, thesis, dissertation, school papers or any other publication in any form without prior written approval from Lucid Legal Department.

Work Environment: Arizona: Plant floor & office,

Anticipated Hours: 8:30 AM - 5:30 PM

Compensation: Student compensation is based on location and current degree level, non-negotiable.

Visa Sponsorship: Lucid may but is not obligated to sponsor foreign national employees requiring company sponsorship for U.S. employment authorization

Medical benefits: Dental and vision on day 1 for all interns working 30+ hours a week; medical for interns in California working 30+ hours a week.

Housing: No compensation for housing.

Bonus: No signing bonus, relocation bonus, equity, or other bonuses.

Relocation: Round trip flight from/to permanent residence.

Housing/Transportation: You must provide your own living arrangements and transportation in the local area.

Location: Casa Grande, AZ. You must be ready to start work at this location on September 7th, 2021.

Background Check: All offers of employment are contingent on clearing a background check.

Drug Screening: All offers of employment are contingent on passing a drug screen
Be part of something amazing

Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.

At Lucid, we don’t just welcome diversity - we celebrate it! Lucid Motors is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.

To all recruitment agencies: Lucid Motors does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias or other Lucid Motors employees. Lucid Motors is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Full Job Description
The Solutions Delivery Intern is part of a multi-semester long professional internship program. The internship will consist of a focused project in the subject area of the internship, working closely with a leader who will mentor you. High preforming interns may be offered full-time positions post-graduation. You will be paid a competitive hourly rate for the internship. In addition, many interns may receive academic credit for their work through their college or university.

What you’ll do

Support day-to-day applications, data, reporting, and analytics projects and complete ad hoc application requests
Provide historical, current, and predictive views of business operations to support key partners in decision making across the enterprise
Build/analyze data sources to understand key drivers of the business
Creatively and rigorously apply modern techniques to a wide range of business problems

What we’re looking for

College Junior or Senior within one to two years of graduation
An interest in pursuing a career with Kum & Go post-graduation
Must be able to complete at least 240 hours during the summer 2021
Must have completed high school in Iowa or currently attend an Iowa community college, private college, or Board of Regents institution

Other key requirements

Pursuing an undergraduate degree in MIS, Computer Science or other STEM major (master’s or doctorate students not eligible)
Detail oriented and process-thinker
Excellent writing and communication skills
Experience in Microsoft Technologies preferred

Leadership Competencies

Communication: Delivers clear, effective communication and listens to others
Conceptual/Systems Thinking: Recognizes patterns, trends, themes, and connections in information to develop innovative ideas and solutions
Constructive Engagement: Expresses ideas and disagreements, constructively resolves conflict, and encourages others to do the same
Customer Orientation: Meets the expectations and needs of internal and external customers
Decision Making: Makes good decisions in a timely manner
Empowerment: Takes initiative and solves problems
Talent Development: Maximizes potential and improves overall performance
Influence: Proactively builds relationships and influences others
Analytical Thinking/Problem Solving: Accurately assesses problems and effectively and efficiently arrives at solutions
Strategic Thinking: Understands the current state and is able to visualize the ideal state and how to achieve it

About Kum & Go

At Kum & Go, our purpose is to make days better. We do that by connecting with people. Every day, whether in stores or at our Store Support Center headquarters, we take a people-first approach to developing associates, serving customers, and solving problems. We provide a unique working experience where associates are given many opportunities to make connections and to have fun along the way. Our culture is supported by our five core values:

Passion - We love what we do, and it shows in our work.
Integrity - We do the right thing, even when it is difficult.
Teamwork - We believe that greatness is only achieved in unity.
Caring - We have genuine compassion for our customers, associates, families, and communities.
Excellence - We expect and deliver superior performance.

For nearly 60 years, Kum & Go has been dedicated to the communities it serves, sharing 10 percent of its profits with charitable causes. For four generations, the family-owned convenience store chain has focused on providing exceptional service and delivering more than customers expect. Established in Hampton, Iowa, in 1959, the chain has since grown to employ more than 5,000 associates in more than 400 stores in 11 states (Iowa, Arkansas, Colorado, Minnesota, Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, North Dakota, Oklahoma, South Dakota, and Wyoming).

Kum & Go is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Full Job Description
Anduril is a defense technology company, bringing Silicon Valley talent and funding to the defense sector. Our technology helps our customers solve their toughest challenges by enabling them to make better, more informed decisions in life-and-death situations. We’ve assembled a diverse team of experts in artificial intelligence, computer vision, sensor fusion, optics, and data analysis that are creating software and hardware solutions to radically evolve the capabilities of the United States and our allies. If you are passionate about solving problems that have real impact, come join Anduril and build the future of defense.

We are looking for front-end focused software engineers to join our team. As an intern at Anduril, you will be helping to build out our front end features and tooling, deploying them to users, and making sure they're meeting users' requirements. You will be working alongside a team of experienced engineers with diverse backgrounds. Your decisions will have a large impact on the company now and into the future.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
Design, build, and deploy a real-time, map-based interface for displaying and interacting with sensor data and commanding physical assets
Fetch and manage large streams of data while maintaining performant rendering in a low-friction user experience
Build and design immersive image-viewing experiences on multiple platforms, including web-based and mobile 3D image viewing as well as integrated VR experiences
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Prior internship experience and academic coursework with a focus in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Mathematics, or Human Computer Interaction
Experience working on frontend applications, especially data-intensive or map-based systems
Proficiency with a programming language such as Javascript, Typescript, or Java, as well as familiarity with web frameworks such as React and Redux
Ability to empathize with end-users, to turn needs into features, and to balance user experience with engineering constraints
Curiosity and experience in backend systems, as well, so that you can understand and contribute to it in support of your frontend responsibilities
U.S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export controlled data
Anduril is an equal-opportunity employer, and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you are someone passionate to work on problems that matter, we’d love to hear from you!

Full Job Description
Location: Salt Lake City, UT
A Technical Program Manager Intern works as an integrated part of the NICE CEA Cloud Analytics software engineering team with specific focus on delivering software features to the marketplace. In this role, a person will learn how to drive, plan and standardize software development activities from concept to completion and will assist in end-to-end agile project management. This position will be mentored by our expert Program Manager for the duration of the internship.

As a Technical Programduct Manager Intern, a Typical Day Might Include the Following:

Working with the teams to plan, manage and update product work plans, deliverables and timetables as part of the software development life cycle
Assisting with agile grooming and the software development processes
Aggregating and distilling insights from artifacts of the agile process and creating action items to drive continuous improvement
Working with engineering teams to identify impediments and resource conflicts and help facilitate course corrections
Collecting and analyzing data from reporting tools to provide insights, status updates and periodically present results to management

To Land This Gig You'll Need:
Completion of upper-level courses in Computer Science, Project Management or similar program; or equivalent work experience or training
Ability to learn independently and from others
Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple simultaneous projects
Ability to communicate effectively in English with team members and peers abroad

Bonus Experience:
Experience with reporting and presentation tools such as JIRA, PPT, Excel
Experience with agile and scrum practices and ceremonies such as sprint planning, daily stand-ups, retrospectives
Experience as a Scrum Master
Experience with Analytics, Big Data or Business Intelligence
ABOUT NICE inContact: NICE inContact makes it easy and affordable for organizations around the globe to provide exceptional customer experiences while meeting key business metrics. NICE inContact provides the world’s #1 cloud customer experience platform, NICE inContact CXone™, combining best-in-class Omnichannel Routing, Workforce Optimization, Analytics, Automation and Artificial Intelligence on an Open Cloud Foundation. NICE inContact is a part of NICE (Nasdaq: NICE), the worldwide leading provider of both cloud and on-premises enterprise software solutions.

position: Fall 2021-IT and Ops Engineering Intern - 90291086 - Philadelphia
description:
Full Job Description
Your success is a train ride away.

Amtrak connects businesses and communities across the country and we move America’s workforce toward the future. We employ more than 20,000 diverse, energetic professionals in a variety of career fields throughout the United States. The safety of our passengers, our employees, the public and our operating environment is our priority and the success of our railroad is the result of our employees.

Are you ready to join our team?

SUMMARY OF DUTIES

The internship is an exciting opportunity to learn about train control systems including dispatching and Positive Train Control (PTC) systems which are critical to sustaining and enhancing safety of the intercity travel network. The intern will work collaboratively with Amtrak staff across IT and Operations Engineering projects. The intern will have an opportunity to learn broadly about Amtrak's business practices while being charged with focused technical research projects with support and guidance from Amtrak senior staff.

Amtrak provides rail transportation, as well as connecting services operated by partner carriers. The internship will focus on improvements to multimodal travel that combines Amtrak with other forms of transportation. This may include enhancements to technology systems in train dispatch, ET SCADA & PTC systems. The intern may also undertake research on developing new routes that connect with Amtrak.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Work under the supervision of assigned IT Manager(s).
Create maps and diagrams of train track in dispatch Territory.
Design & development of reporting system.
Compile data from written sources as well as direct interviews.
Write clearly and succinctly on technical topics.
Create documentation of technical processes and best practices in layman terms.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Must be actively pursuing a degree at an accredited educational institution.
Must be actively pursuing an undergraduate degree in Computer Engineering or Computer Science.
Must have at least 2 years of academic undergraduate studies completed or a junior status at minimum.
Must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Experience with computer programming and/or application design.
Knowledge of Database programming (MySQL and MS-Access).
Knowledge of Networking: Routers, Switches, Firewalls, VLANs.
Knowledge of Microsoft Server, Domain and Workstation Architectures and Administration• Linux and/or Windows Programming.
Configuration and/or Data Management.
Knowledge of X-Windows, Motif under Linux environment.
Knowledge of C++, C, Java and scripting languages under Linux environment.
Eclipse / Bit Bucket Development environment.
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite and CAD software.

COMMUNICATIONS AND INTERPERSONAL SKILLS:
Must have excellent written and oral communication skills.

Requisition ID:56761
Posting Location(s):Pennsylvania
Job Family/Function:Information Technology
Relocation Offered:No
Travel Requirements:None

Amtrak employees power our progress through their performance.

We want your work at Amtrak to be more than a job – we want it to be a fulfilling experience where you find challenging and rewarding opportunities, respect among colleagues, competitive pay, benefits that protect you and your family, and a high performance culture that recognizes and values your contributions and helps you reach your career goals.

We proudly support and encourage U.S. Veterans to apply for Amtrak job opportunities.

All positions require pre-employment background verification, medical review and pre-employment drug screen. Amtrak is committed to a safe and drug-free workplace and performs pre-employment substance abuse testing. All new hires are required to undergo a hair drug test which detects the presence of illegal drugs for months prior to testing. Marijuana, notwithstanding any statute, ordinance, regulation, or other law that legalizes or decriminalizes the use or possession of marijuana, whether for medical, recreational, or other use. Candidates who engage in the usage of marijuana will not be qualified for hire. We appreciate your cooperation in keeping Amtrak safe and drug-free.

In accordance with DOT regulations (49 CFR section 40.25), Amtrak is required to obtain prior drug and alcohol testing records for applicants/employees intending to perform safety- sensitive duties for covered Department of Transportation positions. If an applicant/employee refuses to provide written consent for Amtrak to obtain these records, he/she will not permitted to perform safety-sensitive functions.

Note that any education requirement listed above may be deemed satisfied if you have an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Amtrak is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and we welcome all to apply. We consider candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability (including blindness), or veteran status.
