position: Data Science and Analytics Internships – Fall 2021, Remote
description:
Full Job Description
61370BR

Internships

Staff

Responsibilities

Our Data Science and Analytics internships are designed to provide interns with real-world experience working on projects in a typical Data Science or Analytics environment, using state-of-the-art tools and technologies, while gaining broad exposure to the media industry. Interns will acquire specific responsibilities, goals, and timelines aligned with the teams they are embedded in. We have a world-class team of smart, hungry and fearless professionals who are working at the cutting edge of technology and science at the epicenter of content, technology and culture.

Opportunities may include (but are not limited to):
Entertainment Networks Data Science: This group focuses primarily on decision science analyses to support and inform strategy and key business decisions and building advanced data products to help enable more data-enhanced decision support. Interns will assist with research & development to inform new methodologies. Interns will also contribute to the development of tools and data pipelines, as well as implement predictive and inferential statistical and/or machine learning models.

NBC Entertainment Data Science: The NBC Entertainment Group develops and schedules quality programming for our broadcast and cable brands, including NBC, USA, SyFy, Bravo, E!, Oxygen, and Universal Kids. The Data Science intern will be exposed to exciting new challenges and opportunities arising from today’s swiftly changing media landscape. They will work on projects designed to address strategic business questions around how to create, market, and distribute media content. In the process, they will receive hands-on experience with real-world datasets, use popular Data Science technologies, and apply statistical and machine learning techniques to develop insights and inform on business strategies.

One App Data Science and Analytics: This team provides business analysis and insights on new growth opportunities in digital media with a focus on digital advertising, consumer products, and digital video streaming in broadcasting, cable, film, news and, sports. Interns partner closely with digital strategy, finance & business development team to gather requirements. These requirements are used to build models to analyze ROI on TV content licensing deals and guild / residual / participant cost models for various levels of content exploitation. Interns will also analyze and create predictive models, provide analysis and A/B testing, and build out standardized reporting for stakeholders.

Peacock Data Science: This team is focused on building machine learning and statistical models to understand and predict content value and performance, customer journey and lifetime value, and developing recommendation systems. Interns will explore and transform data (e.g., cleansing, discretization, imputation, selection, generalization) to create high quality features for the modeling process. Interns develop a close partnership with the team to build real-time and automated batch pipelines for productizing data science solutions. Gain experience in using big data, relational and non-relational data sources to access data at the appropriate level of granularity for the needs of specific analytical projects.

Peacock Editorial Business Intelligence: This team leverages user data to help customers enjoy the Peacock app. Interns will collaborate across various teams to analyze content performance and determine key drivers for our users. Interns complete end-to-end business intelligence solutions to help make data driven decisions and drive actionable recommendations. Interns have the opportunity to develop presentations on analysis and insights for business stakeholders.

Peacock Marketing Analytics: Interns will learn the fundamentals of marketing a product in its infancy, from KPI measurement to broad strategic initiatives throughout the marketing funnel. Responsibilities include: (1)devising and developing customer segmentation frameworks to inform differentiated engagement and retention marketing strategies at a 1:1 level, (2) identifying areas of strategic opportunity for the marketing team to drive growth and engagement, and inform said strategies with data-driven insights, and (3) designing and developing automated dashboards to better enable self-serve analytics.

Application Deadline: Fall Internship postings are live for a limited time only, apply today!

#LI-Remote

Qualifications/Requirements

Current Bachelor’s, Master's or PhD student at an Accredited Institution in Data Science, Computer Science, Operations Research, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or other relevant quantitative fields. Must be able to provide documentation to confirm your degree progress

Working knowledge of at least two of the following programming languages: R, Python, Julia, Java, Scala or similar

Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above

Must be 18 years of age or older

Must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by NBCUniversal

Desired Characteristics

Experience with Machine Learning, statistical modeling, predictive modeling, classification models, and clustering a plus.

Advanced working knowledge of statistics and its applications for inferential data analysis

Applied experience creating time-series forecasts in R and/or Python (i.e. ARIMA, Exponential Smoothing, etc.).

Working knowledge of deep learning models and development frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch

Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform, scikit-learn, Spark, Hive, and/or Hadoop

Familiarity with relational databases and SQL. Hands on experience analyzing and mining large datasets in SQL.

Experience with data visualization techniques, concepts, and tools such as Domo, Tableau, Lookr, or Microstrategy

Ability to communicate effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences

Full Job Description
Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in the Duck Creek Suite (Policy, Billing, Insights).
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.
Provide product support and maintenance for products in production.
Participate in developing documentation and job aid documents.

We are looking for candidates with…

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT and XPath.
Experience in with the C#, .NET programming language.
Experience with Angular frontend framework and JavaScript is preferred.
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

MedPro Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Internships

Staff

Responsibilities

Our Data Engineering internships are designed to provide interns with real-world data engineering experience, using state-of-the-art tools and technologies. Working as part of our data engineering teams, interns will help to design and develop custom decision sciences product for the media industry. Interns will acquire specific responsibilities, goals, and timelines aligned with the teams in which they are embedded. Our teams collaborate across our businesses to design and implement engineering solutions that drive data-enhanced strategic decisions.

Opportunities may include (but are not limited to):
Entertainment Networks Data Engineering: This group works closely with partners across NBCUniversal’s businesses to drive advanced analytics throughout the company. The data engineering team processes structured and unstructured data into a form suitable for analysis and reporting, to drive state-of-the-art analytics and machine learning applications. They partner closely with data scientists to understand processes and support feature engineering. Interns will assist in operationalizing data science models and products in a cluster-computing environment. Interns will also build data pipeline frameworks to automate high-volume / real-time data delivery.

Peacock Data Engineering: This team is responsible for architecting solutions that clean, format, and pipe data downstream to Peacock’s data analytics teams as well as Peacock’s various business partners. Interns have the opportunity to gain exposure to and experience with the most cutting-edge data streaming technology in the industry. Interns will develop solutions combining data blending, profiling, mining, statistical analysis, and machine learning, to better define and curate models, test hypothesis, and deliver key insights. Interns will continually work on improving the codebase and have active participation in all aspects of the team, including agile ceremonies.

Background Check: All offers of employment are contingent on clearing a background check.
Publications: This internship may involve access to and/or knowledge of Lucid confidential and proprietary information. As a requirement of accepting an offer of employment with Lucid Motors you will agree to keep all such information confidential and not disclose such information to any third party including but not limited to research papers, thesis, dissertation, school papers or any other publication in any form without prior written approval from Lucid Legal Department.
Be part of something amazing

Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.

At Lucid, we don’t just welcome diversity - we celebrate it! Lucid Motors is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.

To all recruitment agencies: Lucid Motors does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias or other Lucid Motors employees. Lucid Motors is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

description:
Full Job Description
Program Overview

This program is designed for those with a passion for diversity, equality and inclusion. Our internship provides exposure and training across the MSCI business with an emphasis on your professional development. You will be constantly learning and well connected to our senior leaders. This is the ideal introduction to a career at MSCI – you will have opportunities to explore all our career paths and will have responsibility from day one. This is your opportunity to shine!

Responsibilities

Responsibilities vary between interns depending on the business area you are working with. This internship will focus on several initiatives within Technology & Data and the Program Management organization. These initiatives may include working with Program Management and Engineering teams on product roadmaps, developing a technology product catalog across all lines of business, enabling teams in the rollout of new applications, as well as other opportunities that may arise during your internship. Some of the work will be research or analysis in nature, while other parts will be heavy on execution, working across teams to drive a specific outcome. A portion of your time will be spent on real-time projects. You may also collaborate on a ‘business challenge’ with other interns, guided by a Team Sponsor, to provide further experience across the breadth of our business.

What you’ll bring

We look for more than just excellent academic achievements. We want original, creative, passionate people with a desire for success and an adaptable mindset. You should be keen to learn and open to explore all the long-term career options available at MSCI.

How we will support you

You will benefit from technical and professional skills training, which is fast-paced, interactive and ongoing. You will be coached and supported whilst working alongside experts in your team, within a friendly and growth-orientated culture. You will also have access to all our Employee Resource Groups, such as the Black Leadership Network, Women’s Leadership Forum, MSCI Pride, Women in Technology, and Eco-Groups

Experience and Qualifications

Required: Enrolled in full-time university education and due to graduate in 2021 or 2022.
Required: A demonstrable commitment to diversity, equality and inclusion.
Desirable: A relevant degree major for the area you are applying, e.g. Business, Marketing, Communications, with experience or a minor in Computer Science a plus.

About MSCI

MSCI is a market leader in Global Indexes, Smart Beta, ESG and Risk Management, and is at the forefront of the secular trends dominating the financial services landscape today. We are committed to the future sustainability and transparency of the financial markets. We create innovative products and services that allow our clients to make more informed investment decisions, and we provide investors with critical performance measurement and risk management data and analytics. Our values define the working environment we strive to create. We are inclusive, we champion bold ideas, we always pursue excellence, and always act with integrity. Personal accountability and responsibility are key to success, and we always work as a team to remain client centric. MSCI is committed to developing a culture and workforce that reflects the clients and communities in which we operate. Increasing our diversity expands our talent pool which helps to accelerate innovation in all we do. We especially encourage members of historically underrepresented groups to apply, including women, ethnic minorities and those in the LGBTQ community.

For more information, visit us at www.msci.com.

How to Apply

Applications are welcome via our career’s website. We will ensure that all applicants receive a response from MSCI as soon as possible.

To all recruitment agencies: MSCI does not accept unsolicited CVs/Resumes. Please do not forward CVs/Resumes to any MSCI employee, location or website. MSCI is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited CVs/Resumes.

MSCI Inc. is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce. It is the policy of the Firm to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, pregnancy (including unlawful discrimination on the basis of a legally protected pregnancy/maternity leave), veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Full Job Description
ULC Robotics, Hauppauge, NY

Company Description

ULC Robotics is a dynamic company growing at a fast pace. We are a leader in product development and engineering services for the natural gas, energy, industrial, and electric markets. We are committed to solving operations and maintenance problems while protecting the environment, reducing costs, increasing efficiency, and improving safety.

We’re a global company of thinkers, problem solvers, designers and makers. We each play a unique role. Built on a legacy of innovation, ULC robotics is committed to leading the utility robotics revolution and has been since our start in 2001. We foster an environment which encourages the exchange of ideas and inspires change by challenging traditional thought and approaches to problem-solving. Though we are constantly evolving to meet the complex demands of our industry, we remain dedicated to creating an impact, locally and globally, through meaningful work. We are proud of how our technology helps utilities minimize their impact on the environment and the public while lowering operating costs.

We develop new technologies today, so we can change tomorrow.

Join ULC and be at the forefront of change!

Assist the Engineering department in successfully making preparations for robot testing, identify clients for providing robotic services, and assisting with developing proposals for new robotic applications. This position offers a variety of opportunities including basic engineering planning tasks related to testing, integration, and systems engineering. It provides insights into the business of providing robotic services and exposes the intern to developing solutions for new robotic applications. Opportunities can vary from assisting with hardware and software testing activities, assisting in the design and selection of parts, coordinating with multiple engineering team members to collect engineering data, and performing writing assignments to document system technical descriptions.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Participate in system testing activities
Develop list of spares for field-testing
Develop list of potential clients for robotic services
Discuss robot technology with potential clients and document their interest and feedback
Write proposal technical sections, develop graphics, and develop budget for estimating work

Interns will typically support one or more experienced engineers and project managers in performance of assignments, spend time shadowing actual operations, and have unique assignments that support larger projects as well as experience the day-to-day workings of engineering.

Basic Qualifications

Student working towards a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Manufacturing, Industrial, and Mechanical, or other related Engineering field.
Candidates must have completed their first year of engineering studies.
Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above.
Must be a US Citizen or have legal US working status.

Preferred Qualifications

Proficiency with basic engineering concepts
Excellent communication skills
Good writing skills

ULC is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status, or any other reason prohibited by applicable law.

Full Job Description
Internship Program Overview

Cognizant is looking for talented individuals to join our team. We believe in a strong, friendly, engineering culture. Our goal as a team is to build a uniquely fun and growth-oriented culture of thinkers. You will be paired with experienced architects and developers to guide you in architecture and production-ready code practices. We work with the best of the best!

Position Overview

As an Undergraduate Intern, you will have the opportunity to work on complex emerging technologies for some of the world’s leading companies. You will build technical and professional skills through robust training sessions with technology professionals across North America. We also provide career counseling and mentoring where you will connect with our leaders and build your network. Throughout your first two years at Cognizant, we will closely monitor your progress and offer coaching, training and support to help you achieve your long-term career goals at Cognizant.

The Cognizant internship will help you gain the following qualifications:

Full-stack development experience (using frameworks such as React, AngularJS or NodeJS)

Hands-on experience with object-oriented programming languages (C/C#, Python, Scala or Java)

Knowledge of Cloud based architecture (for example: GCP or AWS or Azure)

Knowledge of DevOps

Exposure to Agile development methodologies

Understanding of TDD practices and experience with Unit Testing

Once you have successfully completed the internship program and join full-time, your responsibilities will include:

Working in a diverse, experienced, agile team to define requirements and develop end-to-end solutions.

Full DevOps implementation of production-ready code from inception through delivery and production readiness.

Practicing the Agile methodology of software delivery.

Developing, coding, unit testing, and debugging new highly complex software solutions or enhancements to existing software. Analyze, debug and/or assist in problem solving.

Successful candidates should possess the following qualifications:

Enrolled in an Bachelor's Degree program, currently pursuing a computer science, information technology or similar degree

Strong interest in learning new technologies

Commitment to launching a career in the tech industry

Strong problem solving and analytical skills

Strong interpersonal and communication skills

Ability to work collaboratively with global project teams

Due to the nature of this position Cognizant cannot provide sponsorship for U.S. work authorization (including participation in a CPT/OPT program) for this role.
Employee Status : Full Time Employee
Shift : Day Job
Travel : No
Job Posting : Jun 15 2021

About Cognizant Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 194 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @USJobsCognizant.

Cognizant is recognized as a Military Friendly Employer and is a coalition member of the Veteran Jobs Mission. Our Cognizant Veterans Network assists Veterans in building and growing a career at Cognizant that allows them to leverage the leadership, loyalty, integrity, and commitment to excellence instilled in them through participation in military service.
Cognizant is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

Chromalloy has expanded from a gas turbine parts repair business into an OEM supplier of production parts and advanced repairs and services for gas turbines used in aviation and power applications. description:
Full Job Description

What You'll Do Here

We're looking for an intern app developer to create an iOS app which demonstrates the FIDO capabilities provided by the StrongKey FIDO Server (SKFS). Some of what you'll do here:

  • Create, maintain, and implement the source code to develop a medium-complexity native mobile app on iOS and iPad OS (mobile and iPad) platforms
  • Implement a user-friendly, modern, and easily navigable user interface and menu options for the mobile app
  • Test the end-to end workflows on actual mobile devices (iPhone and iPad)
  • Fix defects found in testing including any suggested enhancements in user interface or navigation

Requirements

Note: These requirements are the most desired qualifications. If you do not meet all of them, we still encourage you to apply, and in particular, explain how you might meet any significant gaps.

  • Pursuing BS or MS in Computer Science
  • Academic or internship experience in writing mobile applications
  • Familiarity with iOS development and Swift
  • Knowledge of Objective-C or Swift; C++ preferred
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

About StrongKey

StrongKey makes data breaches irrelevant. We are redefining the way businesses and government agencies secure their information against the inevitability of a breach through four specific practices that ensure their data, no matter the format, remains encrypted and protected at the highest possible level. While other security solutions focus on predicting, containing, or looking after the perimeter, StrongKey provides strong authentication, application-level encryption, and digital signatures which are underpinned by hardware-backed key management to ensure data security even with an attacker on your network. We’re trusted by some of the largest companies and critical government agencies around the globe, and provide tailored solutions for multinational corporations, small businesses, and even individuals working from a home office.

Founded in 2001, we are now in a pivotal growth stage, which creates a unique opportunity for anyone joining the StrongKey team. We offer the autonomy, excitement, strategy-setting, and challenge of a startup, with the stability of nearly 20 years of proven security, thought leadership, and a working business model. If you are tired of being lost in the crowd and yearn for the opportunity to make a personal impact, we may be a compelling place for you to work.

The Kind of Person Who Might Enjoy Working Here

  • Someone who knows how to communicate well in all circumstances, whether requiring directness, empathy, feedback, listening, or all of the above; we value the “human” in human capital and we're looking for people who feel the same way
  • A person who is equally comfortable chatting with a non-technical customer and sharing technical information

Basic Function

As a part of the Innovation team, the Innovation Intern will help deploy and manage innovative solar and energy storage technology pilots at PVUSA, located in Davis, CA.

Responsibilities

· Review of technical documentation and engineering design drawings

· On-site support and management of pilot projects

· Design and perform experiments on solar and energy storage projects

· Develop simulation and physical tests to validate battery performance metrics (SOC, SOH, etc.)

· Run tests on the battery to simulate various use cases (energy, capacity, and ancillary services)

· Performance data collection, analysis, and presentation of results

· Weekly reporting of pilot project status and performance results

· Remain informed on innovative industry trends, companies, and technologies

· Flag and report abnormal output/data and perform technical analysis to identify RC for any deviation.

Qualifications/Requirements

· Currently in a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD program with an emphasis in Electrical, or Mechanical Engineering, Chemistry, Computer Science, Geography, Environmental Science, or Mathematics/Physics required

· Experience with data analysis and presentation, preferably in Python, R, MATLAB, or other programming environment.

· Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Word

· Strong written and verbal English language communication skills

· Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills

· Educational focus on Renewable Energy and/or Energy Storage preferred

· Hands on experience with photovoltaic modules, power electronics, or Li-ion and flow battery systems preferred

· The ability to potentially lift items as heavy as 30lbs.

· Familiar with control methodology for battery system including communication with inverter, DC-DC converters, and relays.

· Excellent debugging and troubleshooting skills to solve challenging problems.

· Strong fundamental knowledge of BMS and EMS functionality and key metrics of battery systems.

· Firmware design experience is a plus.

· Experienced with communication protocols such as MODBUS TCP/IP

· Familiarity with optimization models and forecasting methods (ANL) are preferred.

Travel Requirements

The position requires up to 25% domestic travel and up to 50% onsite presence at pilot projects at PVUSA in Davis, CA

Full Job Description
Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in Duck Creek Suite Distribution Management and integrations with other applications
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.
Provide product support and maintenance for products in production.
Participate in developing documentation and job aid documents.

We are looking for candidates with…

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT, XPath and JSON.
Experience in development with the Java programming language and an Integrated Development Environment (i.e. Eclipse).
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures.
Experience with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) is preferred.
Experience with Azure or AWS hosted Cloud environments and Web Services is preferred.
Experience with a version control management system (i.e. Git) is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

General:
MedPro Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

The City of Dana Point is seeking a hard-working and enthusiastic individual to fill the position of Information Technology Intern. The Intern will assist the Information Technology Division with hardware and software installation, software configuration on computers and laptops, diagnosing and troubleshooting issues, and additional support duties. This is an excellent opportunity for students to gain hands on experience working in the General Services Department, as well as learn about municipal government functions and tasks related to the program area.

This is an hourly, part-time position.

EXAMPLES OF ESSENTIAL DUTIES – Typical duties assigned to this position include, but are not limited to:

  • Perform computer updates.
  • Assist in performing hardware and software installations.
  • Perform software configurations on computers, laptops and surface pros.
  • Provide support in diagnosing hardware and software issues and troubleshooting activities.
  • Assist with networking and WIFI.
  • Assist with various General Reservices related tasks.

THE IDEAL CANDIDATE

The ideal candidate will possess the following qualifications:

KNOWLEDGE OF:

  • Interest and passion for public service and information technology.
  • Microsoft 365 platform.
  • A variety of computer and/or web programs.
  • Networking and computer programming.
  • Methods and techniques of effective customer service.
  • Appropriate safety precautions and procedures.

ABILITY TO:

  • Demonstrate excellent computer, time management, organization and problem-solving skills.
  • Organize data, and create clear and concise reports.
  • Interpret and follow City, departmental and division policies, laws, and rules.
  • Analyze situations carefully, and adopt effective courses of action.
  • Understand and follow oral and written instructions.
  • Communicate effectively, orally, and in writing.
  • Establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with those contacted in the course of work.

QUALIFICATIONS

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

  • Graduation from high school or completion of a GED.
  • Working towards an associates, undergraduate or graduate degree in information technology, computer science or related field.

LICENSES OR CERTIFICATES:

  • Possession of or ability to obtain a valid California driver’s license.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Position may require the ability to perform light lifting and carrying; occasional standing, walking and sitting for prolonged periods of time. Occasional hand use and finger dexterity needed to use computer keyboard and operate standard office equipment; pushing, pulling, grasping, and reaching may also be required. Good hearing is required when communicating on the telephone or in person.

WORK ENVIRONMENT:

The work environment described herein is representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential function of this job. Primarily office environment with controlled temperature conditions and no direct exposure to hazardous physical substances. Occasional field work where incumbent may be required to work on all types of floor surfaces in a variety of facilities, in varying temperatures.

APPLICATION AND SELECTION PROCESS

OPEN UNTIL FILLED

First Review: June 30, 2021

All applicants must complete a City Employment Application. The City Employment Application is available in PDF format on the City’s website at www.danapoint.org, Employment tab, or at City Hall. Personal resumes will not be accepted in lieu of the City application. You are encouraged to attach a copy of your resume to the City application.

Please mail completed applications to:

CITY OF DANA POINT

ATTN: HUMAN RESOURCES

33282 GOLDEN LANTERN, SUITE 203

DANA POINT, CA 92629

Applications will be reviewed, and those applicants with the most suitable qualifications will be invited for an oral interview.

Full Job Description

Job Description

Company Information

Smarter Grid Solutions (SGS) is a fast-growing technology company that delivers products and services to enable utilities and developers to integrate distributed and renewable energy resources into our electric grid. Our unique Active Network Management (ANM) technology is the only technology of its kind to provide real-time, autonomous control of distributed energy resources, and is the result of over ten years of developing, deploying and proving this unique approach to managing the Smart Grid.

Overview

SGS is seeking a Software Analytics Intern to join our smart grid analytics team. The team is responsible for developing practical paths to operationalizing advanced power systems analytics; this could be battery optimization techniques, ML-based forecasting, or integration with advanced network-model based approaches based on load flow, optimal power flow, or state estimation. All of these power systems techniques can be used to help manage the grid more optimally and pave the way for deeper de-carbonization.

We are looking for a highly motivated student or graduate with excellent software development skills to help build out our analytical capabilities. In this group, you will sit between the world of software development, power systems, and advanced analytics. Your focus will be on helping develop and test software frameworks that give us and our customers confidence that these complex analytics can be safely operationalized. You will be involved in end-to-end software development in a multi-disciplinary environment.

Qualifying Criteria

**Please note we cannot consider applications from candidates who do not meet these criteria.**

You must be either a NY State resident attending or having attended any college or university, regardless of location, within the last 12 months

or

an out of state student, attending or having attended a College or university located in New York State within the last 12 months.

Required Skills

· Strong academic track record in Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Computer Science, or similar

· Familiarity with high-level power and energy systems concepts

· Solid experience in modern analytics-friendly languages like Python, Scala, or R

Desired Skills

There are a number of additional desirable attributes that would complement the required skillset:

  • An understanding of power systems analysis
  • Optimization using AMPL, GAMS, or similar
  • AI and ML techniques
  • First principles understanding of algorithms, data structures, and time/space complexity

Anticipated Start Date: Summer 2021.

Duration: Minimum of 6 months.

Salary: Competitive

Job Type: Internship

Location: New York

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Pay: $17.00 per hour

description:
Full Job Description
Job Summary

The National Security Agency (NSA) Science of Security (SoS) Summer Internship Program offers paid research internship opportunities for undergraduate and graduate-level university students pursuing STEM degrees. The 12-week program starting mid-May/June offers interns the opportunity to gain hands-on experience working with full-time NSA researchers on innovative cybersecurity research and technology. NSA/CSS Research Directorate (RES) is home to a highly technical and talented workforce that performs cutting-edge research and creates breakthroughs in mathematics, computer science, engineering, cybersecurity, physics, neuroscience, and linguistics that lead to creative solutions to NSA's most challenging problems.

Qualifications

' Must be a U.S. citizen.
' Must be eligible to be granted a security clearance.
' Must be available for an operational interview and other applicable processing between the months of November 2021 and March 2022.
' Applicants should have demonstrated superior STEM aptitude and problem-solving skills. Evidence of successful work on an independent STEM project is desirable. Applicants may be at any stage in their undergraduate or graduate careers and working, or intending to work, in any STEM area.
' Desired majors include, but not restricted to, computer science, cybersecurity, engineering, information technology, mathematics, and psychology.

Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule

  • Students are paid a competitive salary commensurate with their education level.
  • Receive annual leave, sick leave and paid federal holidays.
  • Participation in agency-wide extracurricular programs.
  • Students who attend schools in excess of 75 miles from Ft. Meade, MD, are eligible for a round trip airfare ticket to and from school or mileage reimbursement up to the cost of a government-issued airline ticket.
  • Daily transportation to and from work is not provided. Students participating in the program are highly encouraged to bring a vehicle. Carpooling with other students MAY be available but NOT guaranteed.
  • Subsidized housing accommodations are available upon request if school is located in excess of 75 miles from NSA main HQs campus.
How to apply

Submit an online application on or before 31 October 2021.

Send an applicant package to sos.research@nsa.gov; you will receive an email confirmation upon receipt.

Applicant packages should include:
' Resume,
' One page essay on the applicant research experience and/or interests,
' Most recent transcript(s) that show academic performance - Unofficial copies are accepted, and
' A letter of recommendation (LOR) from a faculty member or research mentor who can speak to your research experience/background (LORs attached to the application package or sent directly from the recommender to sos.research@nsa.gov are accepted).

Early Acceptance Incentive;
The application period runs until 31 October 2021. However, the Agency will determine selections for early acceptance into the program on a rolling basis throughout the application period and anticipates filling approximately 1/3 of the available positions prior to the closing of the application period.

If you have questions about the Science of Security Intern Program, please contact us at the email address above or call 1-844-ICHIRES. You may also e-mail Summer_Interns@nsa.gov for application questions.

***PLEASE NOTE:
U.S. Citizenship is required for all applicants. Reasonable accommodations provided to applicants with disabilities during the application and hiring process where appropriate. NSA is an equal opportunity employer and abides by applicable employment laws and regulations. All applicants and employees are subject to random drug testing in accordance with Executive Order 12564. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a security background investigation and polygraph.

This position is a Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS) position in the Excepted Service under 10 U.S.C. 1601. DoD Components with DCIPS positions apply Veterans' Preference to eligible candidates as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 USC, in accordance with the procedures provided in DoD Instruction 1400.25, Volume 2005, DCIPS Employment and Placement. If you are a veteran claiming veterans' preference, as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 U.S.C., you may be asked to submit documents verifying your eligibility.

DCIPS Disclaimer

The National Security Agency (NSA) is part of the DoD Intelligence Community Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS). All positions in the NSA are in the Excepted Services under 10 United States Codes (USC) 1601 appointment authority.

Full Job Description
Overview:
CIS (Center for Internet Security) is the trusted guide to confidence in the connected world. CIS collaborates with the global security community to lead both government and private-sector entities to security solutions and resources. CIS is an independent, not-for-profit organization.

The Device Engineering/Support Intern position is assigned to the Engineering unit within the Security Operations Center (SOC). The primary purpose of this position is to gain experience while serving as an Engineering support team member to help maintain the infrastructure used to monitor State, Local, Tribal and Territorial (SLTT) government networks.

What You'll Do:
Triage issues related to network security device monitoring
Field questions and customer requests received via phone and email to ensure all items are promptly responded to and completed in a timely manner
Ensure that all open tickets are actively being followed-up on and tracked to completion
Perform basic troubleshooting of the CIS Albert and other monitoring infrastructure
Effectively transition action items to SOC Analysts and other teams as applicable
Identify and escalate advanced issues to Device Engineering Specialists or Support personnel
Other tasks and responsibilities as assigned

What You'll Need:
2 years of study in Computer Science/Cybersecurity or related field
Overall GPA is 3.0 or higher and Major GPA 2.8 or higher
Positive customer service and team-oriented attitude
Excellent interpersonal skills and professional demeanor
Must be authorized to work in the United States
The position is open to U.S. citizens and requires a favorably adjudicated DHS Fitness Review for Public Trust Positions**

It's a Plus if You Have:
Working knowledge of UNIX-based operating systems.
Basic scripting skills

**Factors that may cause a negative Fitness Review decision include:

Criminal Conduct
Dishonest Conduct
Employment Misconduct
Alcohol Abuse
Drug Use (illegal drug use or use of a legal drug in a manner that deviates from approved medical direction) Additionally, illegal drug use includes the use of drugs that are illegal for federal purposes despite being legal in select states and countries, such as marijuana.
False Statements
Financial Issues
Have not resided in the US for three (3) of the past five (5) years

At CIS, we are committed to providing an inclusive environment in which the diverse backgrounds, experiences, and views of our employees, members, and customers are valued and respected. It is through this commitment that we are able to work together towards our common mission: to make the connected world a safer place.

position: College to Corporate Internship - Investment Management - PA
description:
Full Job Description
Drive superior investment results

Why join Vanguard’s College to Corporate Internship Program for Investment Management? You will experience buy-side investing with a leading-edge investment management organization. Your internship will provide an opportunity to collaborate alongside a team of premier investment professionals and influence the investment outcomes of over thirty million clients. Through hands-on involvement with the global investment ecosystem and equipped with the tools and resources to succeed, you’ll learn how these elements shape the financial future of our clients and of Vanguard itself. Make it count!

In this internship program:
Pursue an assignment within one of Vanguard's investment teams including Fixed Income Group (FIG), Equity Index Group (EIG), Quantitative Equity Group (QEG), Investment Strategy Group (ISG), Portfolio Review Department (PRD), Investment Management FinTech Strategies (IMFS), or Risk Management Group (RMG). You will work in a department that draws upon your experiences and interests as well as meets our business needs
Experience an intensive, comprehensive approach to investing that employs a range of strategies across asset classes, expanding your expertise while developing a broad understanding of our business
Smaller cadre sizes which support opportunities for focused learning, individualized feedback, and close community connections
Collaborate with others and lead a project distilling complex data to uncover insights that you will present to leadership – influencing decisions that directly affect investors
Meet regularly with your department manager, internship program manager, and key business leaders. Receive personalized coaching and mentorship
Cultivate new relationships in a stimulating network of dedicated professionals working to do what’s right for the investor
Make a positive impact on investors and the global financial markets as a whole through your increased knowledge of Vanguard’s mission driven investment philosophy

Lead the future of investing
At Vanguard, we value community, camaraderie, and leaders who are adaptable and independent-minded. Your upbeat work ethic, leadership and communication abilities will be invaluable as we advance our mission to make investment success accessible to everyone. Strong analytical skills, problem-solving abilities, and conceptual creativity will help further your expertise in investments and products in a dynamic internship program, preparing for a career in investment management. Here, you’ll make your internship count as you advance Vanguard’s mission.
Upon successful completion of the program, you will have the opportunity to apply for a full-time position, including one of the Vanguard rotational programs. These opportunities are designed to provide a broad work-training experience prior to launching into your specific role.

What it takes
Cumulative GPA of 3.5 or higher preferred.
Majors in Finance, Economics, Statistics, Math, Accounting, Engineering, or Computer Science preferred
Effective communication, analytical, leadership, and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Adaptability, the ability to learn quickly, and take initiative
Passion for Investment Management
Results-oriented with the ability to lead multiple priorities
Strong technical acumen a plus, including data analytical, statistical, and programming (preferably Python) skills
A commitment to strengthening communities by donating your time and talent

Special Factors
At this time Vanguard is only considering candidates that will not now, or in the future, need sponsorship or other immigration support to obtain US work authorization
This program is a full-time, paid summer internship
The start date for this program will be May/June 2022
Acceptance into the program is contingent upon a successful drug-screening result

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

Full Job Description
Linqia is the leader in the growing influencer marketing industry. At Linqia, we partner with the world's largest brands including Danonne, AB InBev, Kimberly-Clark, Unilever, and Walmart to build compelling and effective influencer marketing campaigns. Our AI-driven platform and team of experts are leading the transformation of influencer marketing.

We value intelligence, recognize talent and have instilled a culture that supports career development and growth for our employees. We thrive on innovation and accountability, with a customer first attitude that adds true value to everything we touch. Our team members are smart, hard-working, have integrity and love to have fun as we play to win. At Linqia, you'll be working with others who are passionate about marketing in a fun, fast-paced and data-driven environment.

We are growing fast and looking for a talented machine-learning software engineering intern to join the engineering team this summer for a 3 month paid opportunity. The ideal candidate should be someone who is currently or just graduated with a relevant degree and has some knowledge of ML foundations. This is a great opportunity to work on an impactful project, while learning ML applications with Linqia's backend team. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment where you're surrounded by driven, passionate, and motivated people, then Linqia is the place for you!

Design and Develop Automation workflows for provisioning Software Infrastructure span

Design and Develop Microservices and Applications for Data Extraction, Information Retrieval and Data Analysis

Manage deployment and orchestration Infrastructure and related Automation (Apache Mesos, Kubernetes)

Manage and Deploy Distributed Queuing and Streaming platforms (Apache Kafka, Apache ActiveMQ)

Manage and Deploy Database Infrastructure (Relational and Non Relational)

Qualifications:
Currently pursuing or completed a B.S., M.S., or Ph.D in computer science, statistics, mathematics, electrical engineering, machine learning, or related technical field

Python, Java, Shell Scripting

Hands-on experience with machine learning, data mining, natural language processing or statistics

Experience with Data Analysis and Machine Learning Libraries like Pandas, Gensim, Pytorch, TensorFlow, etc.

Experience with Source Control Management esp. Git

Ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to other team members.

Familiarity with Agile software development processes

Very good understanding of Relational Databases and SQL

Very good understanding of Linux/Unix platforms and System Tools.

Nice to Have:
Masters or PHD in computer science or other technical related field.

Experience working and writing automation workflows for AWS, Google Cloud Platform or other cloud infrastructure

Experience deploying, configuring and managing Queuing Systems

Experience deploying, configuring and managing Non Relational Databases

Experience with Microservice based infrastructure.

Experience with Software Infrastructure Automation and tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Docker

This position description is intended to describe the duties most frequently performed by an individual in this position. Linqia is an equal opportunity employer supporting workforce diversity. We actively encourage women, people with disabilities, veterans, underrepresented minorities, and LGBTQ+ people to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes or candidates through this Web site or directly to employees. Linqia does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with us.

Full Job Description
Position Overview:
Nationwide IT Services (NIS) is seeking summer 2021 interns for our program supporting one of our key corporate initiatives. As an intern, you will work in a team environment delivering a working technical solution that can be leveraged for use by various existing customers and other government agencies.

Program Summary:
Work will consist of a wide range of project tasks to include web application design and development, database scripting, code reviews, technical documentation, and research into existing and emerging technologies. Interns will learn how to analyze both a living and pre-existing (legacy) codebase to re-engineer and improve upon both user-facing and back-end features. NIS teams build more modern, scalable solutions that use open source and cloud-based architectures to provide improved user experience, security, reliability, and cost effectiveness. Interns will review and contribute to detailed technical requirements and documentation, learn and adopt DevOps best practices, contribute to prototypes and test plans, design new features, gather user feedback, research and present options to users and developers, analyze alternatives from a complexity and business cost to value basis, and write code to demo or present to existing and potential customers. NIS will gain from the intern's research and insights into the latest coding and design practices, while providing interns with an opportunity to build new skills and apply them to a key corporate initiative.

Additional Internship Information:
This is an eight-week paid internship program. We ask that each intern be available to work the duration of the eight weeks and commit to working a minimum of 35 hours per week. This program is geared towards technical college students that are actively enrolled at an accredited university.

Our internship program is designed to provide college students the opportunity to learn about Nationwide IT Services and gain meaningful, hands-on work experience in a professional environment. We place an emphasis on developing the next generation's workforce. As part of our internship curriculum, we provide the opportunity for each intern to interact with various stakeholders within the company. This includes the chance to complete technical training courses, attend brown bag sessions with our executive leadership team and participate in teambuilding activities with mentors and fellow interns.

Job Qualifications:
Currently enrolled in a Bachelors or Masters degree from an accredited university
Must be a US citizen
Must be able to work collaboratively in a team environment, and establish and maintain interpersonal relationships
Ability and desire to quickly acquire knowledge of new subject matter areas
Must possess strong decision-making skills, and the ability to organize and prioritize work
Must possess the ability to quickly ramp up on technical details of a project
Must take initiative to provide creative alternatives / solutions to intractable challenges or systemic problems
Nationwide IT Services, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetics, disability or protected veteran status.

Full Job Description

Data Analytics Intern, Arlington, VA

Company Profile:

Management Systems International (MSI), a Tetra Tech Company, is a Washington, D.C. metro area management consultancy with a 40-year history of delivering results for our clients. Our expertise is in the fields of monitoring and evaluation; democracy and governance; peace and stability; rule of law and accountability; education; gender and inclusion; strategic communications; and leadership and organizational development. MSI has implemented projects in 90 countries around the world such as Afghanistan, Colombia, Indonesia, Jordan, Kenya, Mexico, Nigeria, Pakistan, Syria and Ukraine, and works domestically. We support clients ranging from the U.S. Government (e.g., the U.S. Agency for International Development, U.S. Department of Defense, U.S. Departments of State and Labor, and the Millennium Challenge Corporation) to large bilateral and multilateral donors (e.g., the World Bank and the United Nations Development Program). We also work with national and local governments, nongovernmental organizations (NGOs), think tanks, foundations and universities. For more information, please visit our website at www.msiworldwide.com.

Position Summary:

MSI is now accepting applications for an internship to help our Chevron five year "Bangladesh Partnership Initiative" (BPI). The position will last approximately three months, with the possibility for extension based on performance, how well the candidate works with the team, and the needs of the team. Internships require a commitment of 28 hours per week. Applicants residing or attending school in the D.C. Metropolitan area are preferred. This is a paid position.

The Bangladesh Partnership Initiative

In 2014, Chevron launched the five-year “Bangladesh Partnership Initiative” (BPI) to complement and maximize the impact of its existing economic development and social investment programs. The goal of the project is to sustainably improve the livelihoods, employability, incomes, and inclusiveness of communities near Chevron’s operations in Greater Sylhet in the districts of Sylhet, Moulvibazar, and Hobiganj. BPI is currently comprised of two projects — “Jibika II,” an enterprise development and access to finance project, the latter of which is being implemented by BRAC and its partner, Institute of Development Affairs (IDEA), and “Uttoron,” a workforce development program being carried out by Swisscontact. Chevron has contracted with MSI to collect monthly monitoring data on village development organizations’ operations, finances, and outcomes.

Responsibilities:

The intern’s primary responsibility would be to help engineer a workflow process starting with a collection of Excel worksheets and workbooks, leading to a collection of cleaned and merged data files which are then processed into multiple indicator tables and visualizations displayed in a static dashboard. Further development may include display in an interactive dashboard. ​

Qualifications:

  • Masters degree student in any quantitative social science (economics, epidemiology, sociology) or explicitly an analytics field such as data science, operations research, information technology, computer science, etc.
  • High abilities with R programming language, including use of R for automation of data handling, static or interactive dashboards, and hosting active web pages.
  • Abilities with Git for hosting, version control, and reproducible research
  • Professional demeanor and diplomatic communication skills, especially via email.
  • Attention to detail and ability to prioritize within a multi-tasking environment.
  • Excellent writing/editing skills.
  • Strong organizational skills.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office applications and the ability to learn new software programs quickly.
  • Fluency in a second language, preferably Arabic, French or Spanish preferred

Only candidates who have been selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls, please.

MSI is an EEO/AA/ADA Veterans Employer.

Reasonable Accommodations: MSI is dedicated to hiring an inclusive workforce. If you would like to request reasonable accommodations during the application process, please email MSI.Dept.HRRecruiting@ tetratechinc.onmicrosoft.com with “Reasonable Accommodations” in the title. Our recruitment team looks forward to engaging in an interactive process to provide reasonable accommodations for candidates.

To apply: Please visit our website, www.msiworldwide.com

Full Job Description
Position Description

The Baldwin County Commission (subsequently referred to as “the County”) is seeking a temporary Planning intern. This internship will be for a graduate or undergraduate student studying Community or Urban Planning, Computer Science, Information Technology, Public Administration, Engineering, Geography, or a related field.

Job Description:
The primary function of the intern is to provide administrative and customer service functions to support the Planning and Zoning Department. The intern will be responsible for providing customer service, researching and updating data, and performing basic zoning/subdivision research for the department.

Essential Job Functions

Responds to inquiries and provides assistance to County staff and the public, by telephone, email and in person, regarding zoning and related planning information;
Assists planners and planning techs with reviewing plans for compliance with zoning/subdivision standards;
Assists planners with planning/subdivision related research;
Maintains and updates information in Citizenserve;
Participating in and/or managing special planning projects under the supervision of Planners
Assists in the preparation of address mailing lists for planning applications;
Creates, updates, and maintains spreadsheets, reports, and databases from established content; verifies and tabulates data; run basic reports and queries as requested;
Data collection and field assessments
Creates and maintains records, related correspondence and documents;
Performs a variety of clerical and administrative support tasks for the Department;
Performs all work duties and activities in accordance with County’s policies and procedures

Education and Experience

Computer programs; Word, Excel, PowerPoint. Preference given for applicants with background in GIS.
General office procedures; answering phones, copying, filing. Be able to follow direction as well as take self-initiative, must be courteous, polite and enjoy meeting and talking with people both in-person and on the phone.
Preference for a graduate or undergraduate student studying Community or Urban Planning, Computer Science, Information Technology, Public Administration, Engineering, Geography, or a related field.

Full Job Description
Personalis is a rapidly growing cancer genomics company transforming the development of next-generation therapies by providing more comprehensive molecular data about each patient's cancer and immune response. Our ImmunoID NeXT Platform® is enabling the development of next generation immuno-oncology therapeutics and diagnostics.

Summary:
You will join a team of software quality engineers whose mission is to simplify, modernize and scale business. The business needs robust, high-performance software that can accurately and reliably orchestrate analysis of large volumes of next-generation sequencing (NGS) data. We are offering a summer internship opportunity to promising computer science students who have a professional interest in software engineering. This internship will offer you direct exposure to real world industry applications of software quality engineering to the rapidly growing biotechnology space and will focus on developing you in areas where a computer science curriculum typically does not. The internship will be approximately 8-10 weeks in duration (dates flexible depending on your academic calendar).

Responsibilities:
The objective of this internship program is to gain exposure to best industry practices in software engineering and quality and regulatory standards as applicable to software medical device industry.

You will be responsible for a summer project from conception through feasibility, development, testing and rolling into "production". During the 8-10 weeks program, you will: understand the latest technology and regulatory standards in software engineering, its impact on immuno-oncology, bioinformatics, Next Generation Sequencing and high-performance computing and where you can best focus your academic studies for future career direction.

In this role, you will

Document, review, execute Qualification Protocols (For e.g. Installation, Operation, Performance) related to Computer Systems Software.
Perform periodic review of computer software systems for legacy systems as needed.
Review other Software Quality related documents like Requirements, Procedures, Traceability Matrix,
Develop software quality reports from the tools as needed
Participate in Kanban planning and project related meeting as applicable
Leverage of tools and technologies to develop, review and execute qualification protocols
Present the project to the Personalis Quality Compliance, Research and Development and Operations organization.
Emerge with valuable hands-on industry experience and find him/herself in a fantastic position for a career in the software industry
Work 100% remotely in the Pacific time zone

Requirements:
The ideal candidate will be completing their junior year of undergrad, or first year of graduate school in Engineering and Science and will be returning to school in the fall.
Currently in process of obtaining or recently obtained a B.S. or B.A. in Engineering, Sciences, S.T.E.M.
Some knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle, Computer System Validation, quality record documentation.
Ability to work effectively in a collaborative and dynamic environment.
Knowledge of test management tools, regulatory standards for software medical device, source code management will be bonus.

Application Process:
Submit your resume at https://boards.greenhouse.io/personalisinc by June 15 th , 2021.

Personalis is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabilities. Personalis offers a competitive compensation package.

We are seeking an innovative Product Management Intern in the SF Bay Area to help our Product Team align with software and strategic initiatives at Sikka Software. Qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled or recent graduate with Master’s Degree in CS or EE

  • This role requires a dynamic problem solver with a strong analytics and product focus rooted in operational excellence and a clear understanding of product success.
  • Innovative and creative, detail-oriented, organized, comfortable with mobile technologies, taking advantage of established content assets such as (but not limited to) twitter, instagram, snapchat, facebook, medium, quora
  • Post-marketing and iteration techniques such as MVP analytics product design, community and advocacy building, feedback channel metrics and more.

Full Job Description
Are you ready to join a growing team that puts a premium on productivity and has an award-winning culture, centered around transforming talented employees into effective business leaders?

Then Bankers Healthcare Group is the place for you. We offer innovative financial solutions to licensed and highly-skilled professionals, representing the best of both traditional lending and fintech, and are looking for passionate, impact players to help take our company to the next level.

At BHG, you’ll become immersed in the finance industry—with a variety of loan solutions, credit cards, patient financing, bank programs, and collections services, which have helped BHG become one of the leading providers of finance solutions.

With over 19 years in business, we have the stability of an established company with the speed and agility of a startup, where ingenuity and risk-taking are encouraged, and every employee has the opportunity to learn, grow and thrive.

You are a student or recent grad who has a passion for collaboration. You are an analytical thinker that has a strong customer focus. You are accountable for researching, analyzing, and documenting clear and actionable business requirements so that information can distribute them across one or more development teams to deliver the desired functionality incrementally.
What You'll Do
Assists with the definition and direction of complex features and enhancements
Defines and documents stories and conditions of acceptance with other stakeholders' input including Developers and QA
Utilizes exceptional communication skills and collaborates well with onshore and offshore resources
Validates proposed value with customers and prospects using research, prototypes, and designs
Identifies cross-team dependencies when leading a feature through the development process
Helps ensure customers and the organization is ready for new product releases by providing learning content and material and participating in knowledge transfer events as needed
Helps drive features through the development process by working with engineering, prioritizing functional requirements, making appropriate scope tradeoffs, and ensuring completed capability satisfies customers’ needs in a timely manner
Learns customer needs by participating in customer & internal stakeholder meetings
Assists member's services and engineering troubleshooting product escalations
Identifies and proposes process changes including a plan and success measures
What You'll Need
Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or related technical discipline
Strong analytical skills to understand business requirements and then break them down into more granular level requirements
Effective communication skills: ability to communicate complex concepts to stakeholders
Self-motivated and willing to do what it takes to get the job done
Positive team player attitude with excellent verbal and written communication skills
High degree of organizational skills
Life at BHG
At BHG, we work hard and aren’t afraid to take risks. Since the beginning, our core values of PMA (positive mental attitude), team player and loyalty have been the driving force behind every interaction we have between each other and our customers. We have a healthy respect for the daily grind, yet we value work/life balance. We believe that all employees should have the opportunity to lead and that good ideas can come from anyone. From the top-down, our leaders are actively involved not only in strategic oversight and running the business, but also in the wellbeing and growth of all employees. We consider people our #1 asset, and help employees realize their full potential, set and exceed their goals, and explore new opportunities for personal and professional development.

Why You Should Join BHG
We strive to offer amenities, opportunities, events, and programming that support the interests of our teams, while furthering the culture that makes us Great Place to Work® certified. Some of the benefits you can expect when you join BHG include:

  • 100% coverage of monthly health insurance premiums
  • Competitive PTO and vacation policies
  • Company 401(k) plan with employer contributions after one year
  • On-site gym access and memberships, with personal trainers, and certified nutritionists on staff
  • Company-sponsored training and certification opportunities
  • Monthly award ceremonies where top achievers are celebrated and receive additional bonuses
  • Ongoing volunteer opportunities to give back to the community through our BHG Cares program
If you’re ready for a career where you can exercise your passions, be surrounded by co-workers who are relentlessly committed to service, and have a team-player mindset, apply today!

** All Remote employee's at Bankers Healthcare Group are required to work within the United States of America.

Bankers Healthcare Group is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. Bankers Healthcare Group is an equal opportunity employer; committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

Full Job Description
Stonebranch builds dynamic IT automation solutions that transform business IT environments from simple IT task automation into sophisticated, real-time business service automation, helping organizations achieve the highest possible Return on Automation. No matter the degree of automation, Stonebranch software is simple, modern and secure. Using its universal automation platform, enterprises can seamlessly orchestrate workloads and data across technology ecosystems and silos. Headquartered in Alpharetta, Georgia with points of contact and support throughout the Americas, Europe, and Asia, Stonebranch serves some of the world's largest financial, manufacturing, healthcare, travel, transportation, energy, and technology institutions.

Your Part in this Growth Story:
Stonebranch is searching for a Solution Engineer Intern who’s interested in playing in the explosive IT automation market. As a Solution Engineer intern, you will contribute your knowledge and ideas in helping our Professional Services team on implementation projects of Stonebranch’s Universal Automation Center (UAC) family of products.

You will work under the guidance of a more senior engineer or team lead. Preference given to juniors, seniors, and recent graduates. This is a temporary role with potential to grow into a permanent position.

Your Impact on The Organization:
Participate in requirements sessions with the client to determine specific needs for product configuration.
Understand and participate in all the phases of Stonebranch’s UAC implementation including architectural analysis and design, deployment, conversion (from another existing software), development, optimization, and training.
Understand Stonebranch’s conversion methodology and support the client and other team members using it during a project implementation.
Understand the technical aspects of the conversion methodology and be ready to address issues and difficulties that may come up during the implementation process.
Take ownership tasks assigned to you and carry them out to completion in a timely manner.
Embrace Project Management and technical software implementation and configuration best practices.

What You Will Bring to the Team:
Full-time student pursuing undergraduate degree in one of the following fields or related studies: Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business Management.
Creative problem solving and critical thinking skills.
Superior written and verbal communication skills.
The desire and attitude to learn from Senior Engineers and work well in a collaborative environment.
Must be 18 years of age or older.

Knowledge of the following concepts and technologies:
One of the following programming languages: Java, Python, C and C++
High level knowledge of the Unix and Windows operating systems
Project Management concepts.
Basic understanding of SQL, HTML/Java Script and shell scripting.
Cloud architecture and concepts.
Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.

Why You’ll Love Stonebranch:
Competitive compensation
Workforce fitness program / gym reimbursement
Excellent health benefits
401k to help you save for your future
Regular social events
Paid holidays and generous time off policy to rest and recharge
Convenient North-Atlanta location

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.
