Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in Duck Creek Suite Distribution Management and integrations with other applications
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.

Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT, XPath and JSON.
Experience in development with the Java programming language and an Integrated Development Environment (i.e. Eclipse).
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures.

Experience with Azure or AWS hosted Cloud environments and Web Services is preferred.
Experience with a version control management system (i.e. Git) is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.

Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

Job Type: Internship

Full Job Description
Web Developer Intern – Resolve to Save Lives

Vital Strategies, headquartered in New York City, is an international public health organization that strengthens public health systems and addresses the world’s leading causes of illness, injury, and death. We currently work in over 70 countries, supporting data-driven decision making, advancing evidence-based public health policies and programs, and mounting strategic communication campaigns. Our programs are concentrated in low- and middle-income countries and cities in Africa, Latin America, Asia and the Pacific.

Resolve to Save Lives is a global health initiative of Vital Strategies that since 2017 has been working closely with governments, international organizations, community organizations, academic and other partners in more than 40 countries to save millions of lives by reducing preventable deaths from cardiovascular disease and strengthening capacity to prevent, detect and respond to epidemic threats. ; https://preventepidemics.org/; and https://linkscommunity.org/.

At Resolve to Save Lives, we value learning and professional development, and the contributions of a diverse workforce. We believe it is important to mentor future leaders from historically underrepresented groups who will grow personally and professionally and create impact in the public health sector. Interns at Resolve to Save Lives will have the chance to develop skills and contribute to our initiatives through engaging, meaningful work assignments that can help jump start their career in public health.

About this Role:
Simple is a digital tool that supports large-scale hypertension programs in India, Bangladesh, and Ethiopia. The Simple Team is composed of experts in many fields—from software designers and engineers to public health officials and doctors. We are a diverse team spread around the world—from India and the UK to San Francisco, Wisconsin, and New York.

The engineering intern will be focused on the Simple.org project at Resolve to Save Lives, with a particular focus on the Simple Dashboard, which is used by health systems managers to monitor how their hypertension program is doing. Read more about the Simple Dashboard here: https://www.simple.org/simple-dashboard/

The intern will be working with experienced Rails developers in the US and India to make improvements to the Simple Dashboard and to develop new features. The intern will work on real open source code that will benefit patients around the world.

Responsibilities:
Help to deliver features, fix bugs, and maintain our main Ruby on Rails application (https://github.com/simpledotorg/simple-server). This includes our admin dashboard, sync API, and various async jobs and tasks.
Assist in project planning, help ship new features, give suggestions to engineering and design peers
Assist in QA (quality assurance)
Work with our product and design team to iterate on product ideas (Fresh eyes help ensure that our user experience is high quality and simple to use for health professionals)
Work closely with other engineers via Slack, remote pair programming, code review sessions, and pull requests

Qualifications:
Undergraduate student
Area of study: Computer science or computer engineering
Familiarity with modern web development (Rails, Django, Node/React, etc.)
Experience using Git/GitHub or other version control systems

Internship Details:
Up to 25 hours a week, paid
September through December 2021
Internship will be remote, with the potential opportunity to visit the NYC offices when they re-open

Full Job Description
EEO Statement: We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

The Mercatus Center at George Mason University is seeking an intern for our Open Health / International Freedom team who will provide research assistance and quality assurance for data products. The focus of the Open Health project is to improve societal well-being and encouraging better governance by analyzing specific aspects of governance that have been traditionally difficult to measure. The focus of the International Freedom project is to develop natural language processing algorithms to monitor and interpret authoritarian press. The ideal candidate will have the opportunity to assist in our ongoing efforts to expand existing data products and create new ones.

Primary Responsibilities:
Provide research and participate in web scraping and algorithm development as needed to complete long and short term projects for scholars and the Open Health / International Freedom team that represent the Mercatus Center’s vision and add value to the organization.
Participate in data collection for algorithm development.
Provide quality assurance for data products developed by the Open Health / International Freedom Team.
Take initiative in proposing ideas, op-eds, charts, and papers for the Open Health / International Freedom team.
Take initiative in respectfully looking for ways to improve the efficiency and quality of work put out by the Open Health / International Freedom team.
Stay informed on current topics related to the data products under development.

Minimum Requirements:
Pursuit of a BA in computer science, economics, political science, or related fields is preferred.
Interest in data analysis and public policy issues.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work collaboratively on research projects with a team of two to three others.
Strong work ethic.
Help us Grow
Please submit your cover letter and resume through our online application process. Your cover letter must indicate your interest in the Mercatus Center's mission.

About the Mercatus Center at George Mason University
For 40 years, the Mercatus Center at George Mason University has been the world’s premier university source for market-oriented ideas—bridging the gap between academic ideas and real-world problems. A university-based research center, Mercatus works to advance knowledge about how markets work to improve our lives by training graduate students, conducting research, and applying sound economics to offer solutions to society’s most pressing problems.

About Our Opportunity

AVEVA infuses industrial software with intelligence to empower people to shape a sustainable future. We work with our customers and harness the power of our ecosystem to deliver operational agility and empower human expertise. Our solutions advance engineering and operations with Performance Intelligence. From water and energy to food and infrastructure, we inspire insights that transform opportunity into sustainable business value. We combine unparalleled intelligence with collaborative innovation to enable people and industries to thrive.

There are 6,000 of our people at 90 locations in more than 40 countries who challenge themselves and each other to create and improve the transformative technology our customers need. With our help, industries across the world can make a positive difference to the lives of people everywhere.

We take pride in our core values and the diversity of our people, valuing the unique experience and expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business. At AVEVA, we’re all about Limitless possibilities. Are you?

  • Performs development activities of basic complexity in areas such as coding within web-based, front end programs.

  • Adaptability & flexibility to change

  • Strong analytical ability
  • Strong written and oral communication skills
  • Able to manage multiple priorities
Education
  • Working towards a Bachelor’s Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or related discipline.

The recruitment process will involve a mix of interviews and a task. All of our recruitment is done virtually.

At POWER Engineers, Inc., you can have a rewarding career on every level. Full Job Description
Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in the Duck Creek Suite (Policy, Billing, Insights).
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.
Provide product support and maintenance for products in production.
Participate in developing documentation and job aid documents.

We are looking for candidates with…

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT and XPath.
Experience in with the C#, .NET programming language.
Experience with Angular frontend framework and JavaScript is preferred.
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

Full Job Description
On behalf of DFO Global Performance Commerce - its subsidiary agency, Amasa. DFO is on a mission to deliver superior eCommerce software, marketing, and products to make the world a better place.

ABOUT AMASA:
Amasa is a rapidly expanding digital marketing agency that is responsible for some of the most successful and innovative media and ecommerce campaigns online. We are expert, performance marketers who can complete the impossible when it comes to high volume global digital sales. We’ve tripled our growth in the past year, and are looking to go even further with amazing people like yourself!

Amasa is headquartered in downtown San Diego, CA.

OVERVIEW:
Are you a recent graduate looking to enter the fast-paced world of digital marketing and e-commerce? Want to learn how to craft digital marketing strategies for clients spending thousands per day on Facebook, Google, and through other programmatic online ad exchanges?

Eager to know how a multi-million dollar ecommerce agency is run and help real clients grow their business on day 1?

If so, you might be a fit for our internship program at Amasa. This internship will involve both remote work, and some socially-distant collaboration at our Gaslamp district office downtown. The office is regularly cleaned and sanitized, and we are following all CDC protocols for social distancing and safe reopening.

We are looking for smart, data-driven and creative young talent to train, then hopefully hire FULL TIME for our growing agency, in the role of either an Junior Account Manager or a Junior Facebook Media Buyer

In this role, you will:
Plan, manage, and execute digital media buys on Facebook and Instagram
Develop a collaborative relationship with internal and external creative teams to develop cutting-edge media assets.
Constantly learn and experiment new effective bidding, ad placement, and management techniques
Prepare research and insights to inform ongoing media recommendations
Learn to continuously monitor campaign performance and return-on-ad-spend (ROAS), while suggesting and executing ongoing optimization strategies to hit and exceed assigned KPIs
Learn project management tools and software
Assist with developing custom marketing proposals to both startups and global brands
Brainstorm and suggest marketing angles for clients
Perform administrative duties for meetings and other client related tasks
Learn how to A/B test ad creatives and various website components
Help with video and creative shoots
Create and analyze campaign performance reports to inform relevant teams at Amasa.
Perform other related duties as required or assigned

REQUIREMENTS:
Degree in one of the following subjects preferred: Business, Marketing, Statistics, Computer Science, Finance/Accounting, Psychology, Public Relations
Ability to come into the office 2x per week, and work remote (20-25 hours per week total)
Must be creative and have the desire to sell somebody something
Enjoy wearing many hats and managing several projects at one time
Strong communication skills
Computer proficiency
Social media savvy

BENEFITS:
Company issued Macbook Pro or PC
Office stocked with snacks, drinks, and beer
Work alongside awesome young talent and learn real world skills that are transferable to dozens of high earning jobs in a number of fields
Free parking

Full-time employment potential after 3 months

Located in Northwest Indiana to include Gary and Portage, the Plant Process Control Intern position at United States Steel Corporation affords the opportunity to apply educational experiences to real world industrial applications.

This assignment is for CURRENT STUDENTS looking for a paid internship that offers personal and professional development. We are looking for motivated self-starters that can work in a fast paced, data-driven environment.
The successful candidate will be an analytical problem solver, have an extremely high level of customer focus and a passion for process improvement.

Experiences are offered that encompass both existing system maintenance/enhancements, as well as ground up design, development and installation of new systems and processes, focused on productivity and quality improvements. Strong mentoring by seasoned Control Engineers ensures a mutually beneficial work experience.

Experience gained may include, but is not limited to the following:

  • Accurately design, develop and implement programs and systems to meet identified current and future business needs in accordance with current software development standards and standard operating procedures
  • Refine and maintain system software used to control process equipment and by modifying existing programs
  • Analyze and diagnose computer malfunctions and perform necessary corrective measures to efficiently return equipment and/or machinery to operational state that satisfies management objectives
  • Monitor and conduct necessary tests to assure digital systems are functioning properly
  • Collaborate with supervisors, operating personnel, and other maintenance personnel regarding system maintenance issues, as well as system enhancement requests
  • Perform specialized analysis and prepare written reports regarding test results and malfunctions encountered with equipment, offering recommendations for improvements
Requirements:
Candidates must be a full-time student pursuing a bachelor or master’s degree majoring in one of the following: Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering Technology, Electrical Engineering, or other IT/Engineering-related discipline.

  • Candidates must be a current student
  • Completed their sophomore year by December 2020
  • Be in good academic standing
  • Be authorized to work in the US without sponsorship
  • Must attach a recent transcript and any other related information to your application.
  • May roll into a year-round internship for the successful candidate

US-Non-Exempt

Steel is essential to advancing modern society. In fact, countless aspects of our lives wouldn’t be possible without it. From state-of-the-art household appliances and safer, more fuel-efficient automobiles — to steel framing that makes our homes stronger and tubular products that support the development of our nation’s energy resources — our products build quality of life for people around the world. Steel is on an exciting transformational journey to become the iconic corporation — a company set apart from the competition through the talent of our people, the quality of our product, and the strength of our performance. We are seeking talented, motivated people to help us create the next generation of U. S. Steel, known for consistently out-performing the competition, delivering superior returns, and creating value for our customers as a world-class supplier of innovative steel products and solutions.

  • A strong commitment to excellence and to personal and professional growth
  • Must be resourceful, responsible, tenacious, curious, independent, confident and high energy
  • The ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks.

position: Software Intern- Factory and Automation Controls (Fall 2021)
description:
Full Job Description
at Rivian Automotive
United States, Illinois, Normal

Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.

As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.

We operate development centers in Plymouth, Michigan; Southern California (Irvine, Carson & LA); Silicon Valley (San Jose and Palo Alto); Vancouver, British Columbia; and Surrey, England; as well as a manufacturing facility in Normal, Illinois.

Disclaimer: Applying to this requisition will place you into consideration for an internship on our Manufacturing Engineering team. Exact Team Allocation will be discussed during the hiring process.

Internship Term: Fall 2021
Rivian internships are experiences optimized for student candidates. To be eligible, you must be an undergraduate or graduate student in an accredited program during the internship term. If you are not pursuing a degree, please see our full time positions at Rivian.com/careers

Note that if your university has specific requirements for internship programs, it is your responsibility to fulfill those requirements.

Role Responsibilities:
Support what automation solutions in the manufacturing industries can be while automating the process of designing, developing, and deploying new production lines.
Create tools for auto-generating automation controls for manufacturing equipment including:
Electrical schematics
PLC code
Robot code
Human Machine Interfaces (HMI)
Create tools that allow for agile software development for automation controls including:
Auto-backups
Unit testing
Static Analysis
Deployment
Support the development of software for use in a Manufacturing Execution System (MES) for part quality, genealogy, and process control
Participate in the design and development of in-house software to use as a user-interface for controlling and troubleshooting automation equipment
Use modern software tools and practices to ensure high performance, low latency, and ease of deployment.

Qualifications:
Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science or Equivalent
Strong Plus: experience with programming HTML5, React, Go, Python, and similar
Knowledge of continuous integration & continuous deployment (CICD) pipeline tools such as Jenkins
Knowledge of or experience working on applications for the manufacturing industry
Willingness to work in a high volume, fast paced environment
Adaptability supporting ambitious goals and timelines

Full Job Description
Requisition ID: 283784
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP

Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

The SAP Innovation Center is looking for a highly motivated full-stack software development intern to join the team for an internship. This is a remote position for pacific time zone. In case the situation permits, office visits in Palo Alto, CA and Newport Beach, CA will be possible. In this role, you will be able to work on a variety of cutting-edge technologies and projects, such as blockchain, self-sovereign identity, data science and machine learning projects.

The SAP Innovation Center is a global and diverse team with locations around the world. You will get the opportunity to build and contribute to solutions that future-proof SAP.

https://icn.sap.com/

What you’ll do:
Position title: SAP Innovation Center Intern – Software Developer
Location: Palo Alto, California
Expected start date: June 2021

In this role, you’ll:
Develop full-stack applications using state of the art frameworks
Be a contributor in an agile project team with SCRUM setup
Work with stakeholders and team members in solving complex problems
Design and develop front-end interfaces, RESTful APIs and backend systems
Learn about cutting-edge technologies such as blockchain, self-sovereign identity, or machine learning applications
Integrate solutions into SAP enterprise software

Who you are:
We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

Strong programming skills in either Python, JavaScript, or Java
Candidates to currently be enrolled in a master’s degree program which is applicable to the position (computer science or equivalent proven experience)
Experience building web applications
Strong communication skills that include the ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions
Thrive in a fast-paced environment working with multiple teams across various geographies
Preferred experience: familiarity with front-end frameworks, micro service architecture, cloud applications (AWS, GCP), SQL, Docker, GitHub

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

NetStandard is a leading provider of strategic information technology solutions for small and midsized businesses. Our full-service technology solutions include managed technology services, virtual machines, cloud computing and data center services, all delivered with a consultative approach and supported by our expert teams of engineers.
NetStandard is seeking an intern who is interested in learning more about IT and Systems Engineering through the operations of a Managed Service Provider during our 10-week internship program, with departmental rotations. This individual will need to be comfortable working in a fast paced environment, and will get the exciting opportunity to immerse themselves in all aspects of our operations including but not limited to: Managed Services, Technical Support, NOC team, Project Management, Customer Support, and more! We are looking for an intern who is eager to learn, professional, and collaborative for our best in class team.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Work closely with assigned engineering team and other team members to shadow and understand various job roles
Responsible for day to day tier 1- 1.5 IT support for both external and internal NSI clients through ticketing system and phone calls

Assist with the procurement, quotes, and delivering and retrieving equipment to and from appropriate locations
Maintain effective communication with teammates through both verbal and written documentation
Take ownership and effectively complete or make significant progress on assigned project during each departmental rotation
Take ownership and effectively complete or make significant progress on assigned project during each departmental rotation
Additional duties as assigned

Excellent organizational and time-management skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and a positive & professional attitude are required
Excellent customer service and people skills
Must have reliable transportation
Must be able to meet work hour requirements of 8:00 am-5:00 pm, Monday-Friday throughout the 10-week program
Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs.

Education and Experience:
Current enrollment in a related IT, Computer Science, or Technology degree or professional program

Full Job Description
About the Company:
Epiphany Management Group is GROWING! Epiphany Management Group is a fast-growing trusted technology partner delivering excellent service in the Health and Government sector. We are a multi-division company with fast growth on the immediate horizon. Our innovative management approach and focus make us very effective & unique in this market. Through technology we help improve outcomes, collaboration, management, and efficiency.

POSITION SUMMARY

Earn money and gain valuable business experience to boost your resume. The internship will center around Data & Analytics, specifically focused on Business Intelligence utilizing Microsoft Power BI. The selected candidate will work with the leadership team to achieve assigned project goals and deliverables including management reports and dashboards.

The candidate will gain exposure to business, get experience developing requirements, utilizing blends of data architecture and structure while building relationships and meeting project deadlines. Our business is focused on providing call center services for tier 1 technical support, so the data and the output you develop will center around writing scripts and queries to access and summarize call and agent data.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Includes, but is not limited to the following:
Codes application interfaces and data transfer mechanisms as required to support and integrate business applications.
Assists in the design of Power BI data models to deliver Business Intelligence reporting.
Writes scripts and queries for business applications, and/or ad-hoc data analysis.
Transform manual queries ad reports into daily generated reports and dashboards.
Interprets code to write user documentation

Required Qualifications:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
Some previous exposure to SQL and Power BI through either schooling or practical experience.
Current or previous enrollment in an accredited college or university obtaining a degree in Computer Science or related discipline.
Ability to work independently and as part of a larger team.
Demonstrate a high level of personal integrity and strong work ethic and ability to learn quickly.
Ability to present a clear, concise, visual message through data, both in summary and detail.
Orientation toward detail and thoroughness.
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills.

Preferred Qualifications:
An understanding of transactional and data warehouse database design patterns.
Technical knowledge regarding data models, database design & development, data mining and analysis.
Familiarity with various database querying language, report development, presentation tools and techniques.
Working knowledge of data warehousing and analytic reporting and of the following tools, applications and programming language: SQL, Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio, Microsoft Power BI, ad Excel
Work Environment
This job operates in an office setting. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.

Full Job Description
Company Overview
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.
Business Unit Overview
NetherRealm: The creative team that brought Mortal Kombat and Injustice to life is now NetherRealm Studios, part of the Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment family. With over 20 years of creation under our belts, NetherRealm’s mission remains the same; to create cutting edge entertainment and deliver industry leading tech, game art and overall gaming experiences. NetherRealm Studios is a collaborative and creative environment, constantly striving to up the ante on what is possible in interactive entertainment. We encompass the best of both worlds – a team of dedicated professionals with years of experience, who are also at the forefront of an industry taking over the entertainment landscape. The passion and energy that made Mortal Kombat a reality is still on display every day in our offices, our hallways and most definitely the studio’s arcade room! Monolith: For the past 20 years Monolith has been obsessed with delivering a unique gaming experience for our fans. Starting with Blood, our very first title – all the way to our most recent offering, Middle-Earth: Shadow of Mordor, we are constantly pushing the envelope to combine innovative gameplay, inventive narratives, cutting edge tech & AI, and stunning visuals. We are challenging ourselves even further to ensure that our next game is going to be our best yet. That’s where you come in – for us to achieve that we need the best and brightest talent the industry has to offer. Come join us and help create our next AAA title! Turbine: Founded in 1994, Turbine, Inc., a Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment development studio, is focused on creating free-to-play games for mobile platforms. The studio is utilizing its extensive expertise in creating persistent online worlds that foster powerful social gaming communities to develop its mobile titles, which include Batman™: Arkham Underworld and the upcoming Game of Thrones® mobile game. Avalanche: Avalanche Software was acquired by Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment from Disney in 2016. The studio's first title under WBIE is a companion video game to the upcoming Cars 3, in partnership with Warner Bros., Disney, and Pixar. WB Games SF: Warner Bros. is a top video games publisher across multiple platforms. In mobile games, we have a growing portfolio of hits that includes DC Legends, Mortal Kombat X, and LEGO Star Wars: The Complete Saga, and we continue to expand by adding great people and leveraging the best portfolio of brands and intellectual property in the industry, such as DC Comics, Harry Potter, and LEGO. We are looking to add enthusiastic, talented and experienced professionals to our Mobile Publishing team. WB Games New York: WB Games New York works with some of the top talent in the game industry to build online competitive and social features for video games. Our highly experienced team of engineers utilize cutting-edge technology to build game services that are robust and scalable enough to support world-class developers such as NetherRealm Studios, Rocksteady, Monolith Productions, WB Montréal, and more!
Opportunity Overview
The Job

WB Games Inc. seeks a Data Engineer Intern for the WB Games Boston Data Analytics department.

The WB Games studio is looking for passionate and curious professionals to help level up their data and analytics team. Like us, you love games, and love to have fun. We look for those whose curiosity drives them to try new things, aren’t afraid to fail, and continuously learn.

The Data challenges at WB Games are extensive and you can expect to level up in all data domains. This includes software engineering, cloud-based systems, truly BIG data engineering and analytics.

The Daily

Be part of the game development process, helping teams design and implement analytic-based features.
Learn the internals of building a robust end-to-end data pipeline on all levels especially in databases, data modelling, data processing infrastructure and software development.
Contribute code to production data systems and gain strong software engineering practice.
Gain hands-on experience in distributed data processing technologies: Redshift, Airflow, Presto and Looker.
Learn techniques for high volume distributed data processing and storages.
Ensure the integrity, availability, and confidentiality of data, database systems and supporting services.

The Essentials

You have a drive to learn, ask questions and motivation to find the answers.
You are familiar with one or more of these technologies: Python, PostgreSQL, Go
You are comfortable with DevOps cloud tools (Amazon, EC2, or Google Cloud) and have some working knowledge of monitoring tools
You have side projects or viewable public code on Github, Bitbucket, etc.
You are currently pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical discipline, with an expected graduation date of 2020 or 2021

Bonus Skills

You love games and have checked out our current title
You are well-versed in object-oriented programming (OOP)
You have some experience with Hadoop or other data engineering or database software
You have side projects or viewable public code on Github, Bitbucket, etc.
But Wait, There’s More!
The Perks

  • Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings
  • Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees
  • Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies
  • Access to in-house learning and development resources
  • Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands
Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

Full Job Description
Company:
Qualcomm Incorporated

Job Area:
Interns Group, Interns Group > Intern

Job Overview:
Qualcomm is a company of inventors that unlocked 5G ushering in an age of rapid acceleration in connectivity and new possibilities that will transform industries, create jobs, and enrich lives. But this is just the beginning. It takes inventive minds with diverse skills, backgrounds, and cultures to transform 5Gs potential into world-changing technologies and products. This is the Invention Age - and this is where you come in.

Before there were smartphones or smart cities, before autonomous cars or 360° virtual reality videos, there was our technology. Headquartered in San Diego, for over 30 years Qualcomm inventions have inspired others to make the impossible, possible. From 5G to artificial intelligence, from IoT to automotive and extended reality applications, Qualcomm is inventing the technologies of an intelligently connected future, spearheading research efforts for the next global wireless standard, and collaborating with industry leaders in the wireless value chain to make this future a commercial reality.

As a Qualcomm Campus Team I ntern , you will be responsible for the technical aspects of our summer program. This includes building out websites, highlighting Qualcomm Technologies, and hosting our summer online hackathon.

Minimum Qualification:
Academic and/ or project experience in web development

Knowledge of hackathons

Preferred Qualifications:
Academic and/ or project experience in building Sharepoint websites

Knowledge of HTML/CSS, Python, Php

Educational Requirements:
In study towards a bachelors in computer science, engineering, or a related field

Must be available for 10 – 16 weeks during Summer 2021 (May-September) with a graduation date of December 2021 or later

Working at Qualcomm may be the closest you’ll get to experiencing time travel. You won’t just work in a lab or write lines of code. Our interns join world-class teams to help define and build what is next for mobility and the world.

You’ll be paired with a mentor with visibility to your project and team, receive support from your manager and have access to the entire Qualcomm employee community to ensure your success.

In addition to competitive pay and accrued vacation time, you will receive full relocation coverage and furnished housing accommodations for the duration of your internship

We’ll make sure you have fun outside of work with weekend surf lessons & beach days, networking opportunities with Qualcomm executives and professionals, company-wide mentorship program platform, overnight hackathon, community service opportunities, and so much more...

Whether you're graduating and seeking a full-time position after your internship, or hoping to return for another internship the following year, you will be considered for a returning offer through an evaluation of your work from the summer.

  • Certain program offerings are only available in certain office locations or to those who qualify based on pre-determined criteria. Specific benefits provided for given roles and locations will be detailed at the time of offer.
All Qualcomm employees are expected to actively support diversity on their teams, and in the Company.

Qualcomm is also committed to making our workplace accessible for individuals with disabilities. Qualcomm is an equal opportunity employer and supports workforce diversity.

Full Job Description
Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in the Duck Creek Suite (Policy, Billing, Insights).
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.
Provide product support and maintenance for products in production.
Participate in developing documentation and job aid documents.

We are looking for candidates with…

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT and XPath.
Experience in with the C#, .NET programming language.
Experience with Angular frontend framework and JavaScript is preferred.
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

General:
MedPro Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

The Assured Software and Information Division within the Georgia Tech Research Institute (GTRI) seeks an intern for the fall 2021 semester to research techniques in data characterization and data modeling for machine learning projects. This position requires working in Python and evaluating models in open source machine learning platforms, such as PyTorch or Tensorflow. Additional requirements include the ability to prototype example models in at least one of these platforms. This intern will work within a diverse team of mathematicians, physicists, computer scientists, and engineers exploring new ways of representing cyber domain data for machine learning projects. Cybersecurity topic domains include algorithm assurance, software assurance, and cyber-physical systems security. GTRI is the nonprofit applied research arm of the Georgia Institute of Technology (Georgia Tech) and is located in midtown Atlanta on Georgia Tech’s campus.

Intern

Experience in Python and a machine learning platform, such as PyTorch or Tensorflow

Configuration management tools

40 hours per week

Full Job Description
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

NetherRealm: The creative team that brought Mortal Kombat and Injustice to life is now NetherRealm Studios, part of the Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment family. With over 20 years of creation under our belts, NetherRealm’s mission remains the same; to create cutting edge entertainment and deliver industry leading tech, game art and overall gaming experiences. NetherRealm Studios is a collaborative and creative environment, constantly striving to up the ante on what is possible in interactive entertainment. We encompass the best of both worlds – a team of dedicated professionals with years of experience, who are also at the forefront of an industry taking over the entertainment landscape. The passion and energy that made Mortal Kombat a reality is still on display every day in our offices, our hallways and most definitely the studio’s arcade room! Monolith: For the past 20 years Monolith has been obsessed with delivering a unique gaming experience for our fans. Starting with Blood, our very first title – all the way to our most recent offering, Middle-Earth: Shadow of Mordor, we are constantly pushing the envelope to combine innovative gameplay, inventive narratives, cutting edge tech & AI, and stunning visuals. We are challenging ourselves even further to ensure that our next game is going to be our best yet. That’s where you come in – for us to achieve that we need the best and brightest talent the industry has to offer. Come join us and help create our next AAA title! Turbine: Founded in 1994, Turbine, Inc., a Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment development studio, is focused on creating free-to-play games for mobile platforms. The studio is utilizing its extensive expertise in creating persistent online worlds that foster powerful social gaming communities to develop its mobile titles, which include Batman™: Arkham Underworld and the upcoming Game of Thrones® mobile game. Avalanche: Avalanche Software was acquired by Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment from Disney in 2016. The studio's first title under WBIE is a companion video game to the upcoming Cars 3, in partnership with Warner Bros., Disney, and Pixar. WB Games SF: Warner Bros. is a top video games publisher across multiple platforms. In mobile games, we have a growing portfolio of hits that includes DC Legends, Mortal Kombat X, and LEGO Star Wars: The Complete Saga, and we continue to expand by adding great people and leveraging the best portfolio of brands and intellectual property in the industry, such as DC Comics, Harry Potter, and LEGO. We are looking to add enthusiastic, talented and experienced professionals to our Mobile Publishing team. WB Games New York: WB Games New York works with some of the top talent in the game industry to build online competitive and social features for video games. Our highly experienced team of engineers utilize cutting-edge technology to build game services that are robust and scalable enough to support world-class developers such as NetherRealm Studios, Rocksteady, Monolith Productions, WB Montréal, and more!

The Job

WB Games Inc. seeks a Data Engineer Intern for the WB Games Boston Data Analytics department.

The WB Games studio is looking for passionate and curious professionals to help level up their data and analytics team. Like us, you love games, and love to have fun. We look for those whose curiosity drives them to try new things, aren’t afraid to fail, and continuously learn.

The Data challenges at WB Games are extensive and you can expect to level up in all data domains. This includes software engineering, cloud-based systems, truly BIG data engineering and analytics.

The Daily

Be part of the game development process, helping teams design and implement analytic-based features.
Learn the internals of building a robust end-to-end data pipeline on all levels especially in databases, data modelling, data processing infrastructure and software development.
Contribute code to production data systems and gain strong software engineering practice.
Gain hands-on experience in distributed data processing technologies: Redshift, Airflow, Presto and Looker.
Learn techniques for high volume distributed data processing and storages.
Ensure the integrity, availability, and confidentiality of data, database systems and supporting services.

The Essentials

You have a drive to learn, ask questions and motivation to find the answers.
You are familiar with one or more of these technologies: Python, PostgreSQL, Go
You are comfortable with DevOps cloud tools (Amazon, EC2, or Google Cloud) and have some working knowledge of monitoring tools
You have side projects or viewable public code on Github, Bitbucket, etc.
You are currently pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical discipline, with an expected graduation date of 2020 or 2021

Bonus Skills

You love games and have checked out our current title
You are well-versed in object-oriented programming (OOP)
You have some experience with Hadoop or other data engineering or database software
You have side projects or viewable public code on Github, Bitbucket, etc.

The Perks

  • Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings
  • Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees
  • Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies
  • Access to in-house learning and development resources
  • Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands
Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

position: College to Corporate IT Internship - Risk & Security
description:
Full Job Description
Bring courage and clarity to risk and security

At Vanguard, we’re changing the way the world invests by always doing the right thing for our clients. That means security is more than a priority; it’s fundamental to our purpose. Protecting our investors from risk requires clear goals, big ideas and resolute action. As part of our College to Corporate Internship Program in the Risk and Security track, you’ll build solutions that keep Vanguard safe day in and day out – protecting twenty million investors from ever-evolving threats by staying one step ahead. Make it count.

In this program you will:
Help to drive security strategy for a people-centric organization
Develop your technical skills and business knowledge
Learn by working side by side with industry authorities on high-profile projects and through coaching with our Risk, HR, and IT leadership teams
Gain exposure to the latest thinking on digital ethics, online security, risk analysis, fraud mitigation, system modification and threat detection
Learn not only the technical components of risk and security, but how to effectively communicate risk and security topics to our business partners

What it takes:
In pursuit of a bachelor's or master's degree with a concentration in computer science, computer engineering, IST, IT, CIS, Security Risk Analysis or related technical/engineering discipline required
Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher preferred
Proven leadership skills
Effective analytical, communication skills

Special Factors

Vanguard is not offering sponsorship for this position

This position will begin in the summer of 2022 and last approximately 10 weeks.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

description:
Full Job Description

Internship Summer/Fall 2021 - Game Artist, 3D Modeler

Begin: June 23rd

This is for internship Only.

***All applicants are REQUIRED to submit a link to any playable games or videos of games that you have worked on. No Exceptions

Note: This internship is NOT for beginner level Game Artist. Your skill set will need to be intermediate or higher.

Previous Simulation Game Artist/Designer/Programmer internship is preferred.

---------------------------------------------------

Who We Are:

Alexis Day Agency is a boutique Brand Design and Graphic Design agency based in Los Angeles seeking a highly creative, visually innovative and forward-thinking Game Artist - Environment Modeler, 2D, 3D Modeler intern. In this internship role, you will help create concepts and assets for a simulated atmosphere for a high-end brands project. Ideal candidate loves designing virtual simulated atmospheres. We are looking for an innovative artist with a unique, clean and realistic design style, and who loves a challenge and to be different.

ATTENTION: This internship is not for beginner designers. You must be at an intermediate level or higher to work with our high achiever intern team. You will be working on a new and very unique project that requires Game Artist, Game Designer, Programmer, modeling, texturing, rendering, and animation experience. This project will add an uncommon piece of work for your portfolio that no one else will have in the competitive gaming marketplace.

On a day-to-day basis you will get to do the following:

Responsibilities

  • Provide concepts and storyboards for in-development game mechanics and features.
  • Participate in the look/feel, development, and conceptual process for new game like ideas
  • Participate in the full art cycle from pre-production to post-production
  • Build and create game assets up to the high standards required by the end user.
  • Participate in visual critiques and brainstorms.

Requirements

  • 2+ years of experience as a game artist
  • 2 years of game atmosphere development
  • 2 years of 2D, 3D Modeling
  • 2 years of texturing
  • 2 years of Realistic game design aesthetic
  • Experience in development, animating and producing production art for mobile game-like simulation atmospheres, and marketing material.
  • Attention to detail
  • Sense of urgency and a desire to get things done.
  • Must have your own computer with access to the latest design software.
  • Able to work remotely very dependable, reliable and maturely.
  • Ability to work within deadlines.
  • Take direction and constructive critiquing well
  • Self-starter, take initiative, require minimal supervision
  • Work well in a creative team environment
  • Have a no task too small attitude

Benefits

  • Work directly with company CEO, as well as work on your own remotely.
  • Brainstorming with other artist, designer and marketing interns as needed.
  • An opportunity to have your work seen in over 70 countries and showcased through an award-winning luxury lifestyle publication, read by affluent end users.

The opportunity to be recognized in the award-winning luxury lifestyle publication The Contour of Luxury™. View publication here: www.contourofluxury.com.

Education:

College Senior, College Grad or Grad Student with a 3.5 GPA or higher ONLY.

Must have or are completing an Associates degree or higher in Gaming, Computer Science, or related field.

Compensation:

College Credit, unpaid internship

**Commission Payment offered on applicable paid projects that are approved and completed.

Our design projects help build competitive portfolios.

------------------------------------------------

What our interns have said: http://www.alexisdayagency.com/whatourinternssay/

------------------------------------------------

Internship Hours:

Must be able to intern a minimum of 20 hours 3-5 days a week with a 4 months commitment.

Internship Work Schedule:

You will create your schedule to accommodate your work and/or school class schedule

*Internship schedule must be the same every week.

***All applicants are REQUIRED to submit a link to any playable games or videos of games that you have worked on. No Exceptions

Full Job Description
At BWX Technologies, Inc. (NYSE: BWXT), we are People Strong, Innovation Driven. Headquartered in Lynchburg, Va., BWXT provides safe and effective nuclear solutions for national security, clean energy, environmental remediation, nuclear medicine and space exploration. With approximately 6,400 employees, BWXT has 12 major operating sites in the U.S. and Canada. We are the sole manufacturer of naval nuclear reactors for U.S. submarines and aircraft carriers. Our company supplies precision manufactured components, services and fuel for the commercial nuclear power industry across four continents. Our joint ventures provide environmental remediation and nuclear operations management at more than a dozen U.S. Department of Energy and NASA facilities. BWXT’s technology is driving advances in medical radioisotope production in North America and microreactors for various defense and space applications. Follow us on Twitter at @BWXTech and learn more at www.bwxt.com.

BWXT is currently seeking an IT Support Intern for its Mount Vernon, IN location!

Job Description/Duties:
Provide Tier 1 support role for customers and tracking performance through the IT Support Work orders.
Configure mobile phones and mobility solutions.
Assist with mobility usage and configuration reporting.
Provide customers with local desk side and telephone support resolving issues, prioritizing problems and escalating as needed.
Assist customers with desktop operating systems, email, Microsoft Office, PC hardware and Remote Access.
Communicate any current outage/critical incident status to callers and, if new information/symptoms reported notify IT management team.
Communicate with teams within IT to develop solutions to work orders.
Participate in teams to support IT projects.
Install hardware components, desktop operating system software, and application software (Windows 10, Microsoft Office, etc.).

Job Qualifications/Requirements:
Must be currently enrolled and have completed some college coursework in an IT or Computer Science degree program.
Must be able to work 15-25 hours per week between 7:30 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Must be willing to commit to working part time during the school year and full-time during summer and break periods.
Must be highly self-motivated with the ability to organize and prioritize work tasks
Must have awareness of the PC hardware components, desktop operating system software, application software and some network troubleshooting.
Must have strong analytical skills and the ability to troubleshoot and resolve hardware and software problems as well as have the ability to research and understand technical documentation. Experience in a technical call center, customer service team or IT/Help service desk is a plus.
Strong verbal, written, interpersonal, organizational and customer service skills is required.
Must have strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills and the ability to improve processes to be more efficient.
Must have the ability to communicate complex problems and solutions to end users.
Must be able to work in local and remote teams.
Ability to obtain and maintain a DOE security clearance is required.
Must be a U.S. citizen with no dual citizenship.

Applicants selected will be subject to a Federal background investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information or matter. Position requires U.S. citizenship with (no dual citizenship) ability to obtain and maintain a Department of Energy (DOE) security clearance which involves an extensive criminal and financial background investigation, drug test and previous employment reference verifications.

BWXT supports diversity and is committed to the concept of Equal Employment Opportunity. Job Description:
Summary This paid internship will assist in all areas of technical operations for the Brewer’s front office and Miller Park. The ideal candidate will be able to work 15 - 25 hours per week depending on department workload and class schedule.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Other duties may be assigned.

Work with IT staff to field and log all basic trouble tickets and service requests
Assist with support of desktop and laptop computers, printers, telephones and mobile devices

Assist with configuring and distributing new desktop and laptop computers
Assist with small application development projects and enhancements to existing applications

Organize and maintain IT assets and inventory
Troubleshoot and research solutions for end-user device issues

Qualifications To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Desire to work with people in a demanding yet highly rewarding industry
Familiarity with networking, computers and mobile devices
Experience with desktop applications especially Windows 10, Microsoft Office 2016 Suite and Apple Mac OS (preferred)
Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
Detail oriented, organized and thorough in order to best serve end-users
Structured approach to problem solving and ability to document common processes and procedures
Committed to going “above and beyond” to serve the customer
Ability to lift 50 lbs. and handle physically challenging tasks
Availability to work standard support hours (M-F, 9-5) along with occasional after-hours and weekend support

Education and/or Experience

Student within three or four semesters of completing an accredited college degree in computer science or information technology; or three to six months related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Computer Skills

To perform the job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of Microsoft Office software including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.

Language Skills

Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos. Ability to write simple correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization.

Mathematical Skills

Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.

Reasoning Ability

Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed but uninvolved written or oral instructions. Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations.

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly lift and /or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision and ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly exposed to outside weather conditions, which may include heat, cold and various forms of precipitation. The employee is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet.

Work Hours

Business hours are Monday – Friday 9 am – 5pm, however, additional hours may be required on weekends,

evenings and some holidays. Additional hours may also be required as part of an on-call rotation to cover some weekends, evenings, and holidays throughout the year.

position: Project Management Data Analyst Fall Intern
description:
Full Job Description
About Osmose

With 85 years of experience, Osmose proudly serves the electric utility and telecommunications industries across the U.S., helping enable the delivery of safe, reliable and affordable electricity and communications services to millions of customers nationwide. We are the industry leader in wood and steel structure condition assessment, life-extension and rehabilitation services. Our mission is to accurately inspect and mitigate aging infrastructure in a planned, programmatic manner that minimizes owner costs while maximizing benefits.

Headquartered in Peachtree City, Georgia, with satellite offices in Atlanta, Buffalo, Syracuse and Boston, the Osmose footprint extends throughout the country. Our employees are inspired to perform each and every day by our core values of integrity, customer focus, safety, respect, excellence, flexibility, efficiency and ownership. Our staff and field personnel represent some of the most tenured, well trained, and innovative professionals in the industry.

Osmose is currently seeking a Data Analyst Intern in our Project Management Department to become an integral part of our team this Fall! You will analyze data to understand business and market trends in order to increase company revenue and efficiency.

This position is based at our corporate office in Peachtree City, GA. Pay is between $14 - $17 per hour.

Preference will be given to student pursuing a bachelor’s degree in industrial engineering, math or computer science with focus on database management.

Responsibilities
Generate project dashboards and reports
Use data to understand business patterns and trends
Analyze internal and external data through quantitative research
Communicate findings to company through standard and ad hoc reports
Promote best practices in data analysis and reporting
Collaborate with cross-functional teams
Qualifications
Previous experience in business intelligence, analysis, or other related field
Knowledge of statistical tools and business reporting
Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills
Strong attention to detail
Ability to prioritize and multitask
Must be a self-starter with proficiency in MS Excel, MS Word, MS PowerPoint, and the ability to lead presentations with confidence
Candidates with basic programming experience with tools such as MATLAB are preferred

Osmose is an Equal Opportunity employer. EOE M/F/Disabled/Vet

Full Job Description
About Our Opportunity

AVEVA infuses industrial software with intelligence to empower people to shape a sustainable future. We work with our customers and harness the power of our ecosystem to deliver operational agility and empower human expertise. Our solutions advance engineering and operations with Performance Intelligence. From water and energy to food and infrastructure, we inspire insights that transform opportunity into sustainable business value. We combine unparalleled intelligence with collaborative innovation to enable people and industries to thrive.

There are 6,000 of our people at 90 locations in more than 40 countries who challenge themselves and each other to create and improve the transformative technology our customers need. With our help, industries across the world can make a positive difference to the lives of people everywhere.

We take pride in our core values and the diversity of our people, valuing the unique experience and expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business. At AVEVA, we’re all about Limitless possibilities. Are you?

Overview
This is an exciting internship opportunity which will be primarily remote, with the potential to work out of our Lake Forest office if appropriate. It will last around 3 months, with flexible start and end dates.

The intern will join the scrum team and support with cloud native technology.

Key Responsibilities
  • Performs development activities of basic complexity in areas such as coding within web-based, front end programs.
  • May contribute to the identification of technical and procedural areas of concern to avoid gaps and problems in achieving project and/or team objectives.
  • May partner with colleagues to design and drive the development of software code.
  • Provides feedback and suggestions for process improvement at the conclusion of each project sprint.
We need to see evidence of these things within your application:

Technical
  • Programming skills in C#, Python, Java script
  • A good understanding of design principles and coding competency demonstrated in code experience.
Generic
  • Adaptability & flexibility to change
  • Self-motivation for learning
  • Results orientated
  • Independence and decision making
  • Strong analytical ability
  • Strong written and oral communication skills
  • Able to manage multiple priorities
Education
  • Working towards a Bachelor’s Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or related discipline.
Applicants are encouraged to briefly detail their skills in a cover letter.

The recruitment process will involve a mix of interviews and a task. All of our recruitment is done virtually.
To stay up to date with Early Careers opportunities at AVEVA, sign up to our newsletter here - https://mailchi.mp/4cfcfa329ea5/sign-up

AVEVA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to being an exemplar employer with an inclusive culture, developing a workplace environment where all our employees are treated with dignity and respect. We value diversity and the expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business.
Come and join AVEVA to create the transformative technology that enables our customers to engineer a better world.

Concerning agencies: AVEVA does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

Full Job Description
Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in the Duck Creek Suite (Policy, Billing, Insights).
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.
Provide product support and maintenance for products in production.
Participate in developing documentation and job aid documents.

We are looking for candidates with…

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT and XPath.
Experience in with the C#, .NET programming language.
Experience with Angular frontend framework and JavaScript is preferred.
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.
