Full Job Description
Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in Duck Creek Suite Distribution Management and integrations with other applications
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.
Provide product support and maintenance for products in production.
Participate in developing documentation and job aid documents.

We are looking for candidates with…

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT, XPath and JSON.
Experience in development with the Java programming language and an Integrated Development Environment (i.e. Eclipse).
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures.
Experience with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) is preferred.
Experience with Azure or AWS hosted Cloud environments and Web Services is preferred.
Experience with a version control management system (i.e. Git) is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

General:
MedPro Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Full Job Description
To reinvent an industry, you have to build the best team. Join Formlabs if you want to bring groundbreaking professional 3D printers to the desktop of every designer, engineer, researcher, and artist in the world.

Formlabs' web team designs and maintains our websites which provide our customers with compelling learning and shopping experiences. We also empower internal users with the tools to manage website content and experiences. We are looking for a curious and motivated intern to help us create data-driven and user-centric experiences for our website.

If you're passionate about driving projects to help solve customer problems, and want to work with a remarkable, interdisciplinary team building a 3D printing ecosystem, we want you on the Form Team as a Software Product Management Intern. You will report to the Software Product Manager for our Websites.

The Job:
Work with stakeholders and various teams to research, gather requirements, design and vet new features for the website.
Define requirements for our development team and then coordinate testing of new features.
Create reporting and analyse the success of new features in order to quickly iterate or test new hypotheses.
Coordinate and prioritize incoming website feature requests or bug fixes from stakeholders.
Analyse data quality and set up reporting for key website metrics and features.
Participate in, and contribute to improvements in, the Web team's scrum ceremonies.

You:
Strong track record of academic excellence in a BA/BS program, majoring in Economics, Finance, Business Administration, Computer Science, Data Science, Math, Physics, Statistics or other technical field. First-year MBA candidates preferred.
Comfortable in a data-driven business environment.
Knowledge of SQL and skilled in Excel and/or Google Sheets.
Ability to think and perform both tactically and strategically.
Strong track record of success with progression in level of responsibility and scope.
Ability to multitask, and pivot readily and react to real-time data.
Excellent interpersonal and team building skills.
Excited to join an experienced team and work on high impact projects.

Bonus:
Familiarity with Test and Learn practices.
Exposure to the agile software development lifecycle.
Experience building reporting in Tableau or similar tools.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Even if you don't check every box, but see yourself contributing, please apply. Help us build an inclusive community that will change the face of 3D printing.

position: Summer Internship – Jr. Webmaster IT Intern
description:
Full Job Description
Company Description

Interco is a global recycling company headquartered on the Illinois-side of St. Louis in Madison. The company has been an industry leader providing metals, computers and electronics recycling services with a focused track record of innovation and integrity in since 1996.

The 400,000+ sqft. Interco Metaltronics recycling facility is comprised of five buildings on more than 40 acres centrally located on the Illinois-side of St. Louis in the shadows of the Gateway Arch. The facility boasts a 145,000 sqft. processing plant dedicated to the processing of computers, electronics, and batteries with the remainder of the indoor facility used for the processing of nonferrous industrial metals.

The company specializes in the placement of smelter-ready materials catering to commercial, industrial, dealer, and government organizations nationwide. Interco ships nonferrous and electronics scrap worldwide utilizing established partnerships with end consumers in the United States, Europe, Latin America and Asia.

The Interco team — consisting of commercial, logistics, administrative, and operations departments — delivers innovative solutions, competitive pricing, and quality service throughout the supply chain.

https://www.intercotradingco.com

Job Description

The Jr. Webmaster IT Intern works as part of the IT department to manage the company’s 50+ websites. This position will assist with the functionality of the websites, evaluating and managing website performance, facilitating hosting and server management, and working with the Marketing Department to update website content.

The right candidate will have an analytical mind and an understanding of WordPress, current website best practices, Search Engine Optimization (SEO), and the latest associated analytics and strategies. The Jr. Webmaster IT Intern should display a basic understanding of Content Management Systems (CMS) and technology infrastructures using CSS, Firewalls, IDS/IPS, Web-Proxy and Security Audits. Top candidates are expected to display attention to detail and problem-solving skills and the desire to work hard and contribute while learning in a fast-paced environment.

The Jr. Webmaster IT Intern should be able to work well in a team, collaborating with managers, designers, writers, etc. Ideal candidates should have some technical skills and a good understanding of creative online marketing.

This position requires a detail-oriented person eager to learn with the ability to follow clear instructions and an interest in computers, networking, and peripherals.

Day to Day Tasks Include:
Building and maintaining functional and easy-to-use WordPress websites
Responding to and troubleshooting website issues.
Testing websites across browsers, operating systems and devices
Maintaining, configuring and troubleshooting in-house webservers
Ensuring that the website is protected by enabling the appropriate security measures.
Working with IT Administrator to ensure site security by setting up firewalls and login pages
Identifying and responding to website security breaches.
Optimizing loading speeds and capacity
Debugging pages and fixing broken links or images
Working with Marketing Department to update website content, review SEO, monitor and analyze site performance (e.g. traffic, conversions)
Updating HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
Conducting content audits to eliminate redundant and/

Qualifications

Moderate knowledge of WordPress, HTML, XHTML, and CSS.
Desire to work with WordPress builders (Site Origin, Elementor, etc.), plugins, themes. and the WordPress code library.
Basic Linux and IT security experience.
Some experience with Access and MySQL is preferred.
Ability to program in CSS, PHP, HTML, Java/JavaScript is preferred.
Familiarity with programming languages and operating systems.
Desire to learn to use website management tools.
Knowledge of online marketing and fundamental understanding of Search Engine Optimization (SEO)
Eagerness to troubleshoot website issues.
Strong attention to detail with an analytical mind and good problem-solving skills.
Terrific time management skills with the ability to multi-task.
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
Must be naturally driven to produce high quality results with great care
Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word/Excel/Outlook/PowerPoint) is required.
Current college student studying Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Information Technology, Computer Networking, Information Sciences, Computer Programming, or related field.
Recent graduates with degrees in Computer Sciences or related fields may be eligible as well.

Additional Information

Other

Pay rate: $12 / hour
Consistent work schedule 20-40 hours/week
Term of internship 2-3 months
This position does not offer healthcare benefits
This position is open to local students only

Physical Demands and Abilities

Occasionally required to stand, walk, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl
Occasionally required to sit and climb or balance
Occasionally lift and/or move objects 10-50 lbs.

As a matter of company policy, we do not sponsor employment visas or hire from out of the USA nor do we sponsor candidates who do not currently reside within the USA without an existing H-1B visa.

Full Job Description
Mechanical Engineer Intern-TUC01066

Description

BOMBARDIER

At Bombardier, our employees work together to evolve mobility worldwide - one good idea at a time. If you have a good idea, we’ll provide the environment where it will thrive and grow into a great product or customer experience. Your ideas are our fuel.

With an average of over 300 sunny days per year, Bombardier Business Aircraft’s Tucson Service Center is surrounded by stunning mountain ranges and desert landscapes. Celebrating over 40 years of operations in Tucson, Arizona, the service center occupies almost 1 million sq ft of total hangar space and is the largest of Bombardier’s nine aircraft service centers. The facility services both Bombardier commercial and business aircraft. Since its inauguration in 1976, the facility has been located at Tucson International Airport, a strategic location and a key local partner. The 247,000 sq ft Business Aircraft facility is equipped to perform scheduled and unscheduled maintenance, modifications, including interior modifications, avionics installations, customized exterior paint, and Aircraft on Ground (AOG) support for Bombardier Learjet, Challenger and Global aircraft. The Service Center has received certifications from CAAC, FAA, EASA, Argentina (Military), Bermuda, Canada, Cayman Islands, Hong Kong, India, Mexico, Qatar and South Africa.

Bombardier has an exciting opportunity available for a Mechanical Engineer Intern based in Tucson, AZ.

In your role, you will:
  • Assist with interpreting customer specifications, vendor requirements, company/industry standards, FAA/DOT and foreign regulations
  • Assist with determining mechanical equipment, hardware, antenna and system requirements in all types of Bombardier aircraft
  • Assist with investigating design build issues and help develop structural engineering solutions
  • Release temporary engineering to resolve build issues in a timely manner
  • Assist in dispositioning aircraft non-conformances including rework instructions
  • Perform aircraft and engineering drawing investigation and coordination with affected engineering disciplines, Quality assurance and operations manufacturing representatives
  • Coordinate with vendors to resolve installation interface and reliability problems
  • Author engineering to define structural special instructions or restrictions
Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,

  • You are currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Aerospace, Mechanical or Computer Science Engineering
Please note: Relocation or housing assistance is not available for this position. No visa sponsorship is available for this position,

You will be designing and developing the software that will decide the optimal behavior of the autonomous vehicle such as planning future paths, stop-and-go decisions, and etc. Projects may include optimizing current path planning/control algorithms in terms of computational complexity, time constraints, program efficiency and solution correctness. Your work will be a core part of ThorDrive’s Autonomous Driving technology and you will be expected to meet professional expectations.

Currently pursuing a MS, or PhD degree in CS, EE, CE, automotive engineering, robotics or related fields

Understanding of data structures and algorithms
Experience with robotics middleware ROS (robot operating system)

Team player, good communication and collaboration skills
Preferred experiences
Algorithms (e.g. dijkstra, A*, D*, frenet-frame, RRT)
Hands-on experiences with autonomous vehicles or ground wheel robots
Experience with multi-threaded/multi-process programming
Basic understanding of communication protocols such as CAN
Notes
You will be tested in C++ for the coding assessment

description:
Full Job Description
Imagine New Horizons

As a Web Development intern, you will work to improve the online user assistance for both ENOVIA and other Dassault Systèmes products. Create an outstanding user experience to help Dassault Systèmes customers find the information they need to get their work done!

This paid 12 month internship is based at the Dassault Systèmes Waltham campus located at 175 Wyman St. Waltham MA, with some flexibility for a hybrid schedule mixing onsite and remote hours. You and your manager will work together to create a schedule around your coursework.

Do you have dreams? Do you enjoy a challenge? Here at Dassault Systèmes, we empower people with passion to change the world. Shape your career with 3DS! #WeAre3DS

What your role will be?

You will help to develop several major enhancements to our user assistance, including refining, testing, and implementing a full responsive redesign of our main help portals. You will collaborate with user assistance developers, user experience designers, web application developers, tools engineers, and possibly other interns located both in the US and at Dassault Systèmes headquarters in France. You will be mentored primarily by the ENOVIA User Assistance manager, and you might perform additional testing and production tasks for the ENOVIA User Assistance team as time allows.

The Challenges Ahead

Contribute to the responsive redesign of help.3ds.com, primarily working with HTML, CSS, and Javascript.
Contribute to the development of new mechanisms for collecting feedback from our users and for storing, analyzing, and distributing the resulting data
Contribute to work on new and visually engaging presentations of What’s New information, based on an existing prototype built using the PERN stack and other proposals from user experience teams
Assist as necessary with other web development and user assistance development tasks

Your Key Success Factors

Actively enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program in Computer Science, Web Development, or similar area of study for the duration of the internship
A minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0
Ability to work onsite at the Waltham, MA office location for the majority of your working hours
Highly-developed skills in core web technologies - HTML, CSS, JavaScript
Experience with modern front-end tools such as React and Express, and with databases such as PostgreSQL and MongoDB
Some experience with ASP.NET, Visual Studio, and SQL Server a definite plus as our existing web infrastructure uses these technologies
Excellent communication skills in English, both verbal and written
Highly organized and detail-oriented
Ability to work independently and within a collaborative team structure
Positive, self-motivated individual with a high level of enthusiasm and willingness to learn and incorporate coaching and instructions into daily tasks and assignments

Full Job Description
Who We Are

Okcoin is one of the world's largest and fastest growing cryptocurrency exchanges. We help millions of people buy and sell bitcoin, and over 20 other crypto assets every day — but our work is a whole lot more than that. We're building an inclusive future of finance, one that opens new opportunities to learn financial literacy, store value, and build wealth for everyone.

Ready to help the next billion people experience the future of finance with us? Come on board. We have offices in San Francisco, Malta, Hong Kong, Singapore, Japan, and Korea, but we believe in you working wherever you work best.

About the Team:
Localization team enables our products to be accessible in 15+ languages globally. At Okcoin, our mission is to "Take care of our team, promote and advance crypto globally, and empower every individual in the world". We have a small and agile team, working closely with cross- functional stakeholders and vendors to enable international language launches and continuous localization of all user-facing surfaces.

About the Opportunity:
The localization intern will work with other Localization Program Managers to coordinate project schedules, resources, status reports and deliverables within time, quality and cost parameters. You will also work with cross-functional teams to manage feedback and issues for our localization service provider(s), including but not limited to linguistic and functional queries, and keep language assets well maintained and updated. You are expected to work full-time during 2021 Summer holiday, with the possibility to extend if applicable.

What You'll Be Doing:
Execute on the localization schedule work with vendors to ensure that deliveries are completed correctly and on time
Collaborate upstream with Localization Program Managers on all aspects of new product/language launches
Managing queries from vendors, collaborating with relevant stakeholders to resolve questions or conflicts related to terminology and language quality.
Track and manage language related tickets internally
Maintain/update language related assets(terminologies) in translation management systems

What We Look For In You:
Bachelor's, or Master's degree, in CS, Localization, Language Studies, or International Studies
Working knowledge of industry standard localization t ools such as TMS, CAT, and CMS tools
Demonstrated knowledge of internationalization and localization standards, and localization testing best practices
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Nice to Haves:
1-2 years of prior localization project management experience
Proficiency in one or more languages in addition to English(Indonesian, Vietnamese, Mandarin, Spanish, Portuguese and Russian are preferred)
Strong attention to detail
Excellent organization and prioritization skills
Experience or knowledge of mobile app (iOS, Android)internationalization and localization projects
Action oriented, dedicated self-starter

Benefits for Students:
Get hands-on working experience and refine skills to prepare transition into a job
Explore career path opportunities
Receive financial compensation
Curriculum relevant practices can be considered as practicum for credits

Okcoin Statement: Okcoin is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, lawful alien status, national origin, age, marital status, and non-job related physical or mental disability, or protected veteran status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Full Job Description
Overview:
  • Only completed applications will be reviewed. Please scroll down and review the “Your Application Submission Must Include” section for how to apply and what to include.
FleishmanHillard’s St. Louis is seeking qualified candidates for full-time paid Creative intern positions. Interns are an integral part of our teams, giving participants real-life experience and skills that will help them succeed in their communications careers in the future.

FleishmanHillard believes a diverse team brings a wider range of personal and professional experiences and perspectives. We recognize that diversity and inclusion benefit our agency, our clients, and the communities in which we work and live. To that end, we strongly encourage applications from women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ community, veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

Deadlines for Fall submissions: July 1

The internship is a paid, full-time position requiring a commitment of at least five months (September 1, 2021 – January 14, 2022)

Responsibilities:
ART DIRECTORS / DESIGNERS

Our Art Direction/Design Interns work under the guidance of creative directors with their artistic prowess to fulfil the design needs of clients. Having an eye for aesthetic is vital for success on assigned projects. They show us how they create something from nothing, how they visually bring an idea to life, how their process unfolds, and the results.

The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
Completed or entering the final year of a 4-year graphic design or advertising degree or related program.
A portfolio demonstrating a strong sense of design and typography.
A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.
Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite.

COPYWRITERS

Our clients are in need of all types of writing: short form, long form, whatever the kind, it will be written. The Copywriter Intern should capture the voice of the client and tell their story the best way possible. They show us how to change someone’s mind with only words.

The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
Completed or entering the final year of a 4-year advertising degree or related program.
A portfolio filled with conceptual ideas and smart copy.
Proficient in Microsoft Office.
A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.

VIDEO EDITORS

Video Editor Interns work with directors and producers, being the tool that winds the story together, demonstrating the ability to jump from project to project, to find the shot that captures the moment, and to separate compelling content from filler.

The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
Completed final year of a 4-year film, video production, broadcast journalism or related degree program.
A reel and/or work samples demonstrating strong technical proficiency as well as creative and storytelling ability.
A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.
Proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro and related programs.
Proficiency with videography and photography also a plus.

DIGITAL DEVELOPERS

Digital Development Interns get immersed into all aspects of development. They will see projects from front-end to back-end, the creation phase to the testing phase. They find what will work for a program and all its quirks. They are a problem-solver who loves finding that missing piece of the puzzle. The quicker, the better.

The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
Completed a 4-year computer science or engineering degree
Ability to work in a fast-paced, demand driven environment.
Basic experience with HTML5, XML, Ajax, jQuery and JavaScript.
Strong communication skills, including proficiency in developing technical documentation
A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.

PROJECT MANAGERS

Project Management Interns work directly with creative directors, account teams, and clients to see campaigns develop from start to finish. They demonstrate leadership qualities but operate best working with others. This position teaches the intern how to manage several tasks at once, oversee projects, and value the importance of being a collaborative leader.

The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
Completed a 4-year business, marketing, or related degree program.
Ability to work under aggressive deadlines.
Strong leadership, management, communication and analytical skills.
A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.
Proficient in Microsoft Office.

Qualifications:
Qualified candidates will have at least a 3.2 GPA, previous relevant internship experience(s) and completed their junior year of college, though recent graduates are preferred. All candidates must also exhibit a desire and motivation to learn and the ability to work as part of a team.

Your Application Submission Must Include All of the Following:

Cover letter expressing interest in the internship program
Resume
Portfolio
Letter of recommendation from a former teacher, employer, supervisor, or personal reference (teacher or employer are preferred)
Transcript (can be unofficial)

About FleishmanHillard

FleishmanHillard is part of the Omnicom Public Relations Group, a division of Omnicom Group Inc., and has more than 85 offices in 30 countries, plus affiliates in 43 countries. Our award-winning agency specializes in public relations, reputation management, public affairs, research and analytics, brand marketing, digital strategy, social engagement and content strategy. We’ve been named PRWeek’s Global Agency of the Year and Best Places to Work; a “Standout Agency” on Advertising Age’s A-List; the Human Rights Campaign’s “ Best Places to Work for LGBTQ Equality”; and NAFE’s “Top 50 Companies for Executive Women” for a decade. We’re also more motivated by what we can give than what we receive, with a longstanding worldwide service commitment to support social inclusion in the communities in which we work and live. Visit us at www.fleishmanhillard.com

FleishmanHillard is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sex stereotyping, pregnancy (which includes pregnancy, childbirth, and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, mental or physical disability, ancestry, medical condition, marital status, military or veteran status, alienage, citizenship status, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other protected class under federal, state, or local laws.

Please do not contact the office directly to apply – only resumes submitted through this website will be considered. If you need assistance reviewing career opportunities or completing an application, please call 314-982-6283 or email our careers team.

Full Job Description

About Akuna:
Akuna Capital is a young and booming trading firm with a strong focus on collaboration, cutting-edge technology, data driven solutions and automation. We specialize in providing liquidity as an options market maker – meaning we are committed to providing competitive quotes that we are willing to both buy and sell. To do this successfully we design and implement our own low latency technologies, trading strategies and mathematical models.

Our Founding Partners, including Akuna's CEO Andrew Killion, first conceptualized Akuna in their hometown of Sydney. They opened the firm's first office in 2011 in the heart of the derivatives industry and the options capital of the world – Chicago. Today, Akuna is proud to operate from additional offices in Sydney, Shanghai, and Boston.

What you'll do as a Trading Intern:
We are seeking Trading Interns to join our dynamic team at Akuna Capital for our 10-week internship, Akunacademy, in our Chicago headquarters running from June - August. The ideal candidate will be a motivated individual with a desire to make an immediate impact at a growing firm. Akuna gives new traders the opportunity to learn from the most successful members of our Trading team and apply their knowledge quickly.

Our offices provide a positive atmosphere for learning and innovation. We're committed to providing valuable mentorship from our Senior Traders that will help you to learn quickly, find value from our internship program and make an immediate impact on the business. By the end of our program you'll be comfortable with both option theory and trade execution, which you will be able to demonstrate live on our trading desks!

Trading Interns are bright, math-savvy, competitive, ambitious, and have a strong desire to learn how to make markets in a rapidly growing trading firm. We'll teach you how to leverage our proprietary technology while implementing a variety of trading strategies and ideas so you can get on the trading screens and make an impact on the bottom line of the firm. If you are looking for an opportunity to start your career at an exciting firm, Akuna is the place for you!

Qualities that make great candidates:
Pursuing a BS/MS/ PhD in Engineering, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Actuarial Science or a related/equivalent field

Graduating between August 2022 - August 2024

Strong math aptitude, numerical and quantitative analysis skills

Effective communication and interpersonal skills

Entrepreneurial self-starter ready to work in a fast paced, competitive, team environment

Desire to understand and learn about financial markets and economic theories

Programming experience preferred

Detail oriented

Major GPA of 3.0 or above

Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required on the first day of employment including F-1 students using OPT, CPT, TN, or STEM

Job Type: Internship

Full Job Description

Relocation assistance will be considered/provided for this opportunity within our company guidelines.

Level: Intern

Requisition #65625

About the Company

Lincoln Financial Group, a Fortune 250 company with over 10,000 employees, provides advice and solutions that help empower Americans to take charge of their financial lives with confidence. Our core business areas — Life Insurance, Annuities, Retirement Plan Services and Group Protection — focus on supporting, preserving and enhancing over 17 million customer’s lifestyles and retirement outcomes.

Headquartered in Radnor, Pennsylvania, Lincoln Financial Group is the marketing name for Lincoln National Corporation (NYSE: LNC) and its affiliates. The company had $238 billion in assets under management as of December 31, 2018.

Ranked one of the Best Large Employers in America by Forbes magazine, Lincoln Financial Group makes a serious investment in our employees’ futures through a broad range of wealth accumulation and protection plans, health and wellness programs, and career development resources designed to help each individual reach their personal and professional goals.

General Purpose of Job

Our actuarial interns are a key part of our organization because they perform meaningful work in an environment that supports their learning within various business units of the company. #LI-AE1

Long Description

During the 11-week internship over the summer, our actuarial interns learn about our products while working in a variety of disciplines including financial reporting and planning, valuation, pricing and product development, and asset/liability management across lines of business including life insurance, annuities, group protection, and retirement services.

We offer actuarial internship positions in six locations:
Atlanta, GA Boston, MA Dover, NH
Fort Wayne, IN Hartford, CT Greensboro, NC Omaha, NE Radnor, PA

In addition, interns participate in a series with speakers from business leaders across the organization, as well as attend lunch and learn sessions focused on networking, execution, and agility in the workplace. Furthermore,
the interns enjoy a variety of social events with other interns and Actuarial Development Program participants. We offer both competitive pay and housing support.

Responsibilities:
Compile, categorize and audit data
Document and verify factors used in computations and actuarial models Run models and analyze output for consistency and reasonableness
Gain knowledge about company operations, systems, and actuarial methodologies Depending on area, develop rate filings, in-force files, and experience study results Depending on area, assist in the determination of premiums, benefits, and pricing levels

Requirements:
One or more SOA exams preferred GPA of 3.0 or higher
Pursuing undergraduate degree in Actuarial Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or other quantitative major is required.

position: Army CCDC-DAC Data Analysis, Management and Web Development Internship
description:
Full Job Description
Organization
U.S. Department of Defense (DOD)
Reference Code
CCDC-DAC-2021-0001
How to Apply

Description

The Combat Capabilities Development Command (CCDC) Data & Analysis Center (DAC) is offering a Post-Bachelors opportunity at Aberdeen Proving Ground in Aberdeen, Maryland.

What will I be doing?

You will apply mathematical, analytical and computer science principles to develop and improve capabilities for managing data to meet needs of the Data and Analysis Center.

Why should I apply?

Under the guidance of a mentor, you will gain hands-on experience to complement your education and support your academic and professional goals. Along the way, you will engage in activities and research in several areas. These include, but are not limited to:

data assessment
support software, database, and web tool/website development
support conduct of Schedule Risk and performance analyses through various functional areas
apply best practices for quality assurance and quality control
identify opportunities for improvement
support implementation of process improvement

Where will I be located?

Aberdeen Proving Ground, Maryland

What is the appointment length?

The tentative date start for this appointment is July 1, 2021. This date is flexible and is dependent upon the selection of a candidate and start date deemed feasible between the candidate and the mentor. This appointment is a twelve month research appointment, with the possibility to be renewed for additional research periods. Appointments may be extended depending on funding availability, project assignment, program rules, and availability of the participant.

What are the benefits?

You will receive a stipend to be determined by CCDC-DAC. Stipends are typically based on a participant’s academic standing, discipline, experience, and research facility location.

Other benefits may include the following:
Health Insurance Supplement (Participants are eligible to purchase health insurance through ORISE)
Relocation Allowance
Training and Travel Allowance

About CCDC-DAC

The Combat Capabilities Development Command (CCDC) Data & Analysis Center (DAC) is an Army Futures Command organization that conducts a variety of critical analyses to provide state-of-the-art analytical solutions to senior level Army and Department of Defense officials. The Data & Analysis Center's responsive systems analysis supports the "Equipping" and "Sustaining" of weapons and materiel for our Soldiers in the field as well as our Future Army Force. https://www.dac.ccdc.army.mil/home.html.

About ORISE

This program, administered by Oak Ridge Associated Universities (ORAU) through its contract with the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) to manage the Oak Ridge Institute for Science and Education (ORISE), was established through an interagency agreement between DOE and DoD. Participants do not enter into an employee/employer relationship with ORISE, ORAU, DoD or any other office or agency. Instead, you will be affiliated with ORISE for the administration of the appointment through the ORISE appointment letter and Terms of Appointment. Proof of health insurance is required for participation in this program. Health insurance can be obtained through ORISE. For more information, visit the ORISE Research Participation Program at the U.S. Department of Defense.

Qualifications

The qualified candidate will possess a Bachelor’s Degree in mathematics, engineering, statistics, physics, chemistry, computer science, or similar disciplines, with a GPA of 3.0 or higher. Degree must have been received within five years of the appointment start date. MediaWiki, and Microsoft applications experience preferred.

Application Requirements

A complete application consists of:
Zintellect Profile
Educational and Employment History
Essay Questions (goals, experiences, and skills relevant to the opportunity)
Resume (PDF)
Transcripts/Academic Records - For this opportunity, an unofficial transcript or copy of the student academic records printed by the applicant or by academic advisors from internal institution systems may be submitted.

If you have questions, send an email to ARMY@orise.orau.gov.

Eligibility Requirements
Citizenship: U.S. Citizen Only
Degree: Bachelor's Degree, Master's Degree, or Doctoral Degree received within the last 60 months or anticipated to be received by 6/30/2021 11:59:00 PM.
Overall GPA: 3.00

Discipline(s):
Communications and Graphics Design
Computer, Information, and Data Sciences
Earth and Geosciences
Engineering
Environmental and Marine Sciences
Life Health and Medical Sciences
Mathematics and Statistics
Nanotechnology
Other Non-S&E
Other Physical Sciences
Physics
Social and Behavioral Sciences

Full Job Description
Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in the Duck Creek Suite (Policy, Billing, Insights).
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.
Provide product support and maintenance for products in production.
Participate in developing documentation and job aid documents.

We are looking for candidates with…

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT and XPath.
Experience in with the C#, .NET programming language.
Experience with Angular frontend framework and JavaScript is preferred.
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

position: Development Internship - User Interface (C#, Web), Summer 2022
description:
Full Job Description

About Akuna:
Akuna Capital is a young and booming trading firm with a strong focus on cutting-edge technology, data driven decisions and automation. Our core competency is providing liquidity as an options market-maker – meaning we provide competitive quotes that we are willing to both buy and sell. To do this successfully we design and implement our own low latency technologies, trading strategies and mathematical models.

Our Founding Partners, including our global CEO Andrew Killion, first conceptualized Akuna in their hometown of Sydney. They opened the firm's first office in 2011 in the heart of the derivatives industry and the options capital of the world – Chicago. Today, Akuna is proud to operate from additional offices in Sydney, Shanghai, and Boston.

What you'll do as a Development Intern on the User Interface Team at Akuna:

We are seeking Development Interns to join our innovative and growing technology team at Akuna. In this role you will work directly with traders, quants, and other software developers to design, build, test, and maintain real-time data visualization tools. As a Development Intern on the UI Team, you'll be part of a knowledgeable, collaborative, and motivated engineering team made up of both C# and Web Developers.

C# Developers:
As a C# Development Intern, you'll learn to write high performance C# applications, help develop and fine tune our existing systems and work towards developing our next-gen UI solutions. The UI team uses C# to create multithreaded user interfaces which handle high volumes of data and provide traders with a real-time view of the markets. Performance is key and we're always looking for more efficient and innovative ways to view the markets.The applications you build will aid traders in understanding market conditions, assessing risk and managing other components in our system.

The ideal C# Development candidate would have experience using a C-style object-oriented programming language: C#, Java, and/or C++ .

Web Developers:
As a Web Developer, you'll write Python-powered back-ends and dynamic JavaScript front-ends. Using Javascript (React.js, Redux and more) and Python (with Tornado), you'll help improve our existing visualization tools and develop new and innovative ways of displaying key information to traders, providing them with real-time applications to assist them in making accurate decisions. The tools you build will also aid traders in managing volatility, assessing risk, and fine-tuning the parameters of our system.

The ideal Web Development candidate will have experience using a modern web programming language: Javascript, Python, and/or experience with HTML/CSS . Familiarity with REST interfaces, WebSockets / Server push, Linux, git, scrum etc. is also a plus.

Qualities that make great candidates for the UI team:
BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Physics or related field completed upon employment

Strong analytic and problem-solving skills

Familiarity with network and concurrent programming is a plus

An interest in user interface technologies and UX

Excellent communication skills and an ability to collaborate with the team to develop innovative solutions

Ability to adapt to an ever-changing environment

Knowledge of / willingness to learn about finance (derivatives, exchanges, market-making etc.)

Self-starter attitude with the ability to work independently

Major GPA of 3.0 or above

Must be graduating Summer 2023 or prior

Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required on the first day of employment including F-1 students using OPT or STEM

Please note: If you apply to multiple roles, you may be asked to complete multiple coding challenges and interviews.

Job Type: Internship

Full Job Description
Ramp is building the modern financial stack that enables companies to accelerate growth without compromising on their finances. We’re on a mission to uncover and eliminate waste before it undermines our customer’s goals. We make financial rigor easy by enabling real-time visibility and understanding of every dollar spent.

Ramp was founded by the same team who built, scaled, and sold Paribus to Capital One, enabling automated savings on online purchases and putting over $100 million back in consumers’ pockets every year. We are backed by Founders Fund, Coatue, and Box Group, as well as over 50 founders of leading companies.

About the Role

Ramp is, at its core, an engineering company, and is on a mission to build the best engineering team in NYC! We are looking for frontend and full stack engineering interns (12 weeks) who are excited to be part of our early story and help us build a diverse and vibrant tech community in the city. We hire engineers with a broad set of technical skills, who are highly cross-functional, and eager to solve a wide range of engineering challenges. Our ideal candidate has a strong sense of ownership and enjoys owning projects from inception to scaling it in production. We value people who take pride in their work, and show an aptitude for learning quickly whether they’re familiar with our stack or not. As an early employee, you'll be working with a nimble team of committed and talented engineers and having a large, long-term impact on technical design and engineering culture.

What You'll Do

Build performant, beautiful, and usable interfaces that solve for growing businesses with complex needs
Ship products and services in cross-functional teams
Work with sales and business teams to incorporate and productize customer feedback
Help establish engineering process, tools, and systems that will allow us to scale the code base, productivity, and the team

What You'll Need

Currently pursuing a B.S. (or higher) in Computer Science or a related technical field, with an expected graduation date in 2021 or 2022
Proficiency in Javascript, with a knack for getting the visuals right
Experience with one or more object-oriented programming languages
Track record of shipping high quality products and features or a portfolio of side projects
Ability to turn business and product ideas into engineering solutions
Desire to work in a fast-paced environment, continuously grow, and master your craft
Alignment with Ramp’s core values of enabling businesses to grow more by spending less

Nice to Haves

Proficiency in React v16+
Familiarity with or desire to learn our tech stack which includes, but not limited to: Flask (Python), Elixir, AWS, RabbitMQ, PostgreSQL
Passion for, or curiosity to learn, financial technology

About Our Teams

Card Engineering | Ramp’s Card Engineering team is responsible for shipping products with a singular focus on enhancing the finance team and cardholder experience. Current project areas include accounting, physical/virtual card management, mobile wallets, transactions, reimbursements, spend insights, and vendor/invoice management.
Risk Engineering | Ramp’s Risk Engineering team is pioneering how risk is evaluated and building the infrastructure to scale to millions of business in the United States. Current project areas include application processing, underwriting & KYC, risk data signals, risk limit & exposure management, bank linking, capital markets, fraud, and payments.

Learn more about our problem space and environment at our new engineering blog!

Ramp Benefits

Unlimited PTO
WFH stipend to support your home office needs
Monthly wellness stipend

Full Job Description

About Akuna:
Akuna Capital is an innovative trading firm with a strong focus on collaboration, cutting-edge technology, data driven solutions and automation. We specialize in providing liquidity as an options market maker – meaning we are committed to providing competitive quotes that we are willing to both buy and sell. To do this successfully we design and implement our own low latency technologies, trading strategies and mathematical models.

Our Founding Partners, including Akuna's CEO Andrew Killion, first conceptualized Akuna in their hometown of Sydney. They opened the firm's first office in 2011 in the heart of the derivatives industry and the options capital of the world – Chicago. Today, Akuna is proud to operate from additional offices in Sydney, Shanghai, and Boston.

Akuna Boston opened in the Fall of 2015 and is comprised of a small team of Quant Developers and Researchers. The Boston team focuses on discovering alpha signals through statistical analysis, strategy optimization, and building world-class data and research platforms, while closely collaborating with other quant and trading groups.

What you'll do as a Quantitative Development Intern on the Quant Trading & Research team at Akuna:

Akuna's Quantitative Trading and Research team is looking to add Quantitative Development Interns to a team of mathematicians, statisticians and technologists for our 10-week internship Akunacademy in our Boston office from June to August 2022. Our team creates trading strategies scientifically by combining its quantitative expertise with sophisticated understanding of derivatives and financial markets. The team is looking to add Quantitative Development Interns who will make a direct and measurable impact on our trading decisions and performance.

The successful candidate will have a strong programming background, familiarity with mathematical techniques and the fluency to leverage both skills to produce trading solutions and high-performance production code. In this role you will:

Design and develop production code of trading strategies: pricing models, execution logic and performance optimization along with researchers, traders and system engineers

Create innovative methods for extracting trading signals from complex market data

Advance existing codebase and propose new solutions and improvements

Requirements

Pursuing a BS/MS/PhD in a technical field – Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Physics (or related subject)

Strong Python programming background

Experience in object-oriented programming

Exposure to linear algebra and introductory statistics

Desire and ability to learn the intricacies of financial markets

Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required on the first day of employment including F-1 students using CPT, OPT or STEM

Must graduate by August 2023

Qualities that make great candidates:
Experience with generic and/or parallel programming

Deeper understanding of any of the following fields: Linear Algebra, Numerical Methods, Statistics, Optimization, Signal Processing, Computer Architecture, Machine Learning, Heterogeneous/High Performance computing

Exposure to financial markets and trading

** Candidates must be located near Boston, MA.

Job Type: Internship

position: Development Internship - Data Infrastructure Engineering, Summer 2022
description:
Full Job Description

About Akuna:
Akuna Capital is a young and booming trading firm with a strong focus on cutting-edge technology, data driven decisions and automation. Our core competency is providing liquidity as an options market maker – meaning we provide competitive quotes that we are willing to both buy and sell. To do this successfully we design and implement our own low latency technologies, trading strategies and mathematical models.

Our Founding Partners, including Akuna's CEO Andrew Killion, first conceptualized Akuna in their hometown of Sydney. They opened the firm's first office in 2011 in the heart of the derivatives industry and the options capital of the world – Chicago. Today, Akuna is proud to operate from additional offices in Sydney, Shanghai, and Boston.

What you'll do as a Development Intern on the Data Infrastructure Team at Akuna:

We are seeking Development Interns to join our innovative and growing technology team for our 10-week internship, Akunacademy, that will take place in our Chicago headquarters from June - August 2022. In this role you will work alongside our trading and software team to design and implement elegant solutions to complex and interesting problems.

Development Interns at Akuna have the opportunity to use cutting-edge technology while working on high performance/low latency systems. We offer a team-based approach to trading and software engineering, believing that productive integration of the two groups is vital for success in this industry. Akuna loves Development interns who are self-starters and are able to problem solve and think outside of the box. We value innovation and hard work and want you to make an impact in the firm. Whether you are interested in trading infrastructure, algorithms, exchange gateways, performance engineering, hardware, data capture and analysis, or front-end user interfaces, there's work to be done. If you are excited to jump in and make a difference, Akuna could be the place for you.

In this role you will:
Work closely with Developers, Quants, Traders and Support personnel to create and maintain datasets that play a key role in our business

Design and build Scala/Python applications that provide performant access to our data

Monitor and validate our data pipelines by building monitoring and analysis tools

Gain exposure to the financial markets and trading through the development and use of our datasets

Evaluate and select open source or proprietary tools required to meet our data requirements

Qualities that make great candidates:
Pursuing a Bachelors, Masters or PhD in technical field – Computer Science/Engineering, Math, Physics or equivalent

Graduating between September 2022 – August 2023

Demonstrated experience developing software on Linux using Java and/or Scala

Familiarity with Docker, Kubernetes, Kafka, Flink/Spark/Kafka-Streams, or cloud technologies is a plus

Ability to communicate complex technical topics in a clear and concise ways

Passionate, pragmatic problem solver able to independently pursue solutions to complex problems

Understanding of the core concepts of distributing computing, database design, and data storage

Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required on the first day of employment including F-1 students using CPT, OPT or STEM

Please note: If you have applied to multiple roles, you will be asked to complete multiple coding challenges and interviews.

Full Job Description
Â :
At UL, we know why we come to work.:
Thousands of us around the world wake up every day with a common purpose: to make the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place. Science is in our DNA; we are endlessly curious and passionate about seeking and speaking the truth. We take delight in knowing that our work makes a meaningful contribution to society, and we are proud that our culture is centered on integrity, collaboration, inclusion and excellence. UL stands at the forefront of technological advancement, and we are continually challenged to find new ways to foster innovation and positive change. Satisfying? Yes. Exciting? Absolutely!

kVA by UL is a dynamic and growing company with offices in Royal Oak, MI, Greenville, SC and Portland, OR. As a thought leader in the safety of automotive systems, kVA by UL’s mission is the safety of complex products. Our clients include six of the world's top ten automakers and five of the world's top ten automotive suppliers, as well as innovators in the fields of microprocessors, ASICs, autonomy software, and advanced sensing systems. kVA by UL’s Functional Safety engineering interns are highly employable after the internship, as the automotive industry seeks talent to build the next generation of safety-assured products.

What youâll learn & achieve::
kVA by UL is seeking two Functional Safety Engineering Interns to join our growing team in Royal Oak, MI. These employees will help to assure the safety of complex systems, in applications ranging from autonomous vehicles to multi-core microprocessors to electric vehicle powertrains. kVA by UL’s experts are sought after by automotive experts worldwide as they develop advanced safety-relevant systems. The engineering intern will work with kVA by UL’s technical staff and established clients to develop verified safe products, using leading-edge technologies and the best available safety approaches.

What makes you a great fit::
Partial completion of a four-year degree in electrical engineering, systems engineering, computer science, or a closely related field required.
Masters and PhD students are strongly encouraged to apply.
Strong interest in automotive technologies, and/or advanced microprocessor or software technologies for automotive application.
Experience in engineering software and tools for embedded control environments, such as Matlab, Simulink, dSpace, LabView, CANape, HIL/SIL test environments, and related toolsets.
High self-motivation, responsibility, and flexibility are required.

What youâll experience working at UL::
Mission: For UL, corporate and social responsibility isn’t new. Making the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place has been our business model for the last 125 years and is deeply engrained in everything we do.
People: Ask any UL employee what they love most about working here, and you’ll almost always hear, “the people.” Going beyond what is possible is the standard at UL. We’re able to deliver the best because we employ the best.
Interesting work: Every day is different for us here as we eagerly anticipate the next innovation that our customers’ create. We’re inspired to take on the challenge that will transform how people live, work and play. And as a global company, in many roles, you will get international experience working with colleagues around the world.

Learn More::
Working at UL is an exciting journey that twists and turns daily. We thrive in the twists and revel in the turns. This is our every day. This is our normal.

Curious? To learn more about us and the work we do, visit UL.com

description:
Full Job Description

About Akuna:
Akuna Capital is an innovative trading firm with a strong focus on collaboration, cutting-edge technology, data driven solutions and automation. We specialize in providing liquidity as an options market maker – meaning we are committed to providing competitive quotes that we are willing to both buy and sell. To do this successfully we design and implement our own low latency technologies, trading strategies and mathematical models.

Our Founding Partners, including Akuna's CEO Andrew Killion, first conceptualized Akuna in their hometown of Sydney. They opened the firm's first office in 2011 in the heart of the derivatives industry and the options capital of the world – Chicago. Today, Akuna is proud to operate from additional offices in Sydney, Shanghai, and Boston.

What you'll do as a Quantitative Trading Intern at Akuna:
We are seeking motivated Quantitative Trading Interns to join our dynamic team at Akuna Capital for our 10-week internship Akunacademy in our Chicago office. Quant Trading Interns will work with our strong team of Quant Developers and Quant Traders on part of our automated options trading desk. You're a fit for this role if you have enthusiasm for problem solving, financial mathematics, and will bring strong initiatives in generating trading ideas to developing and testing strategies. In this role you will:

Write and optimize data analysis code and calculation intensive models

Develop quantitative models, back-test, and implement trading strategies in Python (C++ is a plus)

A strong interest in finance and learning to develop trading strategies is a plus

Provide Python mentoring to team members and Traders

Strong math aptitude, numerical and quantitative analysis skills

Entrepreneurial self-starter ready to work in a fast paced, competitive, team environment

Passionate about problem-solving and finding creative solutions in an ever changing market

Qualities that make great candidates:
Pursuing a Bachelors, Masters, or Ph.D. in technical field – Engineering, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Actuarial Science or a related/equivalent field

Python programming experience required

Entrepreneurial self-starter, ready to work in a fast paced, team environment

Understanding of option theory

Demonstrated experience with research or data analysis projects, either a personal or school project

Passionate about problem-solving and finding creative solutions in an ever changing market

Graduation date of August 2023 or prior

Major GPA of 3.0 or above

Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required on the first day of employment including F-1 students using CPT, OPT or STEM

Job Type: Internship

Full Job Description
Imagine New Horizons

As a Web Development intern, you will work to improve the online user assistance for both SOLIDWORKS and other Dassault Systèmes products. Create an outstanding user experience to help Dassault Systèmes customers find the information they need to get their work done!

This paid, 12 month internship is based at the Dassault Systèmes Americas Headquarters located on 175 Wyman St. in Waltham, MA. You and your manager will create a flexible schedule to accomodate your university coursework.

Do you have dreams? Do you enjoy a challenge? Here at Dassault Systèmes, we empower people with passion to change the world. Shape your career with 3DS! #WeAre3DS

What your role will be?

You will help to develop several major enhancements to our user assistance, including refining, testing, and implementing a full responsive redesign of our main help portals. You will collaborate with user assistance developers, user experience designers, web application developers, tools engineers, and possibly other interns located both in the US and at Dassault Systèmes headquarters in France. You will be mentored primarily by the SOLIDWORKS User Assistance manager, and you might perform additional testing and production tasks for the SOLIDWORKS User Assistance team as time allows.

The Challenges Ahead

Contribute to the responsive redesign of help.solidworks.com and help.3ds.com, primarily working with HTML, CSS, and Javascript.
Contribute to the development of new mechanisms for collecting feedback from our users and for storing, analyzing, and distributing the resulting data
Contribute to work on new and visually engaging presentations of What’s New information, based on an existing SOLIDWORKS prototype built using the PERN stack and other proposals from user experience teams
Assist as necessary with other web development and user assistance development tasks

Your Key Success Factors

Actively enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program in Computer Science, Web Development, or similar area of study for the duration of the internship
A minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0
Ability to work onsite at the Waltham, MA office location
Highly-developed skills in core web technologies - HTML, CSS, JavaScript
Experience with modern front-end tools such as React and Express, and with databases such as PostgreSQL and MongoDB
Some experience with ASP.NET, Visual Studio, and SQL Server a definite plus as our existing web infrastructure uses these technologies
Excellent communication skills in English, both verbal and written
Highly organized and detail-oriented
Ability to work independently and within a collaborative team structure
Positive, self-motivated individual with a high level of enthusiasm and willingness to learn and incorporate coaching and instructions into daily tasks and assignments
Knowledge of CAD and mechanical engineering concepts, or any experience using SOLIDWORKS or competitor CAD products, is a plus

position: SAP Ariba iXp Intern - Full Stack Developer
description:
Full Job Description
Requisition ID: 276489
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program:
The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, paid internship program that provides university students with the opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:
1. Culture of collaboration: Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
2. Project-driven experience: Gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
3. Gain visibility: With SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team:
The Supply Chain Collaboration team is one of the fastest growing teams within the SAP Business Network, the largest business-to-business network in the world with over 3.6 million connected companies in over 190 countries. Our solution enables customers to manage and run an efficient supply chain and helps them collaborate with direct materials suppliers through innovative planning and execution processes. We are looking for bright engineers who are passionate about solving complex business problems with purposeful and beautiful software and have fun while doing it.

What you’ll do:
Position Title: SAP Ariba iXp Intern – Full Stack Developer
Location: Palo Alto, CA
Expected start date to end date: June 2021 – August 2021

In this role, you’ll:
  • Have the unique opportunity to work on innovation/prototyping projects that will enhance the Supply Chain Collaboration offering
  • Design and develop pixel-perfect UI, robust APIs, and scalable microservices for the cloud
  • Gain insight in how enterprise customers manage and run their supply chain on the SAP Business Network
Who you are:
We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stays curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

  • Candidates must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate degree program in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent
  • Strong desire to revolutionize the enterprise application space by building beautiful and purposeful cloud solutions for business users
  • Strong programming skills in Java, JavaScript, SQL, CSS
  • Strong analytical and communication skills, ability to articulate technical challenges and solutions clearly
  • Thrive in a fast-paced environment working with multiple teams across various geographies
  • Preferred experience: familiarity with Angular, Microservices (Springboot), Kafka, JIRA, IntelliJ IDEA, JMeter, Jenkins, Github
WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Additional Locations: Virtual - USA

Full Job Description
Imagine New Horizons…

SOLIDWORKS Digital Transformation is responsible for the research and application of new technology, automation, machine learning and analysis capabilities to processes, customer engagement and support with the aim to improve efficiency, enhance customer value and uncover new opportunities.

As a intern within the Digital Transformation team, you will work on innovative analytics and platforms across the Dassault Systèmes SOLIDWORKS services organization, including technical support, customer service, training and certification.

This is a paid, 6 month internship with a flexible start in 2021. Your will work with your manager to tailor your work schedule around your academic schedule. This role is based in the Dassault Systèmes SOLIDWORKS Corp. offices located om 175 Wyman Street, Waltham, MA.

Do you have dreams? Do you enjoy a challenge? Here at Dassault Systèmes, we empower people with passion to change the world.

Shape your career with3DS! #WeAre3DS

What will your role be?

You will be exposed to customized business intelligence dashboards on the revolutionary 3DEXPERIENCE Platform while investigating predictive models and algorithms for our clients and partners. Natural language processing and predictive machine learning will be a significant part of the role, so experience, interest and knowledge in these areas is beneficial.

Example activities include, but are not limited to:
Natural Language Processing Guided Submission: Develop and enhance Natural Language Processing models for a range of applications, such as guided issue submission.

Data Dimensioning and Categorization: Improve the quality of the services data by categorization, analysis and feature engineering. Allowing data to be more useful for machine learning.

Dashboard & Analytics: Assist in the creation of interactive dashboards, joining multiple data sources to create actionable business insights.

Your Challenge ahead

You will be charged with enhancing, further developing and deploying natural language processing models and machine learning. Specifically with the intention to help our valuable partners and clients submit fully qualified technical queries, find solutions automatically, reduce support turnaround time and increase customer satisfaction.

Your key success factors

Actively enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science , Data Science or equivalent for the duration of the internship
Minimum cumulative GPA 3.0 /4.0 scale
Ability to work onsite in the Waltham, MA office
Demonstrate knowledge of Machine Learning and Models in particular Natural Language Processing (NLP)
Python (Jupyter notebook, Anaconda, MATLAB etc.)
Data pre-processing, enrichment and analysis processes.
Well-developed communication skills in English, both oral and written
Displays enthusiasm, curiosity and the ability to work autonomously or within teams

Job Description:
About Ribbon (Nasdaq: RBBN)

We deliver global real-time communications software and network solutions to service providers, enterprises, and critical infrastructure sectors. We engage deeply with our customers, helping them modernize their networks for improved competitive positioning and business outcomes in today’s smart, always-on and data-hungry world. Our innovative, end-to-end solutions portfolio delivers unparalleled scale, performance, agility and automation and includes optical and packet networking, core to edge IP solutions, UCaaS/ CPaaS cloud offers, and leading-edge software security and analytics tools.

To learn more, visit rbbn.com

  • Excellent organizational skills.

About the role:
Carimus is looking for an innovative and ambitious college student to join our development team. We are looking for a Product Intern to work on our Product teams. This is an exciting opportunity to help the teamwork on internal products, including GoodBookey and JouleBug. The intern will use their programming and problem-solving skills to assist in the development of these apps. The ideal intern will be excited to work with a variety of technologies and is familiar with a variety of operating systems and platforms. If you are a talented engineering student looking for an opportunity to grow your coding experience this is the role for you.

We are looking for someone that has the capacity to work 20 hours per week.

Responsibilities:
Assist in the creation of scalable software platforms and applications that are unit tested, code reviewed and checked regularly for continuous integration

Gather user requirements, define system functionality and write code in various languages, like javascript, PHP and Sacal using libraries such as React.js, Laravel and Play

Give and receive feedback for assigned projects

Understand client requirements and how they translate into application features

Define Quarterly / Monthly Objectives with Direct Manager

Qualifications:
Required:
Currently enrolled in an undergraduate program in Computer Science, Engineering, or Information Technology

Experience with front end development in React and JavaScript

Interest in writing real code and seeing it in production

Interest in learning new technologies and developing new skills

Dedicated to customer service and making a difference for our customers

Excellent technical and communication abilities

Ability to be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and enjoys working on multiple projects concurrently

Nice to have:
Knowledge or experience with Laravel or other similar MVC frameworks

Experience with OOP or functional programming

Experience with either Android or iOS native development

Knowledge or experience with Git

Knowledge or experience with relational databases such as MySQL or PostgreSQL and non-relational databases

Full Job Description
Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in Duck Creek Suite Distribution Management and integrations with other applications
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.
Provide product support and maintenance for products in production.
Participate in developing documentation and job aid documents.

We are looking for candidates with…

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT, XPath and JSON.
Experience in development with the Java programming language and an Integrated Development Environment (i.e. Eclipse).
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures.
Experience with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) is preferred.
Experience with Azure or AWS hosted Cloud environments and Web Services is preferred.
Experience with a version control management system (i.e. Git) is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

General:
MedPro Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
